ye shall say, thy servants' trade hath cattle youth even now, we, [and] also fathers: ye may dwell land goshen; every shepherd [is] abomination unto egyptians. joseph came told pharaoh, said, father brethren, flocks, herds, have, come land canaan; and, behold, [are] land goshen. took brethren, [even] five men, presented unto pharaoh. pharaoh said unto brethren, [is] occupation? said unto pharaoh, thy servants [are] shepherds, we, [and] also fathers. said moreover unto pharaoh, sojourn land come; thy servants pasture flocks; famine [is] sore land canaan: therefore, pray thee, let thy servants dwell land goshen. pharaoh spake unto joseph, saying, thy father thy brethren come unto thee: land egypt [is] thee; best land make thy father brethren dwell; land goshen let dwell: thou knowest [any] men activity among them, make rulers cattle. joseph brought jacob father, set pharaoh: jacob blessed pharaoh. pharaoh said unto jacob, old [art] thou? jacob said unto pharaoh, days years pilgrimage [are] hundred thirty years: evil days years life been, attained unto days years life fathers days pilgrimage. jacob blessed pharaoh, went pharaoh. joseph placed father brethren, gave possession land egypt, best land, land rameses, pharaoh commanded. joseph nourished father, brethren, father's household, bread, according [their] families. [there was] bread land; famine [was] sore, land egypt [all] land canaan fainted reason famine. joseph gathered money found land egypt, land canaan, corn bought: joseph brought money pharaoh's house. money failed land egypt, land canaan, egyptians came unto joseph, said, give us bread: die thy presence? money faileth. joseph said, give cattle; give cattle, money fail. brought cattle unto joseph: joseph gave bread [in exchange]genesis page 28 horses, flocks, cattle herds, asses: fed bread cattle year. year ended, came unto second year, said unto him, hide [it] lord, money spent; lord also hath herds cattle; ought left sight lord, bodies, lands: wherefore shall die thine eyes, land? buy us land bread, land servants unto pharaoh: give [us] seed, may live, die, land desolate. joseph bought land egypt pharaoh; egyptians sold every man field, famine prevailed them: land became pharaoh's. people, removed cities [one] end borders egypt even [other] end thereof. land priests bought not; priests portion [assigned them] pharaoh, eat portion pharaoh gave them: wherefore sold lands. joseph said unto people, behold, bought day land pharaoh: lo, [here is] seed you, ye shall sow land. shall come pass increase, ye shall give fifth [part] unto pharaoh, four parts shall own, seed field, food, households, food little ones. said, thou hast saved lives: let us find grace sight lord, pharaoh's servants. joseph made law land egypt unto day, [that] pharaoh fifth [part;] except land priests only, [which] became pharaoh's. israel dwelt land egypt, country goshen; possessions therein, grew, multiplied exceedingly. jacob lived land egypt seventeen years: whole age jacob hundred forty seven years. time drew nigh israel must die: called son joseph, said unto him, found grace thy sight, put, pray thee, thy hand thigh, deal kindly truly me; bury not, pray thee, egypt: lie fathers, thou shalt carry egypt, bury buryingplace. said, thou hast said. said, swear unto me. sware unto him. israel bowed upon bed's head. came pass things, [one] told joseph, behold, thy father [is] sick: took two sons, manasseh ephraim. [one] told jacob, said, behold, thy son joseph cometh unto thee: israel strengthened himself, sat upon bed. jacob said unto joseph, god almighty appeared unto luz land canaan, blessed me, said unto me, behold, make thee fruitful, multiply thee, make thee multitude people; give land thy seed thee [for] everlasting possession. thy two sons, ephraim manasseh, born unto thee land egypt came unto thee egypt, [are] mine; reuben simeon, shall mine. thy issue, thou begettest them, shall thine, [and] shall called name brethren inheritance. me, came padan, rachel died land canaan way, yet [there was] little way come unto ephrath: iburied way ephrath; bethlehem. israel beheld joseph's sons, said, [are] these? joseph said unto father, [are] sons, god hath given [place.] said, bring them, pray thee, unto me, bless them. eyes israel dim age, [so that] could see. brought near unto him; kissed them, embraced them. israel said unto joseph, thought see thy face: and, lo, god hath shewed also thy seed. joseph brought knees, bowed face earth. joseph took both, ephraim right hand toward israel's left hand, manasseh left hand toward israel's right hand, brought [them] near unto him. israel stretched right hand, laid upon ephraim's head, [was] younger, left hand upon manasseh's head, guiding hands wittingly; manasseh [was] firstborn. blessed joseph, said, god, fathers abraham isaac walk, god fed life long unto day, angel redeemed evil, bless lads; let name named them, name fathers abraham isaac; let grow multitude midst earth. joseph saw father laid right hand upon head ephraim, displeased him: held father's hand, remove ephraim's head unto manasseh's head. joseph said unto father, so, father: [is] firstborn; put thy right hand upon head. father refused, said, know [it,] son, know [it:] also shall become people, also shall great: truly younger brother shall greater he, seed shall become multitude nations. blessed day, saying, thee shall israel bless, saying, god make thee ephraim manasseh: set ephraim manasseh. israel said unto joseph, behold, die: god shall you, bring unto land fathers. moreover given thee one portion thy brethren, took hand amorite sword bow. jacob called unto sons, said, gather together, may tell [that] shall befall last days. gather together, hear, ye sons jacob; thy father's children shall bow thee. judah [is] lion's whelp: prey, son, thou art gone up:page 29 genesis stooped down, couched lion, old lion; shall rouse up? sceptre shall depart judah, lawgiver feet, shiloh come; [whose] branches run wall: archers sorely grieved him, shot [at him,] hated him: bow abode strength, arms hands made strong hands mighty [god] jacob; (from thence [is] shepherd, stone israel:) [even] god thy father, shall help thee; unto thee evil: now, pray thee, forgive trespass servants god thy father. joseph wept spake unto him. brethren also went fell face; said, behold, [be] thy servants. joseph said unto them, fear not: [am] place god? you, ye thought evil me; [but] god meant unto good, bring pass, [it is] day, save much people alive. therefore fear ye not: nourish you, little ones. comforted them, spake kindly unto them. joseph dwelt egypt, he, father's house: joseph lived hundred ten years. joseph saw ephraim's children third [generation:] children also machir son manasseh brought upon joseph's knees. joseph said unto brethren, die: god surely visit you, bring land unto land swaregenesis page 30 abraham, isaac, jacob. joseph took oath children israel, saying, god surely visit you, ye shall carry bones hence. joseph died, [being] hundred ten years old: embalmed him, put coffin egypt.page 31 exodus second book moses, called exodus [are] names children israel, came egypt; every man household came jacob. issachar, zebulun, benjamin, dan, naphtali, gad, asher. souls came loins jacob seventy souls: joseph egypt [already. ] joseph died, brethren, generation. children israel fruitful, increased abundantly, multiplied, waxed exceeding mighty; land filled them. arose new king egypt, knew joseph. said unto people, behold, people children israel [are] mightier we: come on, let us deal wisely them; lest multiply, come pass, that, falleth war, join also unto enemies, fight us, [so] get land. therefore set taskmasters afflict burdens. built pharaoh treasure cities, pithom raamses. afflicted them, multiplied grew. grieved children israel. egyptians made children israel serve rigour: made lives bitter hard bondage, morter, brick, manner service field: service, wherein made serve, [was] rigour. king egypt spake hebrew midwives, name one [was] shiphrah, name puah: said, ye office midwife hebrew women, see [them] upon stools; [be] son, ye shall kill him: [be] daughter, shall live. midwives feared god, king egypt commanded them, saved men children alive. king egypt called midwives, said unto them, ye done thing, saved men children alive? midwives said unto pharaoh, hebrew women [are] egyptian women; [are] lively, delivered ere midwives come unto them. therefore god dealt well midwives: people multiplied, waxed mighty. came pass, midwives feared god, made houses. pharaoh charged people, saying, every son born ye shall cast river, every daughter ye shall save alive. went man house levi, took [to wife] daughter levi. woman conceived, bare son: saw [was a] goodly [child,] hid three months. could longer hide him, took ark bulrushes, daubed slime pitch, put child therein; laid [it] flags river's brink. sister stood afar off, wit would done him. daughter pharaoh came wash [herself] river; maidens walked along river's side; saw ark among flags, sent maid fetch it. opened [it,] saw child: and, behold, babe wept. shehad compassion him, said, [is one] hebrews' children. said sister pharaoh's daughter, shall go call thee nurse hebrew women, may nurse child thee? pharaoh's daughter said her, go. maid went called child's mother. pharaoh's daughter said unto her, take child away, nurse me, give [thee] thy wages. woman took child, nursed it. child grew, brought unto pharaoh's daughter, became son. called name moses: said, drew water. came pass days, moses grown, went unto brethren, looked burdens: spied egyptian smiting hebrew, one brethren. looked way way, saw [there was] man, slew egyptian, hid sand. went second day, behold, two men hebrews strove together: said wrong, wherefore smitest thou thy fellow? said, made thee prince judge us? intendest thou kill me, thou killedst egyptian? moses feared, said, surely thing known. pharaoh heard thing, sought slay moses. moses fled face pharaoh, dwelt land midian: sat well. priest midian seven daughters: came drew [water,] filled troughs water father's flock. shepherds came drove away: moses stood helped them, watered flock. came reuel father, said, [is that] ye come soon day? said, egyptian delivered us hand shepherds, also drew [water] enough us, watered flock. said unto daughters, [is] he? [is] [that] ye left man? call him, may eat bread. moses content dwell man: gave moses zipporah daughter. bare [him] son, called name gershom: said, stranger strange land. came pass process time, king egypt died: children israel sighed reason bondage, cried, cry came unto god reason bondage. god heard groaning, god remembered covenant abraham, isaac, jacob. god looked upon children israel, god respect unto [them. ] moses kept flock jethro father law, priest midian: led flock backside desert, came mountain god, [even] horeb. angel lord appeared unto flame fire midst bush: looked, and, behold, bush burned fire, bush [was] consumed. moses said, turn aside, see great sight, bush burnt. lord saw turned aside see, god called unto midst bush, said, moses, moses. said, [am] i. said, draw nigh hither: put thy shoes thy feet, place whereon thou standest holy ground. moreover said, [am] god thy father, god abraham, god isaac, god jacob. moses hid face; afraid lookexodus page 32 upon god. lord said, surely seen affliction people [are] egypt, heard cry reason taskmasters; know sorrows; come deliver hand egyptians, bring land unto good land large, unto land flowing milk honey; unto place canaanites, hittites, amorites, perizzites, hivites, jebusites. therefore, behold, cry children israel come unto me: also seen oppression wherewith egyptians oppress them. come therefore, send thee unto pharaoh, thou mayest bring forth people children israel egypt. moses said unto god, [am] i, go unto pharaoh, bring forth children israel egypt? said, certainly thee; [shall be] token unto thee, sent thee: thou hast brought forth people egypt, ye shall serve god upon mountain. moses said unto god, behold, [when] come unto children israel, shall say unto them, god fathers hath sent unto you; shall say me, name? shall say unto them? god said unto moses, am: said, thus shalt thou say unto children israel, hath sent unto you. god said moreover unto moses, thus shalt thou say unto children israel, lord god fathers, god abraham, god isaac, god jacob, hath sent unto you: [is] name ever, [is] memorial unto generations. go, gather elders israel together, say unto them, lord god fathers, god abraham, isaac, jacob, appeared unto me, saying, surely visited you, [seen] done egypt: said, bring affliction egypt unto land canaanites, hittites, amorites, perizzites, hivites, jebusites, unto land flowing milk honey. shall hearken thy voice: thou shalt come, thou elders israel, unto king egypt, ye shall say unto him, lord god hebrews hath met us: let us go, beseech thee, three days' journey wilderness, may sacrifice lord god. sure king egypt let go, no, mighty hand. stretch hand, smite egypt wonders midst thereof: let go. give people favour sight egyptians: shall come pass, that, ye go, ye shall go empty: every woman shall borrow neighbour, sojourneth house, jewels silver, jewels gold, raiment: ye shall put [them] upon sons, upon daughters; ye shall spoil egyptians. moses answered said, but, behold, believe me, hearken unto voice: say, lord hath appeared unto thee. lord said unto him, [is] thine hand? said, rod. said, cast ground. cast ground, became serpent; moses fled it. lord said untomoses, put forth thine hand, take tail. put forth hand, caught it, became rod hand: may believe lord god fathers, god abraham, god isaac, god jacob, hath appeared unto thee. lord said furthermore unto him, put thine hand thy bosom. put hand bosom: took out, behold, hand [was] leprous snow. said, put thine hand thy bosom again. put hand bosom again; plucked bosom, and, behold, turned [other] flesh. shall come pass, believe thee, neither hearken voice first sign, believe voice latter sign. shall come pass, believe also two signs, neither hearken unto thy voice, thou shalt take water river, pour [it] upon dry [land:] water thou takest river shall become blood upon dry [land. ] moses said unto lord, lord, [am] eloquent, neither heretofore, since thou hast spoken unto thy servant: [am] slow speech, slow tongue. lord said unto him, hath made man's mouth? maketh dumb, deaf, seeing, blind? lord? therefore go, thy mouth, teach thee thou shalt say. said, lord, send, pray thee, hand [of whom] thou wilt send. anger lord kindled moses, said, [is] aaron levite thy brother? know speak well. also, behold, cometh forth meet thee: seeth thee, glad heart. thou shalt speak unto him, put words mouth: thy mouth, mouth, teach ye shall do. shall thy spokesman unto people: shall be, [even] shall thee instead mouth, thou shalt instead god. thou shalt take rod thine hand, wherewith thou shalt signs. moses went returned jethro father law, said unto him, let go, pray thee, return unto brethren [are] egypt, see whether yet alive. jethro said moses, go peace. lord said unto moses midian, go, return egypt: men dead sought thy life. moses took wife sons, set upon ass, returned land egypt: moses took rod god hand. lord said unto moses, thou goest return egypt, see thou wonders pharaoh, put thine hand: harden heart, shall let people go. thou shalt say unto pharaoh, thus saith lord, israel [is] son, [even] firstborn: say unto thee, let son go, may serve me: thou refuse let go, behold, slay thy son, [even] thy firstborn. came pass way inn, lord met him, sought kill him. zipporah took sharp stone, cut foreskin son, cast [it] feet, said, surely bloody husband [art] thou me. let go: said, bloody husband [thou art,] circumcision.page 33 exodus lord said aaron, go wilderness meet moses. went, met mount god, kissed him. moses told aaron words lord sent him, signs commanded him. moses aaron went gathered together elders children israel: aaron spake words lord spoken unto moses, signs sight people. people believed: heard lord visited children israel, looked upon affliction, bowed heads worshipped. afterward moses aaron went in, told pharaoh, thus saith lord god israel, let people go, may hold feast unto wilderness. pharaoh said, [is] lord, obey voice let israel go? know lord, neither let israel go. said, god hebrews hath met us: let us go, pray thee, three days' journey desert, sacrifice unto lord god; lest fall upon us pestilence, sword. king egypt said unto them, wherefore ye, moses aaron, let people works? get unto burdens. pharaoh said, behold, people land [are] many, ye make rest burdens. pharaoh commanded day taskmasters people, officers, saying, ye shall give people straw make brick, heretofore: let go gather straw themselves. tale bricks, make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall diminish [ought] thereof: [be] idle; therefore cry, saying, let us go [and] sacrifice god. let work laid upon men, may labour therein; let regard vain words. taskmasters people went out, officers, spake people, saying, thus saith pharaoh, give straw. go ye, get straw ye find it: yet ought work shall diminished. people scattered abroad throughout land egypt gather stubble instead straw. taskmasters hasted [them,] saying, fulfil works, [your] daily tasks, straw. officers children israel, pharaoh's taskmasters set them, beaten, [and] demanded, wherefore ye fulfilled task making brick yesterday day, heretofore? officers children israel came cried unto pharaoh, saying, wherefore dealest thou thus thy servants? straw given unto thy servants, say us, make brick: and, behold, thy servants [are] beaten; fault [is] thine people. said, ye [are] idle, [ye are] idle: therefore ye say, let us go [and] sacrifice lord. go therefore now, [and] work; shall straw given you, yet shall ye deliver tale bricks. officers children israel see [that] [were] evil [case,] said, ye shall minish [ought] bricks daily task. met moses aaron, stood way, came forth pharaoh: theysaid unto them, lord look upon you, judge; ye made savour abhorred eyes pharaoh, eyes servants, put sword hand slay us. moses returned unto lord, said, lord, wherefore hast thou [so] evil entreated people? [is] [that] thou hast sent me? since came pharaoh speak thy name, hath done evil people; neither hast thou delivered thy people all. lord said unto moses, shalt thou see pharaoh: strong hand shall let go, strong hand shall drive land. god spake unto moses, said unto him, [am] lord: appeared unto abraham, unto isaac, unto jacob, [the name of] god almighty, name jehovah known them. also established covenant them, give land canaan, land pilgrimage, wherein strangers. also heard groaning children israel, egyptians keep bondage; remembered covenant. wherefore say unto children israel, [am] lord, bring burdens egyptians, rid bondage, redeem stretched arm, great judgments: take people, god: ye shall know [am] lord god, bringeth burdens egyptians. bring unto land, concerning swear give abraham, isaac, jacob; give heritage: [am] lord. moses spake unto children israel: hearkened unto moses anguish spirit, cruel bondage. lord spake unto moses, saying, go in, speak unto pharaoh king egypt, let children israel go land. moses spake lord, saying, behold, children israel hearkened unto me; shall pharaoh hear me, [am] uncircumcised lips? lord spake unto moses unto aaron, gave charge unto children israel, unto pharaoh king egypt, bring children israel land egypt. [are] names sons levi according generations; gershon, kohath, merari: years life levi [were] hundred thirty seven years. sons gershon; libni, shimi, according families. sons kohath; amram, izhar, hebron, uzziel: years life kohath [were] hundred thirty three years. sons merari; mahali mushi: [are] families levi according generations. amram took jochebed father's sister wife; bare aaron moses: years life amram [were] hundred thirty seven years. sons izhar; korah, nepheg,exodus page 34 zichri. sons uzziel; mishael, elzaphan, zithri. aaron took elisheba, daughter amminadab, sister naashon, wife; bare nadab, abihu, eleazar, ithamar. sons korah; assir, elkanah, abiasaph: [are] families korhites. eleazar aaron's son took [one] daughters putiel wife; bare phinehas: [are] heads fathers levites according families. [are] aaron moses, lord said, bring children israel land egypt according armies. [are] spake pharaoh king egypt, bring children israel egypt: [are] moses aaron. came pass day [when] lord spake unto moses land egypt, lord spake unto moses, saying, [am] lord: speak thou unto pharaoh king egypt say unto thee. moses said lord, behold, [am] uncircumcised lips, shall pharaoh hearken unto me? lord said unto moses, see, made thee god pharaoh: aaron thy brother shall thy prophet. thou shalt speak command thee: aaron thy brother shall speak unto pharaoh, send children israel land. harden pharaoh's heart, multiply signs wonders land egypt. pharaoh shall hearken unto you, may lay hand upon egypt, bring forth mine armies, [and] people children israel, land egypt great judgments. egyptians shall know [am] lord, stretch forth mine hand upon egypt, bring children israel among them. moses aaron lord commanded them, they. moses [was] fourscore years old, aaron fourscore three years old, spake unto pharaoh. lord spake unto moses unto aaron, saying, pharaoh shall speak unto you, saying, shew miracle you: thou shalt say unto aaron, take thy rod, cast [it] pharaoh, [and] shall become serpent. moses aaron went unto pharaoh, lord commanded: aaron cast rod pharaoh, servants, became serpent. pharaoh also called wise men sorcerers: magicians egypt, also like manner enchantments. cast every man rod, became serpents: aaron's rod swallowed rods. hardened pharaoh's heart, hearkened unto them; lord said. lord said unto moses, pharaoh's heart [is] hardened, refuseth let people go. get thee unto pharaoh morning; lo, goeth unto water; thou shalt stand river's brink come; rod turned serpent shalt thou take thine hand. thou shalt say unto him, lord god hebrews hath sent unto thee, saying, let people go, may serve wilderness: and, behold, hitherto thou wouldest hear. thus saith lord, thou shalt know [am] lord: behold, smite rod [is] mine hand upon waters [are] river, shallbe turned blood. fish [is] river shall die, river shall stink; egyptians shall lothe drink water river. lord spake unto moses, say unto aaron, take thy rod, stretch thine hand upon waters egypt, upon streams, upon rivers, upon ponds, upon pools water, may become blood; river stank, egyptians could drink water river; blood throughout land egypt. magicians egypt enchantments: pharaoh's heart hardened, neither hearken unto them; lord said. pharaoh turned went house, neither set heart also. egyptians digged round river water drink; could drink water river. seven days fulfilled, lord smitten river. lord spake unto moses, go unto pharaoh, say unto him, thus saith lord, let people go, may serve me. thou refuse let [them] go, behold, smite thy borders frogs: river shall bring forth frogs abundantly, shall go come thine house, thy bedchamber, upon thy bed, house thy servants, upon thy people, thine ovens, thy kneadingtroughs: frogs shall come thee, upon thy people, upon thy servants. lord spake unto moses, say unto aaron, stretch forth thine hand thy rod streams, rivers, ponds, cause frogs come upon land egypt. aaron stretched hand waters egypt; shall remain river only. moses aaron went pharaoh: moses cried unto lord frogs brought pharaoh. lord according word moses; frogs died houses, villages, fields. gathered together upon heaps: land stank. pharaoh saw respite, hardened heart, hearkened unto them; thou mayest know [there is] none like earth. stretch hand, may smite thee thy people pestilence; thou shalt cut earth. deed [cause] raised thee up, shew [in] thee power; name may declared throughout earth. yet exaltest thou thyself people, thou wilt let go? behold, morrow time cause rain grievous hail, hath egypt since foundation thereof even now. send therefore now, [and] gather thy cattle, thou hast field; [for upon] every man beast shall found field, shall brought home, hail shall come upon them, shall die. feared word lord among servants pharaoh made servants cattle flee houses: regarded word lord left servants cattle field. lord said unto moses, stretch forth thine hand toward heaven, may hail land egypt, upon man, upon beast, upon every herb field, throughout land egypt. moses stretched forth rod toward heaven: lord sent thunder hail, fire ran along upon ground; lord rained hail upon land egypt. hail, fire mingled hail, grievous, none like land egypt since became nation. hail smote throughout land egypt [was] field, man beast; hail smote every herb field, brake every tree field. land goshen, children israel [were,] hail. pharaoh sent, called moses aaron, said unto them, sinned time: lord [is] righteous, people [are] wicked. intreat lord (for [it is] enough) [more] mighty thunderings hail; lord spoken moses. lord said unto moses, go unto pharaoh: hardened heart, heart servants, might shew signs him: thou mayest tell ears thy son, thy son's son, things wrought egypt, signs done among them; [and] morning, east wind brought locusts. locusts went land egypt, rested coasts egypt: grievous [were they;] locusts they, neither shall such. covered face whole earth, land darkened; eat every herb land, fruit trees hail left: remained green thing trees, herbs field, land egypt. pharaoh called moses aaron haste; lord fighteth egyptians. lord said unto moses, stretch thine hand sea, waters may come upon egyptians, upon chariots, upon horsemen. moses stretched forth hand sea, sea returned strength morning appeared; waters [were] wall unto right hand, left. thus lord saved israel day hand egyptians; israel saw egyptians dead upon sea shore. israel saw great work lord upon egyptians: people feared lord, believed lord, servant moses. sang moses children israel song unto lord, spake, saying, sing unto lord, hath triumphed gloriously: horse rider hath thrown sea. lord [is] strength song, become salvation: [is] god, prepare habitation; father's god, exalt him. lord [is] man war: lord [is] name. pharaoh's chariots host hath cast sea: chosen captains also drowned red sea. depths covered them: sank bottom stone. thy right hand, lord, become glorious power: thy right hand, lord, hath dashed pieces enemy. greatness thine excellency thou hastoverthrown rose thee: thou sentest forth thy wrath, [which] consumed stubble. blast thy nostrils waters gathered together, floods stood upright heap, [and] depths congealed heart sea. enemy said, pursue, overtake, divide spoil; lust shall satisfied upon them; draw sword, hand shall destroy them. thou didst blow thy wind, sea covered them: sank lead mighty waters. [is] like unto thee, lord, among gods? [is] like thee, glorious holiness, fearful [in] praises, wonders? thou stretchedst thy right hand, earth swallowed them. thou thy mercy hast led forth people [which] thou hast redeemed: thou hast guided [them] thy strength unto thy holy habitation. people shall hear, [and] afraid: sorrow shall take hold inhabitants palestina. dukes edom shall amazed; mighty men moab, trembling shall take hold upon them; inhabitants canaan shall melt away. fear dread shall fall upon them; greatness thine arm shall [as] still stone; till thy people pass over, lord, till people pass over, [which] thou hast purchased. thou shalt bring in, plant mountain thine inheritance, [in] place, lord, [which] thou hast made thee dwell in, sanctuary, lord, [which] thy hands established. lord shall reign ever ever. horse pharaoh went chariots horsemen sea, lord brought waters sea upon them; children israel went dry [land] midst sea. miriam prophetess, sister aaron, took timbrel hand; women went timbrels dances. miriam answered them, sing ye lord, hath triumphed gloriously; horse rider hath thrown sea. moses brought israel red sea, went wilderness shur; went three days wilderness, found water. came marah, could drink waters marah, [were] bitter: therefore name called marah. people murmured moses, saying, shall drink? cried unto lord; lord shewed tree, [which] cast waters, waters made sweet: made statute ordinance, proved them, said, thou wilt diligently hearken voice lord thy god, wilt right sight, wilt give ear commandments, keep statutes, put none diseases upon thee, brought upon egyptians: [am] lord healeth thee. came elim, [were] twelve wells water, threescore ten palm trees: encamped waters. took journey elim, congregation children israel came unto wilderness sin, [is] elim sinai, fifteenth day second month departing land egypt. whole congregation children israel murmured moses aaron wilderness: children israel said unto them, would god died hand lordexodus page 40 land egypt, sat flesh pots, [and] eat bread full; ye brought us forth wilderness, kill whole assembly hunger. said lord unto moses, behold, rain bread heaven you; people shall go gather certain rate every day, may prove them, whether walk law, no. shall come pass, sixth day shall prepare [that] bring in; shall twice much gather daily. moses aaron said unto children israel, even, ye shall know lord hath brought land egypt: morning, ye shall see glory lord; heareth murmurings lord: [are] we, ye murmur us? moses said, [this shall be,] lord shall give evening flesh eat, morning bread full; lord heareth murmurings ye murmur him: [are] we? murmurings [are] us, lord. moses spake unto aaron, say unto congregation children israel, come near lord: hath heard murmurings. came pass, aaron spake unto whole congregation children israel, looked toward wilderness, and, behold, glory lord appeared cloud. lord spake unto moses, saying, heard murmurings children israel: speak unto them, saying, even ye shall eat flesh, morning ye shall filled bread; ye shall know [am] lord god. came pass, even quails came up, covered camp: morning dew lay round host. dew lay gone up, behold, upon face wilderness [there lay] small round thing, [as] small hoar frost ground. children israel saw [it,] said one another, [is] manna: wist [was.] moses said unto them, [is] bread lord hath given eat. [is] thing lord hath commanded, gather every man [according to] eating, omer every man, according number persons; take ye every man [them] [are] tents. children israel so, gathered, more, less. mete [it] omer, gathered much nothing over, gathered little lack; gathered every man according eating. moses said, let man leave till morning. notwithstanding hearkened unto moses; left morning, bred worms, stank: moses wroth them. gathered every morning, every man according eating: sun waxed hot, melted. came pass, [that] sixth day gathered twice much bread, two omers one [man:] rulers congregation came told moses. said unto them, [is that] lord hath said, morrow [is] rest holy sabbath unto lord: bake [that] ye bake [to day,] andseethe ye seethe; remaineth lay kept morning. laid till morning, moses bade: stink, neither worm therein. moses said, eat day; day [is] sabbath unto lord: day ye shall find field. six days ye shall gather it; seventh day, [which is] sabbath, shall none. came pass, [that] went [some] people seventh day gather, found none. lord said unto moses, long refuse ye keep commandments laws? see, lord hath given sabbath, therefore giveth sixth day bread two days; abide ye every man place, let man go place seventh day. people rested seventh day. house israel called name thereof manna: [was] like coriander seed, white; taste [was] like wafers [made] honey. moses said, [is] thing lord commandeth, fill omer kept generations; may see bread wherewith fed wilderness, brought forth land egypt. moses said unto aaron, take pot, put omer full manna therein, lay lord, kept generations. lord commanded moses, aaron laid testimony, kept. children israel eat manna forty years, came land inhabited; eat manna, came unto borders land canaan. omer [is] tenth [part] ephah. congregation children israel journeyed wilderness sin, journeys, according commandment lord, pitched rephidim: [there was] water people drink. wherefore people chide moses, said, give us water may drink. moses said unto them, chide ye me? wherefore ye tempt lord? people thirsted water; people murmured moses, said, wherefore [is] [that] thou hast brought us egypt, kill us children cattle thirst? moses cried unto lord, saying, shall unto people? almost ready stone me. lord said unto moses, go people, take thee elders israel; thy rod, wherewith thou smotest river, take thine hand, go. behold, stand thee upon rock horeb; thou shalt smite rock, shall come water it, people may drink. moses sight elders israel. called name place massah, meribah, chiding children israel, tempted lord, saying, lord among us, not? came amalek, fought israel rephidim. moses said unto joshua, choose us men, go out, fight amalek: morrow stand top hill rod god mine hand. joshua moses said him, fought amalek: moses, aaron, hur went top hill. came pass, moses held hand, israel prevailed:page 41 exodus let hand, amalek prevailed. moses' hands [were] heavy; took stone, put [it] him, sat thereon; aaron hur stayed hands, one one side, side; hands steady going sun. joshua discomfited amalek people edge sword. lord said unto moses, write [for] memorial book, rehearse [it] ears joshua: utterly put remembrance amalek heaven. moses built altar, called name jehovah- nissi: said, lord hath sworn [that] lord [will have] war amalek generation generation. jethro, priest midian, moses' father law, heard god done moses, israel people, [and] lord brought israel egypt; jethro, moses' father law, took zipporah, moses' wife, sent back, two sons; name one [was] gershom; said, alien strange land: name [was] eliezer; god father, [said he, was] mine help, delivered sword pharaoh: jethro, moses' father law, came sons wife unto moses wilderness, encamped mount god: said unto moses, thy father law jethro come unto thee, thy wife, two sons her. moses went meet father law, obeisance, kissed him; asked [their] welfare; came tent. moses told father law lord done unto pharaoh egyptians israel's sake, [and] travail come upon way, [how] lord delivered them. jethro rejoiced goodness lord done israel, delivered hand egyptians. jethro said, blessed [be] lord, hath delivered hand egyptians, hand pharaoh, hath delivered people hand egyptians. know lord [is] greater gods: thing wherein dealt proudly [he was] them. jethro, moses' father law, took burnt offering sacrifices god: aaron came, elders israel, eat bread moses' father law god. came pass morrow, moses sat judge people: people stood moses morning unto evening. moses' father law saw people, said, [is] thing thou doest people? sittest thou thyself alone, people stand thee morning unto even? moses said unto father law, people come unto enquire god: matter, come unto me; judge one another, make [them] know statutes god, laws. moses' father law said unto him, thing thou doest [is] good. thou wilt surely wear away, thou, people [is] thee: thing [is] heavy thee; thou art able perform thyself alone. hearken unto voice, give thee counsel, god shall thee: thou people god-ward, thou mayest bring causes unto god: thou shalt teach ordinances laws, shalt shew way wherein must walk, work must do. moreover thou shalt provide people able men, fear god, men truth, hating covetousness; place [such] them, [to be] rulers thousands, [and] rulers hundreds, rulers fifties, rulers tens: let judge people seasons: shall be, [that] every great matter shall bring unto thee, every small matter shall judge: shall easier thyself, shall bear [the burden] thee. thou shalt thing, god command thee [so,] thou shalt able endure, people shall also go place peace. moses hearkened voice father law, said. moses chose able men israel, made heads people, rulers thousands, rulers hundreds, rulers fifties, rulers tens. judged people seasons: hard causes brought unto moses, every small matter judged themselves. moses let father law depart; went way land. third month, children israel gone forth land egypt, day came [into] wilderness sinai. departed rephidim, come [to] desert sinai, pitched wilderness; israel camped mount. moses went unto god, lord called unto mountain, saying, thus shalt thou say house jacob, tell children israel; ye seen unto egyptians, [how] bare eagles' wings, brought unto myself. therefore, ye obey voice indeed, keep covenant, ye shall peculiar treasure unto people: earth [is] mine: ye shall unto kingdom priests, holy nation. [are] words thou shalt speak unto children israel. moses came called elders people, laid faces words lord commanded him. people answered together, said, lord hath spoken do. moses returned words people unto lord. lord said unto moses, lo, come unto thee thick cloud, people may hear speak thee, believe thee ever. moses told words people unto lord. lord said unto moses, go unto people, sanctify day morrow, let wash clothes, ready third day: third day lord come sight people upon mount sinai. thou shalt set bounds unto people round about, saying, take heed yourselves, [that ye] go [not] mount, touch border it: whosoever toucheth mount shall surely put death: shall hand touch it, shall surely stoned, shot through; whether [it be] beast man, shall live: trumpet soundeth long, shall come mount. moses went mount unto people, sanctified people; washed clothes. said unto people, ready third day: come [your] wives.exodus page 42 came pass third day morning, thunders lightnings, thick cloud upon mount, voice trumpet exceeding loud; people [was] camp trembled. moses brought forth people camp meet god; stood nether part mount. mount sinai altogether smoke, lord descended upon fire: smoke thereof ascended smoke furnace, whole mount quaked greatly. voice trumpet sounded long, waxed louder louder, moses spake, god answered voice. lord came upon mount sinai, top mount: lord called moses [up] top mount; moses went up. lord said unto moses, go down, charge people, lest break unto lord gaze, many perish. let priests also, come near lord, sanctify themselves, lest lord break forth upon them. moses said unto lord, people cannot come mount sinai: thou chargedst us, saying, set bounds mount, sanctify it. lord said unto him, away, get thee down, thou shalt come up, thou, aaron thee: let priests people break come unto lord, lest break forth upon them. moses went unto people, spake unto them. [am] lord thy god, brought thee land egypt, house bondage. thou shalt gods me. thou shalt make unto thee graven image, likeness [of thing] [is] heaven above, [is] earth beneath, [is] water earth: thou shalt bow thyself them, serve them: lord thy god [am] jealous god, visiting iniquity fathers upon children unto third fourth [generation] hate me; shewing mercy unto thousands love me, keep commandments. thou shalt take name lord thy god vain; lord hold guiltless taketh name vain. remember sabbath day, keep holy. six days shalt thou labour, thy work: seventh day [is] sabbath lord thy god: [in it] thou shalt work, thou, thy son, thy daughter, thy manservant, thy maidservant, thy cattle, thy stranger [is] within thy gates: [in] six days lord made heaven earth, sea, [is,] rested seventh day: wherefore lord blessed sabbath day, hallowed it. honour thy father thy mother: thy days may long upon land lord thy god giveth thee. thou shalt commit adultery. thou shalt bear false witness thy neighbour. thou shalt covet thy neighbour's house, thou shalt covet thy neighbour's wife, manservant, maidservant, ox, ass, thing [is] thy neighbour's. people saw thunderings, lightnings, noise trumpet, mountain smoking: people saw [it,] removed, stood afar off. said unto moses, speakthou us, hear: let god speak us, lest die. moses said unto people, fear not: god come prove you, fear may faces, ye sin not. people stood afar off, moses drew near unto thick darkness god [was. ] lord said unto moses, thus thou shalt say unto children israel, ye seen talked heaven. ye shall make gods silver, neither shall ye make unto gods gold. altar earth thou shalt make unto me, shalt sacrifice thereon thy burnt offerings, thy peace offerings, thy sheep, thine oxen: places record name come unto thee, bless thee. thou wilt make altar stone, thou shalt build hewn stone: thou lift thy tool upon it, thou hast polluted it. neither shalt thou go steps unto mine altar, thy nakedness discovered thereon. [are] judgments thou shalt set them. thou buy hebrew servant, six years shall serve: seventh shall go free nothing. came himself, shall go himself: married, wife shall go him. master given wife, born sons daughters; wife children shall master's, shall go himself. servant shall plainly say, love master, wife, children; go free: master shall bring unto judges; shall also bring door, unto door post; master shall bore ear aul; shall serve ever. man sell daughter maidservant, shall go menservants do. please master, hath betrothed himself, shall let redeemed: sell unto strange nation shall power, seeing hath dealt deceitfully her. betrothed unto son, shall deal manner daughters. take another [wife;] food, raiment, duty marriage, shall diminish. three unto her, shall go free without money. smiteth man, die, shall surely put death. man lie wait, god deliver [him] hand; appoint thee place whither shall flee. man come presumptuously upon neighbour, slay guile; thou shalt take mine altar, may die. smiteth father, mother, shall surely put death. stealeth man, selleth him, found hand, shall surely put death. curseth father, mother, shall surely put death. men strive together, one smite another stone, [his] fist, die not, keepeth [his] bed: rise again, walk abroad uponpage 43 exodus staff, shall smote [him] quit: shall pay [for] loss time, shall cause [him] thoroughly healed. man smite servant, maid, rod, die hand; shall surely punished. notwithstanding, continue day two, shall punished: [is] money. men strive, hurt woman child, fruit depart [from her,] yet mischief follow: shall surely punished, according woman's husband lay upon him; shall pay judges [determine. ] [any] mischief follow, thou shalt give life life, eye eye, tooth tooth, hand hand, foot foot, burning burning, wound wound, stripe stripe. man smite eye servant, eye maid, perish; shall let go free eye's sake. smite manservant's tooth, maidservant's tooth; shall let go free tooth's sake. ox gore man woman, die: ox shall surely stoned, flesh shall eaten; owner ox [shall be] quit. ox wont push horn time past, hath testified owner, hath kept in, hath killed man woman; ox shall stoned, owner also shall put death. laid sum money, shall give ransom life whatsoever laid upon him. whether gored son, gored daughter, according judgment shall done unto him. ox shall push manservant maidservant; shall give unto master thirty shekels silver, ox shall stoned. man shall open pit, man shall dig pit, cover it, ox ass fall therein; owner pit shall make [it] good, [and] give money unto owner them; dead [beast] shall his. one man's ox hurt another's, die; shall sell live ox, divide money it; dead [ox] also shall divide. known ox hath used push time past, owner hath kept in; shall surely pay ox ox; dead shall own. man shall steal ox, sheep, kill it, sell it; shall restore five oxen ox, four sheep sheep. thief found breaking up, smitten die, [there shall] blood [be shed] him. sun risen upon him, [there shall be] blood [shed] him; [for] make full restitution; nothing, shall sold theft. theft certainly found hand alive, whether ox, ass, sheep; shall restore double. man shall cause field vineyard eaten, shall put beast, shall feed another man's field; best field, best vineyard, shall make restitution. fire break out, catch thorns, stacks corn, standing corn, field, consumed [therewith;] kindled fire shall surely make restitution. man shall deliver unto neighbour money stuff keep, stolen man's house; thief found, let pay double. thief found, master house shall brought unto judges, [to see] whether put hand unto neighbour's goods. manner trespass, [whether be] ox, ass, sheep, raiment, [or] manner lost thing, [another] challengeth his, cause parties shall come judges; [and] judges shall condemn, shall pay double unto neighbour. man deliver unto neighbour ass, ox, sheep, beast, keep; die, hurt, driven away, man seeing [it: ] [then] shall oath lord both, hath put hand unto neighbour's goods; owner shall accept [thereof,] shall make [it] good. stolen him, shall make restitution unto owner thereof. torn pieces, [then] let bring [for] witness, [and] shall make good torn. man borrow [ought] neighbour, hurt, die, owner thereof [being] it, shall surely make [it] good. [but] owner thereof [be] it, shall make [it] good: [be] hired [thing,] came hire. man entice maid betrothed, lie her, shall surely endow wife. father utterly refuse give unto him, shall pay money according dowry virgins. thou shalt suffer witch live. whosoever lieth beast shall surely put death. sacrificeth unto [any] god, save unto lord only, shall utterly destroyed. thou shalt neither vex stranger, oppress him: ye strangers land egypt. ye shall afflict widow, fatherless child. thou afflict wise, cry unto me, surely hear cry; wrath shall wax hot, kill sword; wives shall widows, children fatherless. thou lend money [any of] people [that is] poor thee, thou shalt usurer, neither shalt thou lay upon usury. thou take thy neighbour's raiment pledge, thou shalt deliver unto sun goeth down: [is] covering only, [is] raiment skin: wherein shall sleep? shall come pass, crieth unto me, hear; [am] gracious. thou shalt revile gods, curse ruler thy people. thou shalt delay [to offer] first thy ripe fruits, thy liquors: firstborn thy sons shalt thouexodus page 44 give unto me. likewise shalt thou thine oxen, [and] thy sheep: seven days shall dam; eighth day thou shalt give me. ye shall holy men unto me: neither shall ye eat [any] flesh [that is] torn beasts field; ye shall cast dogs. thou shalt raise false report: put thine hand wicked unrighteous witness. thou shalt follow multitude [do] evil; neither shalt thou speak cause decline many wrest [judgment: ] neither shalt thou countenance poor man cause. thou meet thine enemy's ox ass going astray, thou shalt surely bring back again. thou see ass hateth thee lying burden, wouldest forbear help him, thou shalt surely help him. thou shalt wrest judgment thy poor cause. keep thee far false matter; innocent righteous slay thou not: justify wicked. thou shalt take gift: gift blindeth wise, perverteth words righteous. also thou shalt oppress stranger: ye know heart stranger, seeing ye strangers land egypt. six years thou shalt sow thy land, shalt gather fruits thereof: seventh [year] thou shalt let rest lie still; poor thy people may eat: leave beasts field shall eat. like manner thou shalt deal thy vineyard, [and] thy oliveyard. six days thou shalt thy work, seventh day thou shalt rest: thine ox thine ass may rest, son thy handmaid, stranger, may refreshed. [things] said unto circumspect: make mention name gods, neither let heard thy mouth. three times thou shalt keep feast unto year. thou shalt keep feast unleavened bread: (thou shalt eat unleavened bread seven days, commanded thee, time appointed month abib; thou camest egypt: none shall appear empty:) feast harvest, firstfruits thy labours, thou hast sown field: feast ingathering, [which is] end year, thou hast gathered thy labours field. three times year thy males shall appear lord god. thou shalt offer blood sacrifice leavened bread; neither shall fat sacrifice remain morning. first firstfruits thy land thou shalt bring house lord thy god. thou shalt seethe kid mother's milk. behold, send angel thee, keep thee way, bring thee place prepared. beware him, obey voice, provoke not; pardon transgressions: name [is] him. thou shalt indeed obey voice, speak; enemy unto thine enemies, adversary unto thineadversaries. mine angel shall go thee, bring thee unto amorites, hittites, perizzites, canaanites, hivites, jebusites: cut off. thou shalt bow gods, serve them, works: thou shalt utterly overthrow them, quite break images. ye shall serve lord god, shall bless thy bread, thy water; take sickness away midst thee. shall nothing cast young, barren, thy land: number thy days fulfil. send fear thee, destroy people thou shalt come, make thine enemies turn backs unto thee. send hornets thee, shall drive hivite, canaanite, hittite, thee. drive thee one year; lest land become desolate, beast field multiply thee. little little drive thee, thou increased, inherit land. set thy bounds red sea even unto sea philistines, desert unto river: deliver inhabitants land hand; thou shalt drive thee. thou shalt make covenant them, gods. shall dwell thy land, lest make thee sin me: thou serve gods, surely snare unto thee. said unto moses, come unto lord, thou, aaron, nadab, abihu, seventy elders israel; worship ye afar off. moses alone shall come near lord: shall come nigh; neither shall people go him. moses came told people words lord, judgments: people answered one voice, said, words lord hath said do. moses wrote words lord, rose early morning, builded altar hill, twelve pillars, according twelve tribes israel. sent young men children israel, offered burnt offerings, sacrificed peace offerings oxen unto lord. moses took half blood, put [it] basons; half blood sprinkled altar. took book covenant, read audience people: said, lord hath said do, obedient. moses took blood, sprinkled [it] people, said, behold blood covenant, lord hath made concerning words. went moses, aaron, nadab, abihu, seventy elders israel: saw god israel: [there was] feet paved work sapphire stone, body heaven [his] clearness. upon nobles children israel laid hand: also saw god, eat drink. lord said unto moses, come mount, there: give thee tables stone, law, commandments written; thou mayest teach them. moses rose up, minister joshua: moses went mount god. said unto elders, tarry ye us, come unto you: and, behold, aaronpage 45 exodus hur [are] you: man matters do, let come unto them. moses went mount, cloud covered mount. glory lord abode upon mount sinai, cloud covered six days: seventh day called unto moses midst cloud. sight glory lord [was] like devouring fire top mount eyes children israel. moses went midst cloud, gat mount: moses mount forty days forty nights. speak unto children israel, bring offering: every man giveth willingly heart ye shall take offering. [is] offering ye shall take them; gold, silver, brass, blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats [hair, ] rams' skins dyed red, badgers' skins, shittim wood, oil light, spices anointing oil, sweet incense, onyx stones, stones set ephod, breastplate. let make sanctuary; may dwell among them. according shew thee, [after] pattern tabernacle, pattern instruments thereof, even shall ye make [it. ] shall make ark [of] shittim wood: two cubits half [shall be] length thereof, cubit half breadth thereof, cubit half height thereof. thou shalt overlay pure gold, within without shalt thou overlay it, shalt make upon crown gold round about. thou shalt cast four rings gold it, put [them] four corners thereof; toward mercy seat shall faces cherubims be. thou shalt put mercy seat upon ark; ark thou shalt put testimony shall give thee. meet thee, commune thee mercy seat, two cherubims [are] upon ark testimony, [things] give thee commandment unto children israel. thou shalt also make table [of] shittim wood: two cubits [shall be] length thereof, cubit breadth thereof, cubit half height thereof. thou shalt overlay pure gold, make thereto crown gold round about. thou shalt make unto border hand breadth round about, thou shalt make golden crown border thereof round about. thou shalt make four ringsof gold, put rings four corners [are] four feet thereof. border shall rings places staves bear table. thou shalt make staves [of] shittim wood, overlay gold, table may borne them. thou shalt make dishes thereof, spoons thereof, covers thereof, bowls thereof, cover withal: [of] pure gold shalt thou make them. thou shalt set upon table shewbread alway. thou shalt make candlestick [of] pure gold: [of] beaten work shall candlestick made: shaft, branches, bowls, knops, flowers, shall same. six branches shall come sides it; three branches candlestick one side, three branches candlestick side: three bowls made like unto almonds, [with] knop flower one branch; three bowls made like almonds branch, [with] knop flower: six branches come candlestick. candlestick [shall be] four bowls made like unto almonds, [with] knops flowers. [there shall be] knop two branches same, knop two branches same, knop two branches same, according six branches proceed candlestick. knops branches shall same: [shall be] one beaten work [of] pure gold. thou shalt make seven lamps thereof: shall light lamps thereof, may give light it. tongs thereof, snuffdishes thereof, [shall of] pure gold. [of] talent pure gold shall make it, vessels. look thou make [them] pattern, shewed thee mount. moreover thou shalt make tabernacle [with] ten curtains [of] fine twined linen, blue, purple, scarlet: [with] cherubims cunning work shalt thou make them. length one curtain [shall be] eight twenty cubits, breadth one curtain four cubits: every one curtains shall one measure. five curtains shall coupled together one another; loops may take hold one another. thou shalt make fifty taches gold, couple curtains together taches: shall one tabernacle. thou shalt make curtains [of] goats' [hair] covering upon tabernacle: eleven curtains shalt thou make. length one curtain [shall be] thirty cubits, breadth one curtain four cubits: eleven curtains [shall all] one measure. thou shalt couple five curtains themselves, six curtains themselves, shalt double sixth curtain forefront tabernacle. thou shalt make fifty loops edge one curtain [that is] outmost coupling, fifty loops edge curtain coupleth second. thou shalt make fifty taches brass, put taches loops, couple tent together, may one.exodus page 46 remnant remaineth curtains tent, half curtain remaineth, shall hang backside tabernacle. cubit one side, cubit side remaineth length curtains tent, shall hang sides tabernacle side side, cover it. thou shalt make covering tent [of] rams' skins dyed red, covering [of] badgers skins. thou shalt make boards tabernacle [of] shittim wood standing up. ten cubits [shall be] length board, cubit half [shall be] breadth one board. two tenons [shall be] one board, set order one another: thus shalt thou make boards tabernacle. thou shalt make boards tabernacle, twenty boards south side southward. thou shalt make forty sockets silver twenty boards; shall two corners. shall eight boards, sockets [of] silver, sixteen sockets; two sockets one board, two sockets another board. thou shalt make bars [of] shittim wood; five boards one side tabernacle, five bars boards side tabernacle, five bars boards side tabernacle, two sides westward. middle bar midst boards shall reach end end. thou shalt overlay boards gold, make rings [of] gold [for] places bars: thou shalt overlay bars gold. thou shalt rear tabernacle according fashion thereof shewed thee mount. thou shalt make vail [of] blue, purple, scarlet, fine twined linen cunning work: cherubims shall made: thou shalt hang upon four pillars shittim [wood] overlaid gold: hooks [shall of] gold, upon four sockets silver. thou shalt hang vail taches, thou mayest bring thither within vail ark testimony: vail shall divide unto holy [place] holy. thou shalt put mercy seat upon ark testimony holy [place. ] thou shalt set table without vail, candlestick table side tabernacle toward south: thou shalt put table north side. thou shalt make hanging door tent, [of] blue, purple, scarlet, fine twined linen, wrought needlework. thou shalt make hanging five pillars [of] shittim [wood,] overlay gold, [and] hooks [shall of] gold: thou shalt cast five sockets brass them. thou shalt make altar [of] shittim wood, five cubits long, five cubits broad; [are] garments shall make; breastplate, ephod, robe, broidered coat, mitre, girdle: shall make holy garments aaron thy brother, sons, may minister unto priest's office. shall take gold, blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen. shall make ephod [of] gold, [of] blue, [of] purple, [of] scarlet, fine twined linen, cunning work. shall two shoulderpieces thereof joined two edges thereof; [so] shall joined together. curious girdle ephod, [is] upon it, shall same, according work thereof; [even of] gold, [of] blue, purple, scarlet, fine twined linen. thou shalt take two onyx stones, grave names children israel: six names one stone, [the other] six names rest stone, according birth. work engraver stone, [like] engravings signet, shalt thou engrave two stones names children israel: thou shalt make set ouches gold. thou shalt put two stones upon shoulders ephod [for] stones memorial unto children israel: aaron shall bear names lord upon two shoulders memorial. two chains [of] pure gold ends; [of] wreathen work shalt thou make them, fasten wreathen chains ouches. thou shalt make breastplate judgment cunning work; work ephod thou shalt make it; [of] gold, [of] blue, [of] purple, [of] scarlet, [of] fine twined linen, shalt thou make it. foursquare shall [being] doubled; span [shall be] length thereof, span [shall be] breadth thereof. thou shalt set settings stones, [even] four rows stones: [the first] row [shall be] sardius, topaz, carbuncle: [this shall be] first row. second row [shall be] emerald, sapphire, diamond. third row ligure, agate, amethyst. fourth row beryl, onyx, jasper: shall set gold inclosings. stones shall names children israel, twelve, according names, [like] engravings signet; every one name shall according twelve tribes. thou shalt make upon breastplate chains ends [of] wreathen work [of] pure gold. thou shalt make upon breastplate two rings gold, shalt put two rings two ends breastplate. thou shalt put two wreathen [chains] gold two rings [which are] ends breastplate. moses said. moses said unto aaron, unto eleazar unto ithamar, sons, uncover heads, neither rend clothes; lest ye die, lest wrath come upon people: let brethren, whole house israel, bewail burning lord hath kindled. ye shall go door tabernacle congregation, lest ye die: anointing oil lord [is] upon you. according word moses. drink wine strong drink, thou, thy sons thee, ye go tabernacle congregation, lest ye die: [it shall be] statute ever throughout generations: ye may put difference holy unholy, unclean clean; ye may teach children israel statutes lord hath spoken unto hand moses. moses spake unto aaron, unto eleazar unto ithamar, sons left, take meat offering remaineth offerings lord made fire, eat without leaven beside altar: [is] holy: ye shall eat holy place, [is] thy due, thy sons' due, sacrifices lord made fire: commanded. wave breast heave shoulder shall ye eat clean place; thou, thy sons, thy daughters thee: [they be] thy due, thy sons' due, [which] given sacrifices peace offerings children israel. heave shoulder wave breast shall bring offerings made fire fat, wave [it for] wave offering lord; shall thine, thy sons' thee, statute ever; lord hath commanded. moses diligently sought goat sin offering, and, behold, burnt: angry eleazar ithamar, sons aaron [which were] left [alive,] saying, wherefore ye eaten sin offering holy place, seeing [is] holy, [god] hath given bear iniquity congregation, make atonement thelord? behold, blood brought within holy [place:] ye indeed eaten holy [place,] commanded. aaron said unto moses, behold, day offered sin offering burnt offering lord; things befallen me: [if] eaten sin offering day, accepted sight lord? moses heard [that,] content. lord spake unto moses aaron, saying unto them, speak unto children israel, saying, [are] beasts ye shall eat among beasts [are] earth. whatsoever parteth hoof, clovenfooted, [and] cheweth cud, among beasts, shall ye eat. nevertheless shall ye eat chew cud, divide hoof: [as] camel, cheweth cud, divideth hoof; unclean unto you. coney, cheweth cud, divideth hoof; [is] unclean unto you. hare, cheweth cud, divideth hoof; [is] unclean unto you. swine, though divide hoof, clovenfooted, yet cheweth cud; [is] unclean you. flesh shall ye eat, carcase shall ye touch; [are] unclean you. shall ye eat [are] waters: whatsoever hath fins scales waters, seas, rivers, shall ye eat. fins scales seas, rivers, move waters, living thing [is] waters, [shall be] abomination unto you: shall even abomination unto you; ye shall eat flesh, ye shall carcases abomination. whatsoever hath fins scales waters, [shall be] abomination unto you. [are ye] shall abomination among fowls; shall eaten, [are] abomination: eagle, ossifrage, ospray, vulture, kite kind; owl, night hawk, cuckow, hawk kind, little owl, cormorant, great owl, swan, pelican, gier eagle, stork, heron kind, lapwing, bat. fowls creep, going upon [all] four, [shall be] abomination unto you. yet may ye eat every flying creeping thing goeth upon [all] four, legs feet, leap withal upon earth; [even] ye may eat; locust kind, bald locust kind, beetle kind, grasshopper kind. [other] flying creeping things, four feet, [shall be] abomination unto you. ye shall unclean: whosoever toucheth carcase shall unclean even. whosoever beareth [ought] carcase shall wash clothes, unclean even. [the carcases] every beast divideth hoof, [is] clovenfooted, cheweth cud, [are] unclean unto you: every one toucheth shall unclean. whatsoever goeth upon paws, among manner beasts go [all] four, [are] unclean unto you: whoso toucheth carcase shall unclean even. beareth carcase shall wash clothes, unclean even: [are] unclean unto you.page 63 leviticus also [shall be] unclean unto among creeping things creep upon earth; weasel, mouse, tortoise kind, ferret, chameleon, lizard, snail, mole. [are] unclean among creep: whosoever doth touch them, dead, shall unclean even. upon whatsoever [any] them, dead, doth fall, shall unclean; whether [it be] vessel wood, raiment, skin, sack, whatsoever vessel [it be,] wherein [any] work done, must put water, shall unclean even; shall cleansed. every earthen vessel, whereinto [any] falleth, whatsoever shall unclean; ye shall break it. meat may eaten, [that] [such] water cometh shall unclean: drink may drunk every [such] vessel shall unclean. every [thing] whereupon [any part] carcase falleth shall unclean; [whether be] oven, ranges pots, shall broken down: [for] [are] unclean, shall unclean unto you. nevertheless fountain pit, [wherein is] plenty water, shall clean: toucheth carcase shall unclean. [any part] carcase fall upon sowing seed sown, [shall be] clean. [any] water put upon seed, [any part] carcase fall thereon, [shall be] unclean unto you. beast, ye may eat, die; toucheth carcase thereof shall unclean even. eateth carcase shall wash clothes, unclean even: also beareth carcase shall wash clothes, unclean even. every creeping thing creepeth upon earth [shall be] abomination; shall eaten. whatsoever goeth upon belly, whatsoever goeth upon [all] four, whatsoever hath feet among creeping things creep upon earth, ye shall eat; [are] abomination. ye shall make abominable creeping thing creepeth, neither shall ye make unclean them, ye defiled thereby. [am] lord god: ye shall therefore sanctify yourselves, ye shall holy; [am] holy: neither shall ye defile manner creeping thing creepeth upon earth. [am] lord bringeth land egypt, god: ye shall therefore holy, [am] holy. [is] law beasts, fowl, every living creature moveth waters, every creature creepeth upon earth: make difference unclean clean, beast may eaten beast may eaten. speak unto children israel, saying, woman conceived seed, born man child: shall unclean seven days; according days separation infirmity shall unclean. eighth day flesh foreskin shall circumcised. shall continue blood purifying three thirty days; shall touch hallowed thing, come sanctuary, days purifying fulfilled. bear maid child, shall unclean two weeks, separation: shall continue blood purifying threescore six days. days purifying fulfilled, son, daughter, shall bring lamb first year burnt offering, young pigeon, turtledove, sin offering, unto thedoor tabernacle congregation, unto priest: shall offer lord, make atonement her; shall cleansed issue blood. [is] law hath born male female. able bring lamb, shall bring two turtles, two young pigeons; one burnt offering, sin offering: priest shall make atonement her, shall clean. lord spake unto moses aaron, saying, man shall skin flesh rising, scab, bright spot, skin flesh [like] plague leprosy; shall brought unto aaron priest, unto one sons priests: priest shall look plague skin flesh: [when] hair plague turned white, plague sight [be] deeper skin flesh, [is] plague leprosy: priest shall look him, pronounce unclean. bright spot [be] white skin flesh, sight [be] deeper skin, hair thereof turned white; priest shall shut [him hath] plague seven days: priest shall look seventh day: and, behold, [if] plague sight stay, [and] plague spread skin; priest shall shut seven days more: priest shall look seventh day: and, behold, [if] plague [be] somewhat dark, [and] plague spread skin, priest shall pronounce clean: [is but] scab: shall wash clothes, clean. scab spread much abroad skin, hath seen priest cleansing, shall seen priest again: [if] priest see that, behold, scab spreadeth skin, priest shall pronounce unclean: [is] leprosy. plague leprosy man, shall brought unto priest; priest shall see [him:] and, behold, [if] rising [be] white skin, turned hair white, [there be] quick raw flesh rising; [is] old leprosy skin flesh, priest shall pronounce unclean, shall shut up: [is] unclean. leprosy break abroad skin, leprosy cover skin [him hath] plague head even foot, wheresoever priest looketh; priest shall consider: and, behold, [if] leprosy covered flesh, shall pronounce [him] clean [that hath] plague: turned white: [is] clean. raw flesh appeareth him, shall unclean. priest shall see raw flesh, pronounce unclean: [for] raw flesh [is] unclean: [is] leprosy. raw flesh turn again, changed unto white, shall come unto priest; priest shall see him: and, behold, [if] plague turned white; priest shall pronounce [him] clean [that hath] plague: [is] clean. flesh also, which, [even] skin thereof, boil, healed, place boil white rising, bright spot, white, somewhat reddish, shewed priest; if, priest seeth it, behold, [be] sight lower skin, hair thereof turned white; priest shall pronounce unclean: [is] plague leprosy broken boil. priest look it, and, behold, [there be] white hairsleviticus page 64 therein, [if] [be] lower skin, [be] somewhat dark; priest shall look: and, behold, [if] bright spots skin flesh [be] darkish white; [is] freckled spot [that] groweth skin; [is] clean. man whose hair fallen head, [is] bald; [yet is] clean. hath hair fallen part head toward face, [is] forehead bald: [yet is] clean. bald head, bald forehead, white reddish sore; [is] law manner plague leprosy, scall, leprosy garment, house, rising, scab, bright spot: teach [it is] unclean, [it is] clean: [is] law leprosy. lord spake unto moses aaron, saying, speak unto children israel, say unto them, man hath running issueleviticus page 66 flesh, [because of] issue [is] unclean. shall uncleanness issue: whether flesh run issue, flesh stopped issue, [is] uncleanness. every bed, whereon lieth hath issue, unclean: every thing, whereon sitteth, shall unclean. whosoever toucheth bed shall wash clothes, bathe [himself] water, unclean even. sitteth [any] thing whereon sat hath issue shall wash clothes, bathe [himself] water, unclean even. toucheth flesh hath issue shall wash clothes, bathe [himself] water, unclean even. hath issue spit upon clean; shall wash clothes, bathe [himself] water, unclean even. saddle soever rideth upon hath issue shall unclean. whosoever toucheth thing shall unclean even: beareth [any of] things shall wash clothes, bathe [himself] water, unclean even. whomsoever toucheth hath issue, hath rinsed hands water, shall wash clothes, bathe [himself] water, unclean even. vessel earth, toucheth hath issue, shall broken: every vessel wood shall rinsed water. hath issue cleansed issue; priest shall make atonement lord issue. man's seed copulation go him, shall wash flesh water, unclean even. every garment, every skin, whereon seed copulation, shall washed water, unclean even. woman also man shall lie [with] seed copulation, shall [both] bathe [themselves] water, unclean even. woman issue, [and] issue flesh blood, shall put apart seven days: whosoever toucheth shall unclean even. every thing lieth upon separation shall unclean: every thing also sitteth upon shall unclean. whosoever toucheth bed shall wash clothes, bathe [himself] water, unclean even. whosoever toucheth thing sat upon shall wash clothes, bathe [himself] water, unclean even. [be] [her] bed, thing whereon sitteth, toucheth it, shall unclean even. man lie all, flowers upon him, shall unclean seven days; bed whereon lieth [shall be] unclean. woman issue blood many days time separation, run beyond time separation; days issue uncleanness shall days separation: shall unclean. every bed whereon lieth days issue shall unto bed separation: whatsoever sitteth upon shall unclean, uncleanness separation. whosoever toucheth things shall unclean, shall wash hisclothes, bathe [himself] water, unclean even. cleansed issue, shall number seven days, shall clean. eighth day shall take unto two turtles, two young pigeons, bring unto priest, door tabernacle congregation. priest shall offer one [for] sin offering, [for] burnt offering; priest shall make atonement lord issue uncleanness. thus shall ye separate children israel uncleanness; die uncleanness, defile tabernacle [is] among them. shall take blood bullock, blood goat, put [it] upon horns altar round about. shall sprinkle blood upon finger seven times, cleanse it, hallow uncleanness children israel. hath made end reconciling holy [place,] tabernacle congregation, altar, shall bring live goat: aaron shall lay hands upon head live goat, confess iniquities children israel, transgressions sins, putting upon head goat, shall send [him] away hand fit man wilderness: goat shall bear upon iniquities unto land inhabited: shall let go goat wilderness. aaron shall come tabernacle congregation, shall put linen garments, put went holy [place,] shall leave there: shall wash flesh water holy place, put garments, come forth, offer burnt offering, burnt offering people, make atonement himself, people. fat sin offering shall burn upon altar. let go goat scapegoat shall wash clothes, bathe flesh water, afterward come camp. bullock [for] sin offering, goat [for] sin offering, whose blood brought make atonement holy [place,] shall [one] carry forth without camp; [this] shall statute ever unto you: [that] seventh month, tenth [day] month, ye shall afflict souls, work all, [whether be] one country, stranger sojourneth among you: day shall [the priest] make atonement you, cleanse you, [that] ye may clean sins lord. [shall be] sabbath rest unto you, ye shall afflict souls, statute ever. priest, shall anoint, shall consecrate minister priest's office father's stead, shall make atonement, shall put linen clothes, [even] holy garments: shall make atonement holy sanctuary, shall make atonement tabernacle congregation, altar, shall make atonement priests, people congregation. shall everlasting statute unto you, make atonement children israel sins year. lord commanded moses. speak unto aaron, unto sons, unto children israel, say unto them; [is] thing lord hath commanded, saying, man soever [there be] house israel, killeth ox, lamb, goat, camp, killeth [it] ofthe camp, bringeth unto door tabernacle congregation, offer offering unto lord tabernacle lord; blood shall imputed unto man; hath shed blood; man shall cut among people: end children israel may bring sacrifices, offer open field, even may bring unto lord, unto door tabernacle congregation, unto priest, offer [for] peace offerings unto lord. priest shall sprinkle blood upon altar lord [at] door tabernacle congregation, burn fat sweet savour unto lord. shall offer sacrifices unto devils, gone whoring. shall statute ever unto throughout generations. thou shalt say unto them, whatsoever man [there be] house israel, strangers sojourn among you, offereth burnt offering sacrifice, bringeth unto door tabernacle congregation, offer unto lord; even man shall cut among people. whatsoever man [there be] house israel, strangers sojourn among you, eateth manner blood; even set face soul eateth blood, cut among people. life flesh [is] blood: given upon altar make atonement souls: [is] blood [that] maketh atonement soul. therefore said unto children israel, soul shall eat blood, neither shall stranger sojourneth among eat blood. whatsoever man [there be] children israel, strangers sojourn among you, hunteth catcheth beast fowl may eaten; shall even pour blood thereof, cover dust. [it is] life flesh; blood [is] life thereof: therefore said unto children israel, ye shall eat blood manner flesh: life flesh [is] blood thereof: whosoever eateth shall cut off. every soul eateth died [of itself,] torn [with beasts, whether be] one country, stranger, shall wash clothes, bathe [himself] water, unclean even: shall clean. wash [them] not, bathe flesh; shall bear iniquity. speak unto children israel, say unto them, lord god. doings land egypt, wherein ye dwelt, shall ye do: doings land canaan, whither bring you, shall ye do: neither shall ye walk ordinances. ye shall judgments, keep mine ordinances, walk therein: [am] lord god. ye shall therefore keep statutes, judgments: man do, shall live them: [am] lord. none shall approach near kin him, uncover [their] nakedness: [am] lord. nakedness thy father, nakedness thy mother, shalt thou uncover: thy mother; thou shalt uncover nakedness. nakedness thy father's wife shalt thou uncover: thy father's nakedness. nakedness thy sister, daughter thy father, daughter thy mother, [whether be]leviticus page 68 born home, born abroad, [even] nakedness thou shalt uncover. nakedness thy son's daughter, thy daughter's daughter, [even] nakedness thou shalt uncover: [is] thine nakedness. nakedness thy father's wife's daughter, begotten thy father, [is] thy sister, thou shalt uncover nakedness. thou shalt uncover nakedness thy father's sister: [is] thy father's near kinswoman. thou shalt uncover nakedness thy mother's sister: [is] thy mother's near kinswoman. thou shalt uncover nakedness thy father's brother, thou shalt approach wife: [is] thine aunt. thou shalt uncover nakedness thy daughter law: [is] thy son's wife; thou shalt uncover nakedness. thou shalt uncover nakedness thy brother's wife: [is] thy brother's nakedness. thou shalt uncover nakedness woman daughter, neither shalt thou take son's daughter, daughter's daughter, uncover nakedness; [for] [are] near kinswomen: [is] wickedness. neither shalt thou take wife sister, vex [her,] uncover nakedness, beside life [time. ] also thou shalt approach unto woman uncover nakedness, long put apart uncleanness. moreover thou shalt lie carnally thy neighbour's wife, defile thyself her. thou shalt let thy seed pass [the fire] molech, neither shalt thou profane name thy god: [am] lord. thou shalt lie mankind, womankind: [is] abomination. neither shalt thou lie beast defile thyself therewith: neither shall woman stand beast lie thereto: [is] confusion. defile ye things: nations defiled cast you: land defiled: therefore visit iniquity thereof upon it, land vomiteth inhabitants. ye shall therefore keep statutes judgments, shall commit [any] abominations; [neither] nation, stranger sojourneth among you: (for abominations men land done, [were] you, land defiled;) land spue also, ye defile it, spued nations [were] you. whosoever shall commit abominations, even souls commit [them] shall cut among people. therefore shall ye keep mine ordinance, [ye] commit [any one] abominable customs, committed you, ye defile therein: [am] lord god. speak unto congregation children israel, say unto them, ye shall holy: lord god [am] holy. ye shall fear every man mother, father, keep sabbaths: [am] lord god. turn ye unto idols, make molten gods: [am] lord god. ye offer sacrifice peace offerings unto lord, ye shall offer will. shall eaten day ye offer it, morrow: ought remain third day, shall burnt fire. therefore [every one] eateth shall bear iniquity, hath profaned hallowed thing lord: soul shall cut among people. ye reap harvest land, thou shalt wholly reap corners thy field, neither shalt thou gather gleanings thy harvest. thou shalt glean thy vineyard, neither shalt thou gather [every] grape thy vineyard; thou shalt leave poor stranger: [am] lord god. ye shall steal, neither deal falsely, neither lie one another. ye shall swear name falsely, neither shalt thou profane name thy god: [am] lord. thou shalt defraud thy neighbour, neither rob [him:] wages hired shall abide thee night morning. thou shalt curse deaf, put stumblingblock blind, shalt fear thy god: [am] lord. ye shall unrighteousness judgment: thou shalt respect person poor, honour person mighty: [but] righteousness shalt thou judge thy neighbour. thou shalt go [as] talebearer among thy people: neither shalt thou stand blood thy neighbour: [am] lord. thou shalt hate thy brother thine heart: thou shalt wise rebuke thy neighbour, suffer sin upon him. thou shalt avenge, bear grudge children thy people, thou shalt love thy neighbour thyself: [am] lord. ye shall keep statutes. thou shalt let thy cattle gender diverse kind: thou shalt sow thy field mingled seed: neither shall garment mingled linen woollen come upon thee. whosoever lieth carnally woman, [is] bondmaid, betrothed husband, redeemed, freedom given her; shall scourged; shall put death, free. shall bring trespass offering unto lord, unto door tabernacle congregation, [even] ram trespass offering. priest shall make atonement ram trespass offering lord sin hath done: sin hath done shall forgiven him. ye shall come land, shall planted manner trees food, ye shall count fruit thereof uncircumcised: three years shall uncircumcised unto you: shall eaten of. fourth year fruit thereof shall holy praise lord [withal. ] fifth year shall ye eat fruit thereof, may yield unto increase thereof: [am] lord god.page 69 leviticus ye shall eat [any thing] blood: neither shall ye use enchantment, observe times. ye shall round corners heads, neither shalt thou mar corners thy beard. ye shall make cuttings flesh dead, print marks upon you: [am] lord. prostitute thy daughter, cause whore; lest land fall whoredom, land become full wickedness. ye shall keep sabbaths, reverence sanctuary: [am] lord. regard familiar spirits, neither seek wizards, defiled them: [am] lord god. thou shalt rise hoary head, honour face old man, fear thy god: [am] lord. stranger sojourn thee land, ye shall vex him. shall surely put death: people land shall stone stones. set face man, cut among people; hath given seed unto molech, defile sanctuary, profane holy name. people land ways hide eyes man, giveth seed unto molech, kill not: set face man, family, cut off, go whoring him, commit whoredom molech, among people. soul turneth familiar spirits, wizards, go whoring them, even set face soul, cut among people. sanctify therefore, ye holy: [am] lord god. ye shall keep statutes, them: [am] lord sanctify you. every one curseth father mother shall surely put death: hath cursed father mother; blood [shall be] upon him. man committeth adultery [another] man's wife, [even he] committeth adultery neighbour's wife, adulterer adulteress shall surely put death. man liethwith father's wife hath uncovered father's nakedness: shall surely put death;
