therefore, king, come according desire thy soul come down; part [shall be] deliver king's hand. saul said, blessed [be] ye lord; ye compassion me. go, pray you, prepare yet, know see place haunt is, [and] hath seen there: told [that] dealeth subtilly. see therefore, take knowledge lurking places hideth himself, come ye certainty, go you: shall come pass, land, search throughout thousands judah. arose, went ziph saul: david men [were] wilderness maon, plain south jeshimon. saul also men went seek [him.] told david: wherefore came rock, abode wilderness maon. saul heard [that,] pursued david wilderness maon. saul went side mountain, david men side mountain: david made haste get away fear saul; saul men compassed david men round take them. came messenger unto saul, saying, haste thee, come; philistines invaded land. wherefore saul returned pursuing david, went philistines: therefore called place sela- hammahlekoth. david went thence, dwelt strong holds en-gedi. came pass, saul returned following philistines, told him, saying, behold, david wilderness en-gedi. saul took three thousand chosen men israel, went seek david men upon rocks wild goats. came sheepcotes way, [was] cave; saul went cover feet: david men remained sides cave. men david said unto him, behold day lord said unto thee, behold, deliver thine enemy thine hand, thou mayest shall seem good unto thee. david arose, cut skirt saul's robe privily. came passafterward, david's heart smote him, cut saul's skirt. said unto men, lord forbid thing unto master, lord's anointed, stretch forth mine hand him, seeing anointed lord. david stayed servants words, suffered rise saul. saul rose cave, went [his] way. david also arose afterward, went cave, cried saul, saying, lord king. saul looked behind him, david stooped face earth, bowed himself. david said saul, wherefore hearest thou men's words, saying, behold, david seeketh thy hurt? behold, day thine eyes seen lord delivered thee day mine hand cave: [some] bade [me] kill thee: [mine eye] spared thee; said, put forth mine hand lord; [is] lord's anointed. moreover, father, see, yea, see skirt thy robe hand: cut skirt thy robe killed thee not, know thou see [there is] neither evil transgression mine hand, sinned thee; yet thou huntest soul take it. lord judge thee, lord avenge thee: mine hand shall upon thee. saith proverb ancients, wickedness proceedeth wicked: mine hand shall upon thee. king israel come out? dost thou pursue? dead dog, flea. lord therefore judge, judge thee, see, plead cause, deliver thine hand. came pass, david made end speaking words unto saul, saul said, [is] thy voice, son david? saul lifted voice, wept. said david, thou [art] righteous i: thou hast rewarded good, whereas rewarded thee evil. thou hast shewed day thou hast dealt well me: forasmuch lord delivered thine hand, thou killedst not. man find enemy, let go well away? wherefore lord reward thee good thou hast done unto day. now, behold, know well thou shalt surely king, kingdom israel shall established thine hand. swear therefore unto lord, thou wilt cut seed me, thou wilt destroy name father's house. david sware unto saul. saul went home; david men gat unto hold. samuel died; israelites gathered together, lamented him, buried house ramah. david arose, went wilderness paran. [there was] man maon, whose possessions [were] carmel; man [was] great, three thousand sheep, thousand goats: shearing sheep carmel. name man [was] nabal; name wife abigail: [she was] woman good understanding, beautiful countenance: man [was] churlish evil doings; [was] house caleb. david heard wilderness nabal shear sheep. david sent ten young men, david said unto young men, get carmel,1 samuel page 174 go nabal, greet name: thus shall ye say liveth [in prosperity,] peace [be] thee, peace [be] thine house, peace [be] unto thou hast. heard thou hast shearers: thy shepherds us, hurt not, neither ought missing unto them, carmel. ask thy young men, shew thee. wherefore let young men find favour thine eyes: come good day: give, pray thee, whatsoever cometh thine hand unto thy servants, thy son david. david's young men came, spake nabal according words name david, ceased. nabal answered david's servants, said, [is] david? [is] son jesse? many servants days break away every man master. shall take bread, water, flesh killed shearers, give [it] unto men, know whence [be? ] david's young men turned way, went again, came told sayings. david said unto men, gird ye every man sword. girded every man sword; david also girded sword: went david four hundred men; two hundred abode stuff. one young men told abigail, nabal's wife, saying, behold, david sent messengers wilderness salute master; railed them. men [were] good unto us, hurt, neither missed thing, long conversant them, fields: wall unto us night day, keeping sheep. therefore know consider thou wilt do; evil determined master, household: [is such] son belial, [a man] cannot speak him. abigail made haste, took two hundred loaves, two bottles wine, five sheep ready dressed, five measures parched [corn,] hundred clusters raisins, two hundred cakes figs, laid [them] asses. said unto servants, go me; behold, come you. told husband nabal. [so, as] rode ass, came covert hill, and, behold, david men came her; met them. david said, surely vain kept [fellow] hath wilderness, nothing missed [pertained] unto him: hath requited evil good. also god unto enemies david, leave [pertain] morning light pisseth wall. abigail saw david, hasted, lighted ass, fell david face, bowed ground, fell feet, said, upon me, lord, [upon] [let this] iniquity [be:] let thine handmaid, pray thee, speak thine audience, hear words thine handmaid. let lord, pray thee, regard man belial, [even] nabal: name [is,] [is] he; nabal [is] name, folly [is] him: thine handmaid saw young men lord, thou didst send. therefore, lord, [as] lord liveth, [as] thy soul liveth, seeing lord hath withholden thee coming [shed]blood, avenging thyself thine hand, let thine enemies, seek evil lord, nabal. blessing thine handmaid hath brought unto lord, let even given unto young men follow lord. pray thee, forgive trespass thine handmaid: lord certainly make lord sure house; lord fighteth battles lord, evil hath found thee [all] thy days. yet man risen pursue thee, seek thy soul: soul lord shall bound bundle life lord thy god; souls thine enemies, shall sling out, [as out] middle sling. shall come pass, lord shall done lord according good hath spoken concerning thee, shall appointed thee ruler israel; shall grief unto thee, offence heart unto lord, either thou hast shed blood causeless, lord hath avenged himself: lord shall dealt well lord, remember thine handmaid. david said abigail, blessed [be] lord god israel, sent thee day meet me: blessed [be] thy advice, blessed [be] thou, hast kept day coming [shed] blood, avenging mine hand. deed, [as] lord god israel liveth, hath kept back hurting thee, except thou hadst hasted come meet me, surely left unto nabal morning light pisseth wall. david received hand [that] brought him, said unto her, go peace thine house; see, hearkened thy voice, accepted thy person. abigail came nabal; and, behold, held feast house, like feast king; nabal's heart [was] merry within him, [was] drunken: wherefore told nothing, less more, morning light. came pass morning, wine gone nabal, wife told things, heart died within him, became [as] stone. came pass ten days [after,] lord smote nabal, died. david heard nabal dead, said, blessed [be] lord, hath pleaded cause reproach hand nabal, hath kept servant evil: lord hath returned wickedness nabal upon head. david sent communed abigail, take wife. servants david come abigail carmel, spake unto her, saying, david sent us unto thee take thee wife. arose, bowed [her] face earth, said, behold, [let] thine handmaid [be] servant wash feet servants lord. abigail hasted, arose, rode upon ass, five damsels went her; went messengers david, became wife. david also took ahinoam jezreel; also wives. saul given michal daughter, david's wife, phalti son laish, [was] gallim. ziphites came unto saul gibeah, saying, doth david hide hill hachilah, [which is] jeshimon? saul arose, went wilderness ziph, three thousandpage 175 1 samuel chosen men israel him, seek david wilderness ziph. saul pitched hill hachilah, [is] jeshimon, way. david abode wilderness, saw saul came wilderness. david therefore sent spies, understood saul come deed. david arose, came place saul pitched: david beheld place saul lay, abner son ner, captain host: saul lay trench, people pitched round him. answered david said ahimelech hittite, abishai son zeruiah, brother joab, saying, go saul camp? abishai said, go thee. david abishai came people night: and, behold, saul lay sleeping within trench, spear stuck ground bolster: abner people lay round him. said abishai david, god hath delivered thine enemy thine hand day: therefore let smite him, pray thee, spear even earth once, [smite] second time. david said abishai, destroy not: stretch forth hand lord's anointed, guiltless? david said furthermore, [as] lord liveth, lord shall smite him; day shall come die; shall descend battle, perish. lord forbid stretch forth mine hand lord's anointed: but, pray thee, take thou spear [is] bolster, cruse water, let us go. david took spear cruse water saul's bolster; gat away, man saw [it,] knew [it,] neither awaked: [were] asleep; deep sleep lord fallen upon them. david went side, stood top hill afar off; great space [being] them: david cried people, abner son ner, saying, answerest thou not, abner? abner answered said, [art] thou [that] criest king? david said abner, [art] thou [valiant] man? [is] like thee israel? wherefore hast thou kept thy lord king? came one people destroy king thy lord. thing [is] good thou hast done. [as] lord liveth, ye [are] worthy die, ye kept master, lord's anointed. see king's spear is, cruse water [was] bolster. saul knew david's voice, said, [is] thy voice, son david? david said, [it is] voice, lord, king. said, wherefore doth lord thus pursue servant? done? evil [is] mine hand? therefore, pray thee, let lord king hear words servant. lord stirred thee me, let accept offering: [they be] children men, cursed [be] lord; driven day abiding inheritance lord, saying, go, serve gods. therefore, let blood fall earth face lord: king israel come seek flea, one doth hunt partridge mountains. said saul, sinned: return, son david: thee harm, soul precious thine eyes day: behold, played fool, erred exceedingly. david answered said, behold king's spear! let one ofthe young men come fetch it. lord render every man righteousness faithfulness: lord delivered thee [my] hand day, would stretch forth mine hand lord's anointed. and, behold, thy life much set day mine eyes, let life much set eyes lord, let deliver tribulation. saul said david, blessed [be] thou, son david: thou shalt great things, also shalt still prevail. david went way, saul returned place. david said heart, shall perish one day hand saul: [there is] nothing better speedily escape land philistines; saul shall despair me, seek coast israel: shall escape hand. david arose, passed six hundred men [were] unto achish, son maoch, king gath. david dwelt achish gath, men, every man household, [even] david two wives, ahinoam jezreelitess, abigail carmelitess, nabal's wife. told saul david fled gath: sought him. david said unto achish, found grace thine eyes, let give place town country, may dwell there: thy servant dwell royal city thee? achish gave ziklag day: wherefore ziklag pertaineth unto kings judah unto day. time david dwelt country philistines full year four months. david men went up, invaded geshurites, gezrites, amalekites: [nations were] old inhabitants land, thou goest shur, even unto land egypt. david smote land, left neither man woman alive, took away sheep, oxen, asses, camels, apparel, returned, came achish. achish said, whither ye made road day? david said, south judah, south jerahmeelites, south kenites. david saved neither man woman alive, bring [tidings] gath, saying, lest tell us, saying, david, [will be] manner dwelleth country philistines. achish believed david, saying, hath made people israel utterly abhor him; therefore shall servant ever. came pass days, philistines gathered armies together warfare, fight israel. achish said unto david, know thou assuredly, thou shalt go battle, thou thy men. david said achish, surely thou shalt know thy servant do. achish said david, therefore make thee keeper mine head ever. samuel dead, israel lamented him, buried ramah, even city. saul put away familiar spirits, wizards, land. philistines gathered together, came pitched shunem: saul gathered israel together, pitched gilboa. saul saw host philistines,1 samuel page 176 afraid, heart greatly trembled. saul enquired lord, lord answered not, neither dreams urim, prophets. said saul unto servants, seek woman hath familiar spirit, may go her, enquire her. servants said him, behold, [there is] woman hath familiar spirit endor. saul disguised himself, put raiment, went, two men him, came woman night: said, pray thee, divine unto familiar spirit, bring [him] up, shall name unto thee. woman said unto him, behold, thou knowest saul hath done, hath cut familiar spirits, wizards, land: wherefore layest thou snare life, cause die? saul sware lord, saying, [as] lord liveth, shall punishment happen thee thing. said woman, shall bring unto thee? said, bring samuel. woman saw samuel, cried loud voice: woman spake saul, saying, hast thou deceived me? thou [art] saul. king said unto her, afraid: sawest thou? woman said unto saul, saw gods ascending earth. said unto her, form [is] of? said, old man cometh up; [is] covered mantle. saul perceived [was] samuel, stooped [his] face ground, bowed himself. samuel said saul, hast thou disquieted me, bring up? saul answered, sore distressed; philistines make war me, god departed me, answereth more, neither prophets, dreams: therefore called thee, thou mayest make known unto shall do. said samuel, wherefore dost thou ask me, seeing lord departed thee, become thine enemy? lord hath done him, spake me: lord hath rent kingdom thine hand, given thy neighbour, [even] david: thou obeyedst voice lord, executedst fierce wrath upon amalek, therefore hath lord done thing unto thee day. moreover lord also deliver israel thee hand philistines: morrow [shalt] thou thy sons [be] me: lord also shall deliver host israel hand philistines. saul fell straightway along earth, sore afraid, words samuel: strength him; eaten bread day, night. woman came unto saul, saw sore troubled, said unto him, behold, thine handmaid hath obeyed thy voice, put life hand, hearkened unto thy words thou spakest unto me. therefore, pray thee, hearken thou also unto voice thine handmaid, let set morsel bread thee; eat, thou mayest strength, thou goest thy way. refused, said, eat. servants, together woman, compelled him; hearkened unto voice. arose earth, sat upon bed. woman fat calf house; hasted, killed it, took flour, kneaded [it,] bake unleavened bread thereof: brought [it] saul, servants; andthey eat. rose up, went away night. philistines gathered together armies aphek: israelites pitched fountain [is] jezreel. lords philistines passed hundreds, thousands: david men passed rereward achish. said princes philistines, [do] hebrews [here?] achish said unto princes philistines, [is] david, servant saul king israel, hath days, years, found fault since fell [unto me] unto day? princes philistines wroth him; princes philistines said unto him, make fellow return, may go place thou hast appointed him, let go us battle, lest battle adversary us: wherewith reconcile unto master? [should it] [be] heads men? [is] david, sang one another dances, saying, saul slew thousands, david ten thousands? achish called david, said unto him, surely, [as] lord liveth, thou hast upright, thy going thy coming host [is] good sight: found evil thee since day thy coming unto unto day: nevertheless lords favour thee not. wherefore return, go peace, thou displease lords philistines. david said unto achish, done? hast thou found thy servant long thee unto day, may go fight enemies lord king? achish answered said david, know thou [art] good sight, angel god: notwithstanding princes philistines said, shall go us battle. wherefore rise early morning thy master's servants come thee: soon ye early morning, light, depart. david men rose early depart morning, return land philistines. philistines went jezreel. came pass, david men come ziklag third day, amalekites invaded south, ziklag, smitten ziklag, burned fire; taken women captives, [were] therein: slew any, either great small, carried [them] away, went way. david men came city, and, behold, burned fire; wives, sons, daughters, taken captives. david people [were] lifted voice wept, power weep. david's two wives taken captives, ahinoam jezreelitess, abigail wife nabal carmelite. david greatly distressed; people spake stoning him, soul people grieved, every man sons daughters: david encouraged lord god. david said abiathar priest, ahimelech's son, pray thee, bring hither ephod. abiathar brought thither ephod david. david enquired lord, saying, shall pursue troop? shall overtake them? answered him, pursue: thou shalt surely overtake [them,]page 177 1 samuel without fail recover [all. ] david went, six hundred men [were] him, came brook besor, left behind stayed. david pursued, four hundred men: two hundred abode behind, faint could go brook besor. found egyptian field, brought david, gave bread, eat; made drink water; gave piece cake figs, two clusters raisins: eaten, spirit came him: eaten bread, drunk [any] water, three days three nights. david said unto him, [belongest] thou? whence art thou? said, [am] young man egypt, servant amalekite; master left me, three days agone fell sick. made invasion [upon] south cherethites, upon [the coast] [belongeth] judah, upon south caleb; burned ziklag fire. david said him, canst thou bring company? said, swear unto god, thou wilt neither kill me, deliver hands master, bring thee company. brought down, behold, [they were] spread abroad upon earth, eating drinking, dancing, great spoil taken land philistines, land judah. david smote twilight even unto evening next day: escaped man them, save four hundred young men, rode upon camels, fled. david recovered amalekites carried away: david rescued two wives. nothing lacking them, neither small great, neither sons daughters, neither spoil, [thing] taken them: david recovered all. david took flocks herds, [which] drave [other] cattle, said, [is] david's spoil. david came two hundred men, faint could follow david, made also abide brook besor: went forth meet david, meet people [were] him: david came near people, saluted them. answered wicked men [men] belial, went david, said, went us, give [ought] spoil recovered, save every man wife children, may lead [them] away, depart. said david, ye shall so, brethren, lord hath given us, hath preserved us, delivered company came us hand. hearken unto matter? part [is] goeth battle, [shall] part [be] tarrieth stuff: shall part alike. [so] day forward, made statute ordinance israel unto day. david came ziklag, sent spoil unto elders judah, [even] friends, saying, behold present spoil enemies lord; [them] [were] bethel, [them] [were] south ramoth, [them] [were] jattir, [them] [were] aroer, [them] [were] siphmoth, [them] [were] eshtemoa, [them]which [were] rachal, [them] [were] cities jerahmeelites, [them] [were] cities kenites, [them] [were] hormah, [them] [were] chor- ashan, [them] [were] athach, [them] [were] hebron, places david men wont haunt. philistines fought israel: men israel fled philistines, fell slain mount gilboa. philistines followed hard upon saul upon sons; philistines slew jonathan, abinadab, melchi-shua, saul's sons. battle went sore saul, archers hit him; sore wounded archers. said saul unto armourbearer, draw thy sword, thrust therewith; lest uncircumcised come thrust through, abuse me. armourbearer would not; sore afraid. therefore saul took sword, fell upon it. armourbearer saw saul dead, fell likewise upon sword, died him. saul died, three sons, armourbearer, men, day together. men israel [were] side valley, [they] [were] side jordan, saw men israel fled, saul sons dead, forsook cities, fled; philistines came dwelt them. came pass morrow, philistines came strip slain, found saul three sons fallen mount gilboa. cut head, stripped armour, sent land philistines round about, publish [it in] house idols, among people. put armour house ashtaroth: fastened body wall beth-shan. inhabitants jabesh-gilead heard philistines done saul; valiant men arose, went night, took body saul bodies sons wall beth- shan, came jabesh, burnt there. took bones, buried [them] tree jabesh, fasted seven days.page 179 2 samuel second book samuel otherwise called second book kings came pass death saul, david returned slaughter amalekites, david abode two days ziklag; came even pass third day, that, behold, man came camp saul clothes rent, earth upon head: [so] was, came david, fell earth, obeisance. david said unto him, whence comest thou? said unto him, camp israel escaped. david said unto him, went matter? pray thee, tell me. answered, people fled battle, many people also fallen dead; saul jonathan son dead also. david said unto young man told him, knowest thou saul jonathan son dead? young man told said, happened chance upon mount gilboa, behold, saul leaned upon spear; and, lo, chariots horsemen followed hard him. looked behind him, saw me, called unto me. answered, [am] i. said unto me, [art] thou? answered him, [am] amalekite. said unto again, stand, pray thee, upon me, slay me: anguish come upon me, life [is] yet whole me. stood upon him, slew him, sure could live fallen: took crown [was] upon head, bracelet [was] arm, brought hither unto lord. david took hold clothes, rent them; likewise men [were] him: mourned, wept, fasted even, saul, jonathan son, people lord, house israel; fallen sword. david said unto young man told him, whence [art] thou? answered, [am] son stranger, amalekite. david said unto him, wast thou afraid stretch forth thine hand destroy lord's anointed? david called one young men, said, go near, [and] fall upon him. smote died. david said unto him, thy blood [be] upon thy head; thy mouth hath testified thee, saying, slain lord's anointed. david lamented lamentation saul jonathan son: (also bade teach children judah [the use of] bow: behold, written book jasher.) beauty israel slain upon thy high places: mighty fallen! tell [it] gath, publish [it] streets askelon; lest daughters philistines rejoice, lest daughters uncircumcised triumph. ye mountains gilboa, [let be] dew, neither [let be] rain, upon you, fields offerings: shield mighty vilely cast away, shield saul, [as though had] [been] anointed oil. blood slain, fat mighty, bow jonathan turned back, sword saul returned empty. saul jonathan [were] lovely pleasant lives, death divided: swifter eagles, stronger lions. ye daughters israel, weep saul, clothed scarlet, [other] delights, put onornaments gold upon apparel. mighty fallen midst battle! jonathan, [thou wast] slain thine high places. distressed thee, brother jonathan: pleasant hast thou unto me: thy love wonderful, passing love women. mighty fallen, weapons war perished! came pass this, david enquired lord, saying, shall go cities judah? lord said unto him, go up. david said, whither shall go up? said, unto hebron. david went thither, two wives also, ahinoam jezreelitess, abigail nabal's wife carmelite. men [were] david bring up, every man household: dwelt cities hebron. men judah came, anointed david king house judah. told david, saying, [that] men jabesh-gilead [were they] buried saul. david sent messengers unto men jabesh- gilead, said unto them, blessed [be] ye lord, ye shewed kindness unto lord, [even] unto saul, buried him. lord shew kindness truth unto you: also requite kindness, ye done thing. therefore let hands strengthened, ye valiant: master saul dead, also house judah anointed king them. abner son ner, captain saul's host, took ish-bosheth son saul, brought mahanaim; made king gilead, ashurites, jezreel, ephraim, benjamin, israel. ish-bosheth saul's son [was] forty years old began reign israel, reigned two years. house judah followed david. time david king hebron house judah seven years six months. abner son ner, servants ish- bosheth son saul, went mahanaim gibeon. joab son zeruiah, servants david, went out, met together pool gibeon: sat down, one one side pool, side pool. abner said joab, let young men arise, play us. joab said, let arise. arose went number twelve benjamin, [pertained] ish-bosheth son saul, twelve servants david. caught every one fellow head, [thrust] sword fellow's side; fell together: wherefore place called helkath-hazzurim, [is] gibeon. sore battle day; abner beaten, men israel, servants david. three sons zeruiah there, joab, abishai, asahel: asahel [was as] light foot wild roe. asahel pursued abner; going turned right hand left following abner. abner looked behind him, said, [art] thou asahel? answered, [am. ] abner said him, turn thee aside thy right hand thy left, lay thee hold one young men, take thee armour. asahel would turn aside following him. abner said asahel, turn thee aside following me: wherefore2 samuel page 180 smite thee ground? hold face joab thy brother? howbeit refused turn aside: wherefore abner hinder end spear smote fifth [rib,] spear came behind him; fell there, died place: came pass, [that] many came place asahel fell died stood still. joab also abishai pursued abner: sun went come hill ammah, [lieth] giah way wilderness gibeon. children benjamin gathered together abner, became one troop, stood top hill. abner called joab, said, shall sword devour ever? knowest thou bitterness latter end? long shall then, ere thou bid people return following brethren? joab said, [as] god liveth, unless thou hadst spoken, surely morning people gone every one following brother. joab blew trumpet, people stood still, pursued israel more, neither fought more. abner men walked night plain, passed jordan, went bithron, came mahanaim. joab returned following abner: gathered people together, lacked david's servants nineteen men asahel. servants david smitten benjamin, abner's men, [so that] three hundred threescore men died. took asahel, buried sepulchre father, [was in] bethlehem. joab men went night, came hebron break day. long war house saul house david: david waxed stronger stronger, house saul waxed weaker weaker. unto david sons born hebron: firstborn amnon, ahinoam jezreelitess; second, chileab, abigail wife nabal carmelite; third, absalom son maacah daughter talmai king geshur; fourth, adonijah son haggith; fifth, shephatiah son abital; sixth, ithream, eglah david's wife. born david hebron. came pass, war house saul house david, abner made strong house saul. saul concubine, whose name [was] rizpah, daughter aiah: [ish-bosheth] said abner, wherefore hast thou gone unto father's concubine? abner wroth words ish-bosheth, said, [am] dog's head, judah shew kindness day unto house saul thy father, brethren, friends, delivered thee hand david, thou chargest day fault concerning woman? god abner, also, except, lord hath sworn david, even him; translate kingdom house saul, set throne david israel judah, dan even beer-sheba. could answer abner word again, feared him. abner sent messengers david hisbehalf, saying, whose [is] land? saying [also,] make thy league me, and, behold, hand [shall be] thee, bring israel unto thee. said, well; make league thee: one thing require thee, is, thou shalt see face, except thou first bring michal saul's daughter, thou comest see face. david sent messengers ish-bosheth saul's son, saying, deliver [me] wife michal, espoused hundred foreskins philistines. ish-bosheth sent, took [her] husband, [even] phaltiel son laish. husband went along weeping behind bahurim. said abner unto him, go, return. returned. abner communication elders israel, saying, ye sought david times past [to be] king you: [it:] lord hath spoken david, saying, hand servant david save people israel hand philistines, hand enemies. abner also spake ears benjamin: abner went also speak ears david hebron seemed good israel, seemed good whole house benjamin. abner came david hebron, twenty men him. david made abner men [were] feast. abner said unto david, arise go, gather israel unto lord king, may make league thee, thou mayest reign thine heart desireth. david sent abner away; went peace. and, behold, servants david joab came [pursuing] troop, brought great spoil them: abner [was] david hebron; sent away, gone peace. joab host [was] come, told joab, saying, abner son ner came king, hath sent away, gone peace. joab came king, said, hast thou done? behold, abner came unto thee; [is] [that] thou hast sent away, quite gone? thou knowest abner son ner, came deceive thee, know thy going thy coming in, know thou doest. joab come david, sent messengers abner, brought well sirah: david knew [it] not. abner returned hebron, joab took aside gate speak quietly, smote fifth [rib,] died, blood asahel brother. afterward david heard [it,] said, kingdom [are] guiltless lord ever blood abner son ner: let rest head joab, father's house; let fail house joab one hath issue, leper, leaneth staff, falleth sword, lacketh bread. joab abishai brother slew abner, slain brother asahel gibeon battle. david said joab, people [were] him, rend clothes, gird sackcloth, mourn abner. king david [himself] followed bier. buried abner hebron: king lifted voice, wept grave abner; people wept.page 181 2 samuel king lamented abner, said, died abner fool dieth? thy hands [were] bound, thy feet put fetters: man falleth wicked men, [so] fellest thou. people wept him. people came cause david eat meat yet day, david sware, saying, god me, also, taste bread, ought else, till sun down. people took notice [of it,] pleased them: whatsoever king pleased people. people israel understood day king slay abner son ner. king said unto servants, know ye prince great man fallen day israel? [am] day weak, though anointed king; men sons zeruiah [be] hard me: lord shall reward doer evil according wickedness. saul's son heard abner dead hebron, hands feeble, israelites troubled. saul's son two men [that were] captains bands: name one [was] baanah, name rechab, sons rimmon beerothite, children benjamin: (for beeroth also reckoned benjamin: beerothites fled gittaim, sojourners day.) jonathan, saul's son, son [that was] lame [his] feet. five years old tidings came saul jonathan jezreel, nurse took up, fled: came pass, made haste flee, fell, became lame. name [was] mephibosheth. sons rimmon beerothite, rechab baanah, went, came heat day house ish-bosheth, lay bed noon. came thither midst house, [as though] would fetched wheat; smote fifth [rib:] rechab baanah brother escaped. came house, lay bed bedchamber, smote him, slew him, beheaded him, took head, gat away plain night. brought head ish-bosheth unto david hebron, said king, behold head ish-bosheth son saul thine enemy, sought thy life; lord hath avenged lord king day saul, seed. david answered rechab baanah brother, sons rimmon beerothite, said unto them, lord liveth, hath redeemed soul adversity, one told me, saying, behold, saul dead, thinking brought good tidings, took hold him, slew ziklag, [thought] would given reward tidings: much more, wicked men slain righteous person house upon bed? shall therefore require blood hand, take away earth? david commanded young men, slew them, cut hands feet, hanged [them] pool hebron. took head ish-bosheth, buried [it] sepulchre abner hebron. came tribes israel david unto hebron, spake, saying, behold, [are] thy bone thy flesh. also time past, saul king us, thou wast leddest broughtest israel: lord said thee, thou shalt feed people israel, thou shalt captain israel. elders israel came king hebron; kingdavid made league hebron lord: anointed david king israel. david [was] thirty years old began reign, [and] reigned forty years. hebron reigned judah seven years six months: jerusalem reigned thirty three years israel judah. king men went jerusalem unto jebusites, inhabitants land: spake unto david, saying, except thou take away blind lame, thou shalt come hither: thinking, david cannot come hither. nevertheless david took strong hold zion: [is] city david. david said day, whosoever getteth gutter, smiteth jebusites, lame blind, [that are] hated david's soul, [he shall chief captain.] wherefore said, blind lame shall come house. david dwelt fort, called city david. david built round millo inward. david went on, grew great, lord god hosts [was] him. hiram king tyre sent messengers david, cedar trees, carpenters, masons: built david house. david perceived lord established king israel, exalted kingdom people israel's sake. david took [him] concubines wives jerusalem, come hebron: yet sons daughters born david. [be] names born unto jerusalem; shammuah, shobab, nathan, solomon, ibhar also, elishua, nepheg, japhia, elishama, eliada, eliphalet. philistines heard anointed david king israel, philistines came seek david; david heard [of it,] went hold. philistines also came spread valley rephaim. david enquired lord, saying, shall go philistines? wilt thou deliver mine hand? lord said unto david, go up: doubtless deliver philistines thine hand. david came baal-perazim, david smote there, said, lord hath broken forth upon mine enemies me, breach waters. therefore called name place baal-perazim. left images, david men burned them. philistines came yet again, spread valley rephaim. david enquired lord, said, thou shalt go up; [but] fetch compass behind them, come upon mulberry trees. let be, thou hearest sound going tops mulberry trees, thou shalt bestir thyself: shall lord go thee, smite host philistines. david so, lord commanded him; smote philistines geba thou come gazer. again, david gathered together [the] chosen [men] israel, thirty thousand. david arose, went people [were] baale judah, bring thence ark god, whose name2 samuel page 182 called name lord hosts dwelleth [between] cherubims. set ark god upon new cart, brought house abinadab [was] gibeah: uzzah ahio, sons abinadab, drave new cart. brought house abinadab [was] gibeah, accompanying ark god: ahio went ark. david house israel played lord manner [instruments made of] fir wood, even harps, psalteries, timbrels, cornets, cymbals. came nachon's threshingfloor, uzzah put forth [his hand] ark god, took hold it; oxen shook [it. ] anger lord kindled uzzah; god smote [his] error; died ark god. david displeased, lord made breach upon uzzah: called name place perez-uzzah day. david afraid lord day, said, shall ark lord come me? david would remove ark lord unto city david: david carried aside house obed-edom gittite. ark lord continued house obed-edom gittite three months: lord blessed obed-edom, household. told king david, saying, lord hath blessed house obed- edom, [pertaineth] unto him, ark god. david went brought ark god house obed- edom city david gladness. [so,] bare ark lord gone six paces, sacrificed oxen fatlings. david danced lord [his] might; david [was] girded linen ephod. david house israel brought ark lord shouting, sound trumpet. ark lord came city david, michal saul's daughter looked window, saw king david leaping dancing lord; despised heart. brought ark lord, set place, midst tabernacle david pitched it: david offered burnt offerings peace offerings lord. soon david made end offering burnt offerings peace offerings, blessed people name lord hosts. dealt among people, [even] among whole multitude israel, well women men, every one cake bread, good piece [of flesh,] flagon [of wine.] people departed every one house. david returned bless household. michal daughter saul came meet david, said, glorious king israel today, uncovered day eyes handmaids servants, one vain fellows shamelessly uncovereth himself! david said unto michal, [it was] lord, chose thy father, house, appoint ruler people lord, israel: therefore play lord. yet vile thus, base mine sight: maidservants thou hast spoken of, shall honour. therefore michal daughter saul childunto day death. came pass, king sat house, lord given rest round enemies; king said unto nathan prophet, see now, dwell house cedar, ark god dwelleth within curtains. nathan said king, go, [is] thine heart; lord [is] thee. came pass night, word lord came unto nathan, saying, go tell servant david, thus saith lord, shalt thou build house dwell in? whereas dwelt [any] house since time brought children israel egypt, even day, walked tent tabernacle. [the places] wherein walked children israel spake word tribes israel, commanded feed people israel, saying, build ye house cedar? therefore shalt thou say unto servant david, thus saith lord hosts, took thee sheepcote, following sheep, ruler people, israel: thee whithersoever thou wentest, cut thine enemies thy sight, made thee great name, like unto name great [men] [are] earth. moreover appoint place people israel, plant them, may dwell place own, move more; neither shall children wickedness afflict more, beforetime, since time commanded judges [to be] people israel, caused thee rest thine enemies. also lord telleth thee make thee house. thy days fulfilled, thou shalt sleep thy fathers, set thy seed thee, shall proceed thy bowels, establish kingdom. shall build house name, stablish throne kingdom ever. father, shall son. commit iniquity, chasten rod men, stripes children men: mercy shall depart away him, took [it] saul, put away thee. thine house thy kingdom shall established ever thee: thy throne shall established ever. according words, according vision, nathan speak unto david. went king david in, sat lord, said, [am] i, lord god? [is] house, thou hast brought hitherto? yet small thing thy sight, lord god; thou hast spoken also thy servant's house great come. [is] manner man, lord god? david say unto thee? thou, lord god, knowest thy servant. thy word's sake, according thine heart, hast thou done great things, make thy servant know [them. ] wherefore thou art great, lord god: [there is] none like thee, neither [is any] god beside thee, according heard ears. one nation earth [is] like thy people, [even] like israel, god went redeem people himself, make name, great things terrible, thy land, thy people, thou redeemedst thee egypt, [from] nationspage 183 2 samuel gods? thou hast confirmed thyself thy people israel [to be] people unto thee ever: thou, lord, art become god. now, lord god, word thou hast spoken concerning thy servant, concerning house, establish [it] ever, thou hast said. let thy name magnified ever, saying, lord hosts [is] god israel: let house thy servant david established thee. thou, lord hosts, god israel, hast revealed thy servant, saying, build thee house: therefore hath thy servant found heart pray prayer unto thee. now, lord god, thou [art] god, thy words true, thou hast promised goodness unto thy servant: therefore let please thee bless house thy servant, may continue ever thee: thou, lord god, hast spoken [it:] thy blessing let house thy servant blessed ever. came pass, david smote philistines, subdued them: david took metheg- ammah hand philistines. smote moab, measured line, casting ground; even two lines measured put death, one full line keep alive. moabites became david's servants, [and] brought gifts. david smote also hadadezer, son rehob, king zobah, went recover border river euphrates. david took thousand [chariots,] seven hundred horsemen, twenty thousand footmen: david houghed chariot [horses,] reserved [for] hundred chariots. syrians damascus came succour hadadezer king zobah, david slew syrians two twenty thousand men. david put garrisons syria damascus: syrians became servants david, [and] brought gifts. lord preserved david whithersoever went. david took shields gold servants hadadezer, brought jerusalem. betah, berothai, cities hadadezer, king david took exceeding much brass. toi king hamath heard david smitten host hadadezer, toi sent joram son unto king david, salute him, bless him, fought hadadezer, smitten him: hadadezer wars toi. [joram] brought vessels silver, vessels gold, vessels brass: also king david dedicate unto lord, silver gold dedicated nations subdued; syria, moab, children ammon, philistines, amalek, spoil hadadezer, son rehob, king zobah. david gat [him] name returned smiting syrians valley salt, [being] eighteen thousand [men. ] put garrisons edom; throughout edom put garrisons, edom became david's servants. lord preserved david whithersoever went. david reigned israel; david executed judgment justice unto people. joab son zeruiah [was] host; jehoshaphat son ahilud [was] recorder; zadok son ahitub, ahimelech son abiathar, [were] priests; seraiah [was] scribe; benaiah son jehoiada [was over]both cherethites pelethites; david's sons chief rulers. david said, yet left house saul, may shew kindness jonathan's sake? [there was] house saul servant whose name [was] ziba. called unto david, king said unto him, [art] thou ziba? said, thy servant [is he. ] king said, [is] yet house saul, may shew kindness god unto him? ziba said unto king, jonathan hath yet son, [which is] lame [his] feet. king said unto him, [is] he? ziba said unto king, behold, [is] house machir, son ammiel, lo-debar. king david sent, fetched house machir, son ammiel, lo-debar. mephibosheth, son jonathan, son saul, come unto david, fell face, reverence. david said, mephibosheth. answered, behold thy servant! david said unto him, fear not: surely shew thee kindness jonathan thy father's sake, restore thee land saul thy father; thou shalt eat bread table continually. bowed himself, said, thy servant, thou shouldest look upon dead dog [am? ] king called ziba, saul's servant, said unto him, given unto thy master's son pertained saul house. thou therefore, thy sons, thy servants, shall till land him, thou shalt bring [the fruits,] thy master's son may food eat: mephibosheth thy master's son shall eat bread alway table. ziba fifteen sons twenty servants. said ziba unto king, according lord king hath commanded servant, shall thy servant do. mephibosheth, [said king,] shall eat table, one king's sons. mephibosheth young son, whose name [was] micha. dwelt house ziba [were] servants unto mephibosheth. mephibosheth dwelt jerusalem: eat continually king's table; lame feet. came pass this, king children ammon died, hanun son reigned stead. said david, shew kindness unto hanun son nahash, father shewed kindness unto me. david sent comfort hand servants father. david's servants came land children ammon. princes children ammon said unto hanun lord, thinkest thou david doth honour thy father, hath sent comforters unto thee? hath david [rather] sent servants unto thee, search city, spy out, overthrow it? wherefore hanun took david's servants, shaved one half beards, cut garments middle, [even] buttocks, sent away. told [it] unto david, sent meet them, men greatly ashamed: king said, tarry jericho beards grown, [then] return. children ammon saw stank david, children ammon sent hired2 samuel page 184 syrians beth-rehob, syrians zoba, twenty thousand footmen, king maacah thousand men, ish-tob twelve thousand men. david heard [it,] sent joab, host mighty men. children ammon came out, put battle array entering gate: syrians zoba, rehob, ish-tob, maacah, [were] field. joab saw front battle behind, chose choice [men] israel, put [them] array syrians: rest people delivered hand abishai brother, might put [them] array children ammon. said, syrians strong me, thou shalt help me: children ammon strong thee, come help thee. good courage, let us play men people, cities god: lord seemeth good. joab drew nigh, people [were] him, unto battle syrians: fled him. children ammon saw syrians fled, fled also abishai, entered city. joab returned children ammon, came jerusalem. syrians saw smitten israel, gathered together. hadarezer sent, brought syrians [were] beyond river: came helam; shobach captain host hadarezer [went] them. told david, gathered israel together, passed jordan, came helam. syrians set array david, fought him. syrians fled israel; david slew [the men of] seven hundred chariots syrians, forty thousand horsemen, smote shobach captain host, died there. kings [that were] servants hadarezer saw smitten israel, made peace israel, served them. syrians feared help children ammon more. came pass, year expired, time kings go forth [to battle,] david sent joab, servants him, israel; destroyed children ammon, besieged rabbah. david tarried still jerusalem. came pass eveningtide, david arose bed, walked upon roof king's house: roof saw woman washing herself; woman [was] beautiful look upon. david sent enquired woman. [one] said, [is] bath-sheba, daughter eliam, wife uriah hittite? david sent messengers, took her; came unto him, lay her; purified uncleanness: returned unto house. woman conceived, sent told david, said, [am] child. david sent joab, [saying,] send uriah hittite. joab sent uriah david. uriah come unto him, david demanded [of him] joab did, people did, war prospered. david said uriah, go thy house, wash thy feet. uriah departed king's house, followed mess [of meat] fromthe king. uriah slept door king's house servants lord, went house. told david, saying, uriah went unto house, david said unto uriah, camest thou [thy] journey? [then] didst thou go unto thine house? uriah said unto david, ark, israel, judah, abide tents; lord joab, servants lord, encamped open fields; shall go mine house, eat drink, lie wife? [as] thou livest, [as] thy soul liveth, thing. david said uriah, tarry day also, morrow let thee depart. uriah abode jerusalem day, morrow. david called him, eat drink him; made drunk: even went lie bed servants lord, went house. came pass morning, david wrote letter joab, sent [it] hand uriah. wrote letter, saying, set ye uriah forefront hottest battle, retire ye him, may smitten, die. came pass, joab observed city, assigned uriah unto place knew valiant men [were. ] men city went out, fought joab: fell [some] people servants david; uriah hittite died also. joab sent told david things concerning war; charged messenger, saying, thou hast made end telling matters war unto king, king's wrath arise, say unto thee, wherefore approached ye nigh unto city ye fight? knew ye would shoot wall? smote abimelech son jerubbesheth? woman cast piece millstone upon wall, died thebez? went ye nigh wall? say thou, thy servant uriah hittite dead also. messenger went, came shewed david joab sent for. messenger said unto david, surely men prevailed us, came unto us field, upon even unto entering gate. shooters shot wall upon thy servants; [some] king's servants dead, thy servant uriah hittite dead also. david said unto messenger, thus shalt thou say unto joab, let thing displease thee, sword devoureth one well another: make thy battle strong city, overthrow it: encourage thou him. wife uriah heard uriah husband dead, mourned husband. mourning past, david sent fetched house, became wife, bare son. thing david done displeased lord. lord sent nathan unto david. came unto him, said unto him, two men one city; one rich, poor. rich [man] exceeding many flocks herds: poor [man] nothing, save one little ewe lamb, bought nourished up: grew together him, children; eat meat, drank cup, lay bosom, untopage 185 2 samuel daughter. came traveller unto rich man, spared take flock herd, dress wayfaring man come unto him; took poor man's lamb, dressed man come him. david's anger greatly kindled man; said nathan, lord liveth, man hath done [thing] shall surely die: shall restore lamb fourfold, thing, pity. nathan said david, thou [art] man. thus saith lord god israel, anointed thee king israel, delivered thee hand saul; gave thee thy master's house, thy master's wives thy bosom, gave thee house israel judah; [that been] little, would moreover given unto thee things. wherefore hast thou despised commandment lord, evil sight? thou hast killed uriah hittite sword, hast taken wife [to be] thy wife, hast slain sword children ammon. therefore sword shall never depart thine house; thou hast despised me, hast taken wife uriah hittite thy wife. thus saith lord, behold, raise evil thee thine house, take thy wives thine eyes, give [them] unto thy neighbour, shall lie thy wives sight sun. thou didst [it] secretly: thing israel, sun. david said unto nathan, sinned lord. nathan said unto david, lord also hath put away thy sin; thou shalt die. howbeit, deed thou hast given great occasion enemies lord blaspheme, child also [that is] born unto thee shall surely die. nathan departed unto house. lord struck child uriah's wife bare unto david, sick. david therefore besought god child; david fasted, went in, lay night upon earth. elders house arose, [and went] him, raise earth: would not, neither eat bread them. came pass seventh day, child died. servants david feared tell child dead: said, behold, child yet alive, spake unto him, would hearken unto voice: vex himself, tell child dead? david saw servants whispered, david perceived child dead: therefore david said unto servants, child dead? said, dead. david arose earth, washed, anointed [himself,] changed apparel, came house lord, worshipped: came house; required, set bread him, eat. said servants unto him, thing [is] thou hast done? thou didst fast weep child, [while was] alive; child dead, thou didst rise eat bread. said, child yet alive, fasted wept: said, tell [whether] god gracious me, child may live? dead, wherefore fast? bring back again? shall go him, shall return me. david comforted bath-sheba wife, andwent unto her, lay her: bare son, called name solomon: lord loved him. sent hand nathan prophet; called name jedidiah, lord. joab fought rabbah children ammon, took royal city. joab sent messengers david, said, fought rabbah, taken city waters. therefore gather rest people together, encamp city, take it: lest take city, called name. david gathered people together, went rabbah, fought it, took it. took king's crown head, weight whereof [was] talent gold precious stones: [set] david's head. brought forth spoil city great abundance. brought forth people [were] therein, put [them] saws, harrows iron, axes iron, made pass brickkiln: thus unto cities children ammon. david people returned unto jerusalem. came pass this, absalom son david fair sister, whose name [was] tamar; amnon son david loved her. amnon vexed, fell sick sister tamar; [was] virgin; amnon thought hard thing her. amnon friend, whose name [was] jonadab, son shimeah david's brother: jonadab [was] subtil man. said unto him, [art] thou, [being] king's son, lean day day? wilt thou tell me? amnon said unto him, love tamar, brother absalom's sister. jonadab said unto him, lay thee thy bed, make thyself sick: thy father cometh see thee, say unto him, pray thee, let sister tamar come, give meat, dress meat sight, may see [it,] eat [it] hand. amnon lay down, made sick: king come see him, amnon said unto king, pray thee, let tamar sister come, make couple cakes sight, may eat hand. david sent home tamar, saying, go thy brother amnon's house, dress meat. tamar went brother amnon's house; laid down. took flour, kneaded [it,] made cakes sight, bake cakes. took pan, poured [them] him; refused eat. amnon said, men me. went every man him. amnon said unto tamar, bring meat chamber, may eat thine hand. tamar took cakes made, brought [them] chamber amnon brother. brought [them] unto eat, took hold her, said unto her, come lie me, sister. answered him, nay, brother, force me; thing ought done israel: thou folly. i, whither shall cause shame go? thee, thou shalt one fools israel. therefore, pray thee, speak unto king; withhold thee. howbeit would hearken unto voice: but, stronger she, forced her, lay her. amnon hated exceedingly; hatred wherewith hated [was] greater love2 samuel page 186 wherewith loved her. amnon said unto her, arise, gone. said unto him, [there is] cause: evil sending away [is] greater thou didst unto me. would hearken unto her. called servant ministered unto him, said, put [woman] me, bolt door her. [she had] garment divers colours upon her: robes king's daughters [that were] virgins apparelled. servant brought out, bolted door her. tamar put ashes head, rent garment divers colours [was] her, laid hand head, went crying. absalom brother said unto her, hath amnon thy brother thee? hold thy peace, sister: [is] thy brother; regard thing. tamar remained desolate brother absalom's house. king david heard things, wroth. absalom spake unto brother amnon neither good bad: absalom hated amnon, forced sister tamar. came pass two full years, absalom sheepshearers baal- hazor, [is] beside ephraim: absalom invited king's sons. absalom came king, said, behold now, thy servant hath sheepshearers; let king, beseech thee, servants go thy servant. king said absalom, nay, son, let us go, lest chargeable unto thee. pressed him: howbeit would go, blessed him. said absalom, not, pray thee, let brother amnon go us. king said unto him, go thee? absalom pressed him, let amnon king's sons go him. absalom commanded servants, saying, mark ye amnon's heart merry wine, say unto you, smite amnon; kill him, fear not: commanded you? courageous valiant. servants absalom unto amnon absalom commanded. king's sons arose, every man gat upon mule, fled. came pass, way, tidings came david, saying, absalom hath slain king's sons, one left. king arose, tare garments, lay earth; servants stood clothes rent. jonadab, son shimeah david's brother, answered said, let lord suppose [that] slain young men king's sons; amnon dead: appointment absalom hath determined day forced sister tamar. therefore let lord king take thing heart, think king's sons dead: amnon dead. absalom fled. young man kept watch lifted eyes, looked, and, behold, came much people way hill side behind him. jonadab said unto king, behold, king's sons come: thy servant said, is. came pass, soon made end speaking, that, behold, king's sons came, lifted voice wept: king also servants wept sore. absalom fled, went talmai, son ammihud, king geshur. [david] mourned son every day. absalom fled, went geshur, three years. [the soul of] king david longed go forth unto absalom: comforted concerning amnon, seeing dead. joab son zeruiah perceived king's heart [was] toward absalom. joab sent tekoah, fetched thence wise woman, said unto her, pray thee, feign thyself mourner, put mourning apparel, anoint thyself oil, woman long time mourned dead: come king, speak manner unto him. joab put words mouth. woman tekoah spake king, fell face ground, obeisance, said, help, king. king said unto her, aileth thee? answered, [am] indeed widow woman, mine husband dead. thy handmaid two sons, two strove together field, [there was] none part them, one smote other, slew him. and, behold, whole family risen thine handmaid, said, deliver smote brother, may kill him, life brother slew; destroy heir also: shall quench coal left, shall leave husband [neither] name remainder upon earth. king said unto woman, go thine house, give charge concerning thee. woman tekoah said unto king, lord, king, iniquity [be] me, father's house: king throne [be] guiltless. king said, whosoever saith [ought] unto thee, bring me, shall touch thee more. said she, pray thee, let king remember lord thy god, thou wouldest suffer revengers blood destroy more, lest destroy son. said, lord liveth, shall one hair thy son fall earth. woman said, let thine handmaid, pray thee, speak [one] word unto lord king. said, say on. woman said, wherefore hast thou thought thing people god? king doth speak thing one faulty, king doth fetch home banished. must needs die, [are] water spilt ground, cannot gathered again; neither doth god respect [any] person: yet doth devise means, banished expelled him. therefore come speak thing unto lord king, [it is] people made afraid: thy handmaid said, speak unto king; may king perform request handmaid. king hear, deliver handmaid hand man [that would] destroy son together inheritance god. thine handmaid said, word lord king shall comfortable: angel god, [is] lord king discern good bad: therefore lord thy god thee. king answered said unto woman, hide me, pray thee, thing shall ask thee. woman said, let lord king speak. king said, [is not] hand joab thee this? woman answered said, [as] thy soul liveth, lord king, none turn right hand left ought lord king hath spoken: thy servant joab, bade me, putpage 187 2 samuel words mouth thine handmaid: fetch form speech hath thy servant joab done thing: lord [is] wise, according wisdom angel god, know [things] [are] earth. king said unto joab, behold now, done thing: go therefore, bring young man absalom again. joab fell ground face, bowed himself, thanked king: joab said, today thy servant knoweth found grace thy sight, lord, king, king hath fulfilled request servant. joab arose went geshur, brought absalom jerusalem. king said, let turn house, let see face. absalom returned house, saw king's face. israel none much praised absalom beauty: sole foot even crown head blemish him. polled head, (for every year's end polled [it:] [the hair] heavy him, therefore polled it:) weighed hair head two hundred shekels king's weight. unto absalom born three sons, one daughter, whose name [was] tamar: woman fair countenance. absalom dwelt two full years jerusalem, saw king's face. therefore absalom sent joab, sent king; would come him: sent second time, would come. therefore said unto servants, see, joab's field near mine, hath barley there; go set fire. absalom's servants set field fire. joab arose, came absalom unto [his] house, said unto him, wherefore thy servants set field fire? absalom answered joab, behold, sent unto thee, saying, come hither, may send thee king, say, wherefore come geshur? [it been] good [to been] still: therefore let see king's face; [any] iniquity me, let kill me. joab came king, told him: called absalom, came king, bowed face ground king: king kissed absalom. came pass this, absalom prepared chariots horses, fifty men run him. absalom rose early, stood beside way gate: so, man controversy came king judgment, absalom called unto him, said, city [art] thou? said, thy servant one tribes israel. absalom said unto him, see, thy matters [are] good right; [there is] man [deputed] king hear thee. absalom said moreover, oh made judge land, every man hath suit cause might come unto me, would justice! [so,] man came nigh [to him] obeisance, put forth hand, took him, kissed him. manner absalom israel came king judgment: absalom stole hearts men israel. came pass forty years, absalom said unto king, pray thee, let go pay vow, vowed unto lord, hebron. forthy servant vowed vow abode geshur syria, saying, lord shall bring indeed jerusalem, serve lord. king said unto him, go peace. arose, went hebron. absalom sent spies throughout tribes israel, saying, soon ye hear sound trumpet, ye shall say, absalom reigneth hebron. absalom went two hundred men jerusalem, [that were] called; went simplicity, knew thing. absalom sent ahithophel gilonite, david's counsellor, city, [even] giloh, offered sacrifices. conspiracy strong; people increased continually absalom. came messenger david, saying, hearts men israel absalom. david said unto servants [were] jerusalem, arise, let us flee; shall [else] escape absalom: make speed depart, lest overtake us suddenly, bring evil upon us, smite city edge sword. king's servants said unto king, behold, thy servants [are ready do] whatsoever lord king shall appoint. king went forth, household him. king left ten women, [which were] concubines, keep house. king went forth, people him, tarried place far off. servants passed beside him; cherethites, pelethites, gittites, six hundred men came gath, passed king. said king ittai gittite, wherefore goest thou also us? return thy place, abide king: thou [art] stranger, also exile. whereas thou camest [but] yesterday, day make thee go us? seeing go whither may, return thou, take back thy brethren: mercy truth [be] thee. ittai answered king, said, [as] lord liveth, [as] lord king liveth, surely place lord king shall be, whether death life, even also thy servant be. david said ittai, go pass over. ittai gittite passed over, men, little ones [were] him. country wept loud voice, people passed over: king also passed brook kidron, people passed over, toward way wilderness. lo zadok also, levites [were] him, bearing ark covenant god: set ark god; abiathar went up, people done passing city. king said unto zadok, carry back ark god city: shall find favour eyes lord, bring again, shew [both] it, habitation: thus say, delight thee; behold, [here am] i, let seemeth good unto him. king said also unto zadok priest, [art not] thou seer? return city peace, two sons you, ahimaaz thy son, jonathan son abiathar. see, tarry plain wilderness, come word certify me. zadok therefore abiathar carried ark god jerusalem: tarried there.2 samuel page 188 david went ascent [mount] olivet, wept went up, head covered, went barefoot: people [was] covered every man head, went up, weeping went up. [one] told david, saying, ahithophel [is] among conspirators absalom. david said, lord, pray thee, turn counsel ahithophel foolishness. came pass, [when] david come top [of mount,] worshipped god, behold, hushai archite came meet coat rent, earth upon head: unto david said, thou passest me, thou shalt burden unto me: thou return city, say unto absalom, thy servant, king; [as] [have been] thy father's servant hitherto, [will] also [be] thy servant: mayest thou defeat counsel ahithophel. [hast thou] thee zadok abiathar priests? therefore shall be, [that] thing soever thou shalt hear king's house, thou shalt tell [it] zadok abiathar priests. behold, [they have] two sons, ahimaaz zadok's [son,] jonathan abiathar's [son;] ye shall send unto every thing ye hear. hushai david's friend came city, absalom came jerusalem. david little past top [of hill,] behold, ziba servant mephibosheth met him, couple asses saddled, upon two hundred [loaves] bread, hundred bunches raisins, hundred summer fruits, bottle wine. king said unto ziba, meanest thou these? ziba said, asses [be] king's household ride on; bread summer fruit young men eat; wine, faint wilderness may drink. king said, [is] thy master's son? ziba said unto king, behold, abideth jerusalem: said, today shall house israel restore kingdom father. said king ziba, behold, thine [are] [pertained] unto mephibosheth. ziba said, humbly beseech thee [that] may find grace thy sight, lord, king. king david came bahurim, behold, thence came man family house saul, whose name [was] shimei, son gera: came forth, cursed still came. cast stones david, servants king david: people mighty men [were] right hand left. thus said shimei cursed, come out, come out, thou bloody man, thou man belial: lord hath returned upon thee blood house saul, whose stead thou hast reigned; lord hath delivered kingdom hand absalom thy son: and, behold, thou [art taken] thy mischief, thou [art] bloody man. said abishai son zeruiah unto king, dead dog curse lord king? let go over, pray thee, take head. king said, you, ye sons zeruiah? let curse, lord hath said unto him, curse david. shall say, wherefore hast thou done so? david said abishai, servants, behold, son, came forth bowels,seeketh life: much [may this] benjamite [do it?] let alone, let curse; lord hath bidden him. may lord look mine affliction, lord requite good cursing day. david men went way, shimei went along hill's side him, cursed went, threw stones him, cast dust. king, people [were] him, came weary, refreshed there. absalom, people men israel, came jerusalem, ahithophel him. came pass, hushai archite, david's friend, come unto absalom, hushai said unto absalom, god save king, god save king. absalom said hushai, [is] thy kindness thy friend? wentest thou thy friend? hushai said unto absalom, nay; lord, people, men israel, choose, be, abide. again, serve? [should i] [serve] presence son? served thy father's presence, thy presence. said absalom ahithophel, give counsel among shall do. ahithophel said unto absalom, go unto thy father's concubines, hath left keep house; israel shall hear thou art abhorred thy father: shall hands [are] thee strong. spread absalom tent upon top house; absalom went unto father's concubines sight israel. counsel ahithophel, counselled days, [was] man enquired oracle god: [was] counsel ahithophel david absalom. moreover ahithophel said unto absalom, let choose twelve thousand men, arise pursue david night: come upon [is] weary weak handed, make afraid: people [are] shall flee; smite king only: bring back people unto thee: man thou seekest [is] returned: [so] people shall peace. saying pleased absalom well, elders israel. said absalom, call hushai archite also, let us hear likewise saith. hushai come absalom, absalom spake unto him, saying, ahithophel hath spoken manner: shall [after] saying? not; speak thou. hushai said unto absalom, counsel ahithophel hath given [is] good time. for, said hushai, thou knowest thy father men, [be] mighty men, [be] chafed minds, bear robbed whelps field: thy father [is] man war, lodge people. behold, hid pit, [other] place: come pass, overthrown first, whosoever heareth say, slaughter among people follow absalom. also [that is] valiant, whose heart [is] heart lion, shall utterly melt: israel knoweth thy father [is] mighty man, [they] [be] [are] valiant men. therefore counsel israel generally gathered unto thee, dan even beer- sheba, sand [is] sea multitude; thou go battle thine person. shallpage 189 2 samuel come upon place shall found, light upon dew falleth ground: men [are] shall left much one. moreover, gotten city, shall israel bring ropes city, draw river, one small stone found there. absalom men israel said, counsel hushai archite [is] better counsel ahithophel. lord appointed defeat good counsel ahithophel, intent lord might bring evil upon absalom. said hushai unto zadok abiathar priests, thus thus ahithophel counsel absalom elders israel; thus thus counselled. therefore send quickly, tell david, saying, lodge night plains wilderness, speedily pass over; lest king swallowed up, people [are] him. jonathan ahimaaz stayed en-rogel; might seen come city: wench went told them; went told king david. nevertheless lad saw them, told absalom: went away quickly, came man's house bahurim, well court; whither went down. woman took spread covering well's mouth, spread ground corn thereon; thing known. absalom's servants came woman house, said, ahimaaz jonathan? woman said unto them, gone brook water. sought could find [them,] returned jerusalem. came pass, departed, came well, went told king david, said unto david, arise, pass quickly water: thus hath ahithophel counselled you. david arose, people [were] him, passed jordan: morning light lacked one gone jordan. ahithophel saw counsel followed, saddled [his] ass, arose, gat home house, city, put household order, hanged himself, died, buried sepulchre father. david came mahanaim. absalom passed jordan, men israel him. absalom made amasa captain host instead joab: amasa man's son, whose name [was] ithra israelite, went abigail daughter nahash, sister zeruiah joab's mother. israel absalom pitched land gilead. came pass, david come mahanaim, shobi son nahash rabbah children ammon, machir son ammiel lo- debar, barzillai gileadite rogelim, brought beds, basons, earthen vessels, wheat, barley, flour, parched [corn,] beans, lentiles, parched [pulse, ] honey, butter, sheep, cheese kine, david, people [were] him, eat: said, people [is] hungry, weary, thirsty, wilderness. david numbered people [were] him, set captains thousands captains hundredsover them. david sent forth third part people hand joab, third part hand abishai son zeruiah, joab's brother, third part hand ittai gittite. king said unto people, surely go forth also. people answered, thou shalt go forth: flee away, care us; neither half us die, care us: [thou art] worth ten thousand us: therefore [it is] better thou succour us city. king said unto them, seemeth best do. king stood gate side, people came hundreds thousands. king commanded joab abishai ittai, saying, [deal] gently sake young man, [even] absalom. people heard king gave captains charge concerning absalom. people went field israel: battle wood ephraim; people israel slain servants david, great slaughter day twenty thousand [men. ] battle scattered face country: wood devoured people day sword devoured. absalom met servants david. absalom rode upon mule, mule went thick boughs great oak, head caught hold oak, taken heaven earth; mule [was] went away. certain man saw it, told joab, said, behold, saw absalom hanged oak. joab said unto man told him, and, behold, thou sawest [him,] didst thou smite ground? would given thee ten [shekels] silver, girdle. man said unto joab, though receive thousand [shekels] silver mine hand, yet would put forth mine hand king's son: hearing king charged thee abishai ittai, saying, beware none [touch] young man absalom. otherwise wrought falsehood mine life: matter hid king, thou thyself wouldest set thyself [me. ] said joab, may tarry thus thee. took three darts hand, thrust heart absalom, [was] yet alive midst oak. ten young men bare joab's armour compassed smote absalom, slew him. joab blew trumpet, people returned pursuing israel: joab held back people. took absalom, cast great pit wood, laid great heap stones upon him: israel fled every one tent. absalom lifetime taken reared pillar, [is] king's dale: said, son keep name remembrance: called pillar name: called unto day, absalom's place. said ahimaaz son zadok, let run, bear king tidings, lord hath avenged enemies. joab said unto him, thou shalt bear tidings day, thou shalt bear tidings another day: day thou shalt bear tidings, king's son dead. said joab cushi, go tell king thou hast seen. cushi bowed unto joab, ran. said2 samuel page 190 ahimaaz son zadok yet joab, howsoever, let me, pray thee, also run cushi. joab said, wherefore wilt thou run, son, seeing thou hast tidings ready? howsoever, [said he,] let run. said unto him, run. ahimaaz ran way plain, overran cushi. david sat two gates: watchman went roof gate unto wall, lifted eyes, looked, behold man running alone. watchman cried, told king. king said, [be] alone, [there is] tidings mouth. came apace, drew near. watchman saw another man running: watchman called unto porter, said, behold [another] man running alone. king said, also bringeth tidings. watchman said, thinketh running foremost like running ahimaaz son zadok. king said, [is] good man, cometh good tidings. ahimaaz called, said unto king, well. fell earth upon face king, said, blessed [be] lord thy god, hath delivered men lifted hand lord king. king said, young man absalom safe? ahimaaz answered, joab sent king's servant, [me] thy servant, saw great tumult, knew [it was. ] king said [unto him,] turn aside, [and] stand here. turned aside, stood still. and, behold, cushi came; cushi said, tidings, lord king: lord hath avenged thee day rose thee. king said unto cushi, young man absalom safe? cushi answered, enemies lord king, rise thee [thee] hurt, [that] young man [is. ] king much moved, went chamber gate, wept: went, thus said, son absalom, son, son absalom! would god died thee, absalom, son, son! told joab, behold, king weepeth mourneth absalom. victory day [turned] mourning unto people: people heard say day king grieved son. people gat stealth day city, people ashamed steal away flee battle. king covered face, king cried loud voice, son absalom, absalom, son, son! joab came house king, said, thou hast shamed day faces thy servants, day saved thy life, lives thy sons thy daughters, lives thy wives, lives thy concubines; thou lovest thine enemies, hatest thy friends. thou hast declared day, thou regardest neither princes servants: day perceive, absalom lived, died day, pleased thee well. therefore arise, go forth, speak comfortably unto thy servants: swear lord, thou go forth, tarry one thee night: worse unto thee evil befell thee thy youth now. king arose, sat gate. told unto people, saying, behold, king doth sit gate. people came king: israel fled every man tent. people strife throughout tribes israel, saying, king saved [there were] thousand men benjamin him, ziba servant house saul, fifteen sons twenty servants him; went jordan king. went ferry boat carry king's household, thought good. shimei son gera fell king, come jordan; said unto king, let lord impute iniquity unto me, neither thou remember thy servant perversely day lord king went jerusalem, king take heart. thy servant doth know sinned: therefore, behold, come first day house joseph go meet lord king. abishai son zeruiah answered said, shall shimei put death this, cursed lord's anointed? david said, you, ye sons zeruiah, ye day adversaries unto me? shall man put death day israel? know [am] day king israel? therefore king said unto shimei, thou shalt die. king sware unto him. mephibosheth son saul came meet king, neither dressed feet, trimmed beard, washed clothes, day king departed day came [again] peace. came pass, come jerusalem meet king, king said unto him, wherefore wentest thou me, mephibosheth? answered, lord, king, servant deceived me: thy servant said, saddle ass, may ride thereon, go king; thy servant [is] lame. hath slandered thy servant unto lord king; lord king [is] angel god: therefore [what is] good thine eyes. [of] father's house dead men lord king: yet didst thou set thy servant among eat thine table. right therefore yet cry unto king? king said unto him, speakest thou thy matters? said, thou ziba divide land. mephibosheth said unto king, yea, let take all, forasmuch lord king come peace unto house.page 191 2 samuel barzillai gileadite came rogelim, went jordan king, conduct jordan. barzillai aged man, [even] fourscore years old: provided king sustenance lay mahanaim; [was] great man. king said unto barzillai, come thou me, feed thee jerusalem. barzillai said unto king, long live, go king unto jerusalem? [am] day fourscore years old: [and] discern good evil? thy servant taste eat drink? hear voice singing men singing women? wherefore thy servant yet burden unto lord king? thy servant go little way jordan king: king recompense reward? let thy servant, pray thee, turn back again, may die mine city, [and buried] grave father mother. behold thy servant chimham; let go lord king; shall seem good unto thee. king answered, chimham shall go me, shall seem good unto thee: whatsoever thou shalt require me, [that] thee. people went jordan. king come over, king kissed barzillai, blessed him; returned unto place. king went gilgal, chimham went him: people judah conducted king, also half people israel. and, behold, men israel came king, said unto king, brethren men judah stolen thee away, brought king, household, david's men him, jordan? men judah answered men israel, king [is] near kin us: wherefore ye angry matter? eaten king's [cost?] hath given us gift? men israel answered men judah, said, ten parts king, also [right] david ye: ye despise us, advice first bringing back king? words men judah fiercer words men israel. happened man belial, whose name [was] sheba, son bichri, benjamite: blew trumpet, said, part david, neither inheritance son jesse: every man tents, israel. every man israel went david, [and] followed sheba son bichri: men judah clave unto king, jordan even jerusalem. david came house jerusalem; king took ten women [his] concubines, left keep house, put ward, fed them, went unto them. shut unto day death, living widowhood. said king amasa, assemble men judah within three days, thou present. amasa went assemble [the men of] judah: tarried longer set time appointed him. david said abishai, shall sheba son bichri us harm [did] absalom: take thou thy lord's servants, pursue him, lest get fenced cities, escape us. went outafter joab's men, cherethites, pelethites, mighty men: went jerusalem, pursue sheba son bichri. [were] great stone [is] gibeon, amasa went them. joab's garment put girded unto him, upon girdle [with] sword fastened upon loins sheath thereof; went forth fell out. joab said amasa, [art] thou health, brother? joab took amasa beard right hand kiss him. amasa took heed sword [was] joab's hand: smote therewith fifth [rib,] shed bowels ground, struck again; died. joab abishai brother pursued sheba son bichri. one joab's men stood him, said, favoureth joab, [is] david, [let go] joab. amasa wallowed blood midst highway. man saw people stood still, removed amasa highway field, cast cloth upon him, saw every one came stood still. removed highway, people went joab, pursue sheba son bichri. went tribes israel unto abel, beth-maachah, berites: gathered together, went also him. came besieged abel beth-maachah, cast bank city, stood trench: people [were] joab battered wall, throw down. cried wise woman city, hear, hear; say, pray you, unto joab, come near hither, may speak thee. come near unto her, woman said, [art] thou joab? answered, [am he.] said unto him, hear words thine handmaid. answered, hear. spake, saying, wont speak old time, saying, shall surely ask [counsel] abel: ended [the matter. ] [am one are] peaceable [and] faithful israel: thou seekest destroy city mother israel: wilt thou swallow inheritance lord? joab answered said, far it, far me, swallow destroy. matter [is] so: man mount ephraim, sheba son bichri name, hath lifted hand king, [even] david: deliver only, depart city. woman said unto joab, behold, head shall thrown thee wall. woman went unto people wisdom. cut head sheba son bichri, cast [it] joab. blew trumpet, retired city, every man tent. joab returned jerusalem unto king. joab [was] host israel: benaiah son jehoiada [was] cherethites pelethites: adoram [was] tribute: jehoshaphat son ahilud [was] recorder: sheva [was] scribe: zadok abiathar [were] priests: ira also jairite chief ruler david. famine days david three years, year year; david enquired lord. lord answered, [it is] saul, [his] bloody house, slew gibeonites. king called gibeonites, said unto them; (now2 samuel page 192 gibeonites [were] children israel, remnant amorites;
