[are] ways every one greedy gain; [which] taketh away life owners thereof. wisdom crieth without; uttereth voice streets: crieth chief place concourse, openings gates: city uttereth words, [saying, ] long, ye simple ones, ye love simplicity? scorners delight scorning, fools hate knowledge? turn reproof: behold, pour spirit unto you, make known words unto you. called, ye refused; stretched hand, man regarded; ye set nought counsel, would none reproof: also laugh calamity; mock fear cometh; fear cometh desolation, destruction cometh whirlwind; distress anguish cometh upon you. shall call upon me, answer; shall seek early, shall find me: hated knowledge, choose fear lord: would none counsel: despised reproof. therefore shall eat fruit way, filled devices. turning away simple shall slay them, prosperity fools shall destroy them. whoso hearkeneth unto shall dwell safely, shall quiet fear evil. son, thou wilt receive words, hide commandments thee; thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, [and] apply thine heart understanding; yea, thou criest knowledge, [and] liftest thy voice understanding; thou seekest silver, searchest [for] hid treasures; shalt thou understand fear lord, findthe knowledge god. lord giveth wisdom: mouth [cometh] knowledge understanding. layeth sound wisdom righteous: [he is] buckler walk uprightly. keepeth paths judgment, preserveth way saints. shalt thou understand righteousness, judgment, equity; [yea,] every good path. wisdom entereth thine heart, knowledge pleasant unto thy soul; discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee: deliver thee way evil [man,] man speaketh froward things; leave paths uprightness, walk ways darkness; rejoice evil, [and] delight frowardness wicked; whose ways [are] crooked, [they] froward paths: deliver thee strange woman, [even] stranger [which] flattereth words; forsaketh guide youth, forgetteth covenant god. house inclineth unto death, paths unto dead. none go unto return again, neither take hold paths life. thou mayest walk way good [men,] keep paths righteous. upright shall dwell land, perfect shall remain it. wicked shall cut earth, transgressors shall rooted it. son, forget law; let thine heart keep commandments: length days, long life, peace, shall add thee. let mercy truth forsake thee: bind thy neck; write upon table thine heart: shalt thou find favour good understanding sight god man. trust lord thine heart; lean unto thine understanding. thy ways acknowledge him, shall direct thy paths. wise thine eyes: fear lord, depart evil. shall health thy navel, marrow thy bones. honour lord thy substance, firstfruits thine increase: shall thy barns filled plenty, thy presses shall burst new wine. son, despise chastening lord; neither weary correction: lord loveth correcteth; even father son [in whom] delighteth. happy [is] man [that] findeth wisdom, man [that] getteth understanding. merchandise [is] better merchandise silver, gain thereof fine gold. [is] precious rubies: things thou canst desire compared unto her. length days [is] right hand; [and] left hand riches honour. ways [are] ways pleasantness, paths [are] peace. [is] tree life lay hold upon her: happy [is every one] retaineth her. lord wisdom hath founded earth; understanding hath established heavens. knowledge depths broken up, clouds drop dew. son, let depart thine eyes: keep sound wisdom discretion: shall lifeproverbs page 396 unto thy soul, grace thy neck. shalt thou walk thy way safely, thy foot shall stumble. thou liest down, thou shalt afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, thy sleep shall sweet. afraid sudden fear, neither desolation wicked, cometh. lord shall thy confidence, shall keep thy foot taken. withhold good due, power thine hand [it. ] say unto thy neighbour, go, come again, morrow give; thou hast thee. devise evil thy neighbour, seeing dwelleth securely thee. strive man without cause, done thee harm. envy thou oppressor, choose none ways. froward [is] abomination lord: secret [is] righteous. curse lord [is] house wicked: blesseth habitation just. surely scorneth scorners: giveth grace unto lowly. wise shall inherit glory: shame shall promotion fools. hear, ye children, instruction father, attend know understanding. give good doctrine, forsake ye law. father's son, tender [beloved] sight mother. taught also, said unto me, let thine heart retain words: keep commandments, live. get wisdom, get understanding: forget [it] not; neither decline words mouth. forsake not, shall preserve thee: love her, shall keep thee. wisdom [is] principal thing; [therefore] get wisdom: thy getting get understanding. exalt her, shall promote thee: shall bring thee honour, thou dost embrace her. shall give thine head ornament grace: crown glory shall deliver thee. hear, son, receive sayings; years thy life shall many. taught thee way wisdom; led thee right paths. thou goest, thy steps shall straitened; thou runnest, thou shalt stumble. take fast hold instruction; let [her] go: keep her; [is] thy life. enter path wicked, go way evil [men. ] avoid it, pass it, turn it, pass away. sleep not, except done mischief; sleep taken away, unless cause [some] fall. eat bread wickedness, drink wine violence. path [is] shining light, shineth unto perfect day. way wicked [is] darkness: know stumble. son, attend words; incline thine ear unto sayings. let depart thine eyes; keep midst thine heart. [are] life unto find them, health flesh. keep thy heart diligence; [are] issues life. put away thee froward mouth, perverse lips put far thee. let thine eyes look right on, let thine eyelids look straight thee. turn right hand left: remove thy foot evil. son, attend unto wisdom, [and] bow thine ear understanding: thou mayest regard discretion, [that] thy lips may keep knowledge. lips strange woman drop [as] honeycomb, mouth [is] smoother oil: end bitter wormwood, sharp twoedged sword. feet go death; steps take hold hell. lest thou shouldest ponder path life, ways moveable, [that] thou canst know [them. ] hear therefore, ye children, depart words mouth. remove thy way far her, come nigh door house: lest thou give thine honour unto others, thy years unto cruel: lest strangers filled thy wealth; thy labours [be] house stranger; thou mourn last, thy flesh thy body consumed, say, hated instruction, heart despised reproof; obeyed voice teachers, inclined mine ear instructed me! almost evil midst congregation assembly. drink waters thine cistern, running waters thine well. let thy fountains dispersed abroad, [and] rivers waters streets. let thine own, strangers' thee. let thy fountain blessed: rejoice wife thy youth. [let as] loving hind pleasant roe; let breasts satisfy thee times; thou ravished always love. wilt thou, son, ravished strange woman, embrace bosom stranger? ways man [are] eyes lord, pondereth goings. iniquities shall take wicked himself, shall holden cords sins. shall die without instruction; greatness folly shall go astray. son, thou surety thy friend, [if] thou hast stricken thy hand stranger, thou art snared words thy mouth, thou art taken words thy mouth. now, son, deliver thyself, thou art come hand thy friend; go, humble thyself, make sure thy friend. give sleep thine eyes, slumber thine eyelids. deliver thyself roe hand [of hunter,] bird hand fowler. go ant, thou sluggard; consider ways, wise: guide, overseer, ruler, provideth meat summer, [and] gathereth food harvest. long wilt thou sleep, sluggard? wilt thou arise thy sleep? [yet] little sleep, little slumber, little folding hands sleep: shall thy poverty come one travelleth, thy want armed man. naughty person, wicked man, walketh froward mouth. winketh eyes, speaketh feet, teacheth fingers; frowardness [is] heart, deviseth mischief continually; soweth discord. therefore shall calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall brokenpage 397 proverbs without remedy. six [things] doth lord hate: yea, seven [are] abomination unto him: proud look, lying tongue, hands shed innocent blood, heart deviseth wicked imaginations, feet swift running mischief, false witness [that] speaketh lies, soweth discord among brethren. son, keep thy father's commandment, forsake law thy mother: bind continually upon thine heart, [and] tie thy neck. thou goest, shall lead thee; thou sleepest, shall keep thee; [when] thou awakest, shall talk thee. commandment [is] lamp; law [is] light; reproofs instruction [are] way life: keep thee evil woman, flattery tongue strange woman. lust beauty thine heart; neither let take thee eyelids. means whorish woman [a man brought] piece bread: adulteress hunt precious life. man take fire bosom, clothes burned? one go upon hot coals, feet burned? goeth neighbour's wife; whosoever toucheth shall innocent. [men] despise thief, steal satisfy soul hungry; [if] found, shall restore sevenfold; shall give substance house. [but] whoso committeth adultery woman lacketh understanding: [that] doeth destroyeth soul. wound dishonour shall get; reproach shall wiped away. jealousy [is] rage man: therefore spare day vengeance. regard ransom; neither rest content, though thou givest many gifts. son, keep words, lay commandments thee. keep commandments, live; law apple thine eye. bind upon thy fingers, write upon table thine heart. say unto wisdom, thou [art] sister; call understanding [thy] kinswoman: may keep thee strange woman, stranger [which] flattereth words. window house looked casement, beheld among simple ones, discerned among youths, young man void understanding, passing street near corner; went way house, twilight, evening, black dark night: and, behold, met woman [with] attire harlot, subtil heart. (she [is] loud stubborn; feet abide house: [is she] without, streets, lieth wait every corner.) caught him, kissed him, [and] impudent face said unto him, [i have] peace offerings me; day payed vows. therefore came forth meet thee, diligently seek thy face, found thee. decked bed coverings tapestry, carved [works,] fine linen egypt. perfumed bed myrrh, aloes, cinnamon. come, let us take fill love morning: let us solace loves. goodman [is] home, gone long journey: hath taken bag money him, [and] come home day appointed. much fair speech caused yield, flatteringof lips forced him. goeth straightway, ox goeth slaughter, fool correction stocks; till dart strike liver; bird hasteth snare, knoweth [is] life. hearken unto therefore, ye children, attend words mouth. let thine heart decline ways, go astray paths. hath cast many wounded: yea, many strong [men] slain her. house [is] way hell, going chambers death. doth wisdom cry? understanding put forth voice? standeth top high places, way places paths. crieth gates, entry city, coming doors. unto you, men, call; voice [is] sons man. ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, ye understanding heart. hear; speak excellent things; opening lips [shall be] right things. mouth shall speak truth; wickedness [is] abomination lips. words mouth [are] righteousness; [there is] nothing froward perverse them. [are] plain understandeth, right find knowledge. receive instruction, silver; knowledge rather choice gold. wisdom [is] better rubies; things may desired compared it. wisdom dwell prudence, find knowledge witty inventions. fear lord [is] hate evil: pride, arrogancy, evil way, froward mouth, hate. counsel [is] mine, sound wisdom: [am] understanding; strength. kings reign, princes decree justice. princes rule, nobles, [even] judges earth. love love me; seek early shall find me. riches honour [are] me; [yea,] durable riches righteousness. fruit [is] better gold, yea, fine gold; revenue choice silver. lead way righteousness, midst paths judgment: may cause love inherit substance; fill treasures. lord possessed beginning way, works old. set everlasting, beginning, ever earth was. [there were] depths, brought forth; [there were] fountains abounding water. mountains settled, hills brought forth: yet made earth, fields, highest part dust world. prepared heavens, [was] there: set compass upon face depth: established clouds above: strengthened fountains deep: gave sea decree, waters pass commandment: appointed foundations earth: him, [as] one brought [with him:] daily [his] delight, rejoicing always him; rejoicing habitable part earth; delights [were] sons men. therefore hearken unto me, ye children: blessed [are that] keep ways. hear instruction, wise, refuse not. blessed [is] man heareth me, watching daily gates, waiting posts doors. whoso findeth findeth life, shall obtain favour lord. sinneth wrongeth soul: hateproverbs page 398 love death. wisdom hath builded house, hath hewn seven pillars: hath killed beasts; hath mingled wine; hath also furnished table. hath sent forth maidens: crieth upon highest places city, whoso [is] simple, let turn hither: [as for] wanteth understanding, saith him, come, eat bread, drink wine [which] mingled. forsake foolish, live; go way understanding. reproveth scorner getteth shame: rebuketh wicked [man getteth] blot. reprove scorner, lest hate thee: rebuke wise man, love thee. give [instruction] wise [man,] yet wiser: teach [man,] increase learning. fear lord [is] beginning wisdom: knowledge holy [is] understanding. thy days shall multiplied, years thy life shall increased. thou wise, thou shalt wise thyself: [if] thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear [it. ] foolish woman [is] clamorous: [she is] simple, knoweth nothing. sitteth door house, seat high places city, call passengers go right ways: whoso [is] simple, let turn hither: [as for] wanteth understanding, saith him, stolen waters sweet, bread [eaten] secret pleasant. knoweth dead [are] there; [and that] guests [are] depths hell. proverbs solomon. wise son maketh glad father: foolish son [is] heaviness mother. treasures wickedness profit nothing: righteousness delivereth death. lord suffer soul righteous famish: casteth away substance wicked. becometh poor dealeth [with] slack hand: hand diligent maketh rich. gathereth summer [is] wise son: [but] sleepeth harvest [is] son causeth shame. blessings [are] upon head just: violence covereth mouth wicked. memory blessed: name wicked shall rot. wise heart receive commandments: prating fool shall fall. walketh uprightly walketh surely: perverteth ways shall known. winketh eye causeth sorrow: prating fool shall fall. mouth righteous [man is] well life: violence covereth mouth wicked. hatred stirreth strifes: love covereth sins. lips hath understanding wisdom found: rod [is] back void understanding. wise [men] lay knowledge: mouth foolish [is] near destruction. rich man's wealth [is] strong city: destruction poor [is] poverty. labour righteous [tendeth] life: fruit wicked sin. [is in] way life keepeth instruction: refuseth reproof erreth. hideth hatred [with] lying lips, uttereth slander, [is] fool. multitude words wanteth sin: refraineth lips [is] wise. tongue [is as] choice silver: heart wicked [is] little worth. lips righteous feed many: fools die want wisdom. blessing lord, maketh rich, addeth sorrow it. [it is] sport afool mischief: man understanding hath wisdom. fear wicked, shall come upon him: desire righteous shall granted. whirlwind passeth, [is] wicked [more:] righteous [is] everlasting foundation. vinegar teeth, smoke eyes, [is] sluggard send him. fear lord prolongeth days: years wicked shall shortened. hope righteous [shall be] gladness: expectation wicked shall perish. way lord [is] strength upright: destruction [shall be] workers iniquity. righteous shall never removed: wicked shall inhabit earth. mouth bringeth forth wisdom: froward tongue shall cut out. lips righteous know acceptable: mouth wicked [speaketh] frowardness. false balance [is] abomination lord: weight [is] delight. [when] pride cometh, cometh shame: lowly [is] wisdom. integrity upright shall guide them: perverseness transgressors shall destroy them. riches profit day wrath: righteousness delivereth death. righteousness perfect shall direct way: wicked shall fall wickedness. righteousness upright shall deliver them: transgressors shall taken [their own] naughtiness. wicked man dieth, [his] expectation shall perish: hope unjust [men] perisheth. righteous delivered trouble, wicked cometh stead. hypocrite [his] mouth destroyeth neighbour: knowledge shall delivered. goeth well righteous, city rejoiceth: wicked perish, [there is] shouting. blessing upright city exalted: overthrown mouth wicked. void wisdom despiseth neighbour: man understanding holdeth peace. talebearer revealeth secrets: faithful spirit concealeth matter. counsel [is,] people fall: multitude counsellors [there is] safety. surety stranger shall smart [for it:] hateth suretiship sure. gracious woman retaineth honour: strong [men] retain riches. merciful man doeth good soul: [he is] cruel troubleth flesh. wicked worketh deceitful work: soweth righteousness [shall be] sure reward. righteousness [tendeth] life: pursueth evil [pursueth it] death. froward heart [are] abomination lord: [such are] upright [their] way [are] delight. [though] hand [join] hand, wicked shall unpunished: seed righteous shall delivered. [as] jewel gold swine's snout, [so is] fair woman without discretion. desire righteous [is] good: [but] expectation wicked [is] wrath. scattereth, yet increaseth; [there is] withholdeth meet, [it tendeth] poverty. liberal soul shall made fat: watereth shall watered also himself. withholdeth corn, people shall curse him: blessing [shall be] upon head selleth [it. ] diligently seeketh good procureth favour: seeketh mischief, shall come unto him. trusteth riches shall fall: righteous shall flourish branch.page 399 proverbs troubleth house shall inherit wind: fool [shall be] servant wise heart. fruit righteous [is] tree life; winneth souls [is] wise. behold, righteous shall recompensed earth: much wicked sinner. whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge: hateth reproof [is] brutish. good [man] obtaineth favour lord: man wicked devices condemn. man shall established wickedness: root righteous shall moved. virtuous woman [is] crown husband: maketh ashamed [is] rottenness bones. thoughts righteous [are] right: [but] counsels wicked [are] deceit. words wicked [are] lie wait blood: mouth upright shall deliver them. wicked overthrown, [are] not: house righteous shall stand. man shall commended according wisdom: perverse heart shall despised. [he is] despised, hath servant, [is] better honoureth himself, lacketh bread. righteous [man] regardeth life beast: tender mercies wicked [are] cruel. tilleth land shall satisfied bread: followeth vain [persons is] void understanding. wicked desireth net evil [men:] root righteous yieldeth [fruit. ] wicked snared transgression [his] lips: shall come trouble. man shall satisfied good fruit [his] mouth: recompense man's hands shall rendered unto him. way fool [is] right eyes: hearkeneth unto counsel [is] wise. fool's wrath presently known: prudent [man] covereth shame. [he that] speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: false witness deceit. speaketh like piercings sword: tongue wise [is] health. lip truth shall established ever: lying tongue [is] moment. deceit scorner heareth rebuke. man shall eat good fruit [his] mouth: soul transgressors [shall eat] violence. keepeth mouth keepeth life: [but] openeth wide lips shall destruction. soul sluggard desireth, [hath] nothing: soul diligent shall made fat. righteous [man] hateth lying: wicked [man] loathsome, cometh shame. righteousness keepeth [him is] upright way: wickedness overthroweth sinner. maketh rich, yet [hath] nothing: [there is] maketh poor, yet [hath] great riches. theransom man's life [are] riches: poor heareth rebuke. light righteous rejoiceth: lamp wicked shall put out. pride cometh favour. heart knoweth bitterness; stranger doth intermeddle joy. house wicked shall overthrown: tabernacle upright shall flourish. way seemeth right unto man, end thereof [are] ways death. even [he is] soon angry dealeth foolishly: man wicked devices hated. simple inherit folly: prudent crowned knowledge. evil bow good; wicked gates righteous. poor hated even neighbour: rich [hath] many friends. despiseth neighbour sinneth: hath mercy poor, happy [is] he. err devise evil? mercy truth [shall be] devise good. labour profit: talk lips [tendeth] penury.proverbs page 400 crown wise riches: [but] foolishness fools [is] folly. true witness delivereth souls: deceitful [witness] speaketh lies. fear lord [is] strong confidence: children shall place refuge. fear lord [is] fountain life, depart snares death. multitude people [is] king's honour: want people [is] destruction prince. [he is] slow wrath [is] great understanding: [he is] hasty spirit exalteth folly. sound heart [is] life flesh: envy rottenness bones. oppresseth poor reproacheth maker: honoureth hath mercy poor. wicked driven away wickedness: righteous hath hope death. wisdom resteth heart hath understanding: [that is] midst fools made known. righteousness exalteth nation: sin [is] reproach people. king's favour [is] toward wise servant: wrath [against] causeth shame. soft answer turneth away wrath: grievous words stir anger. tongue wise useth knowledge aright: mouth fools poureth foolishness. eyes lord [are] every place, beholding evil good. wholesome tongue [is] tree life: perverseness therein [is] breach spirit. fool despiseth father's instruction: regardeth reproof prudent. house righteous [is] much treasure: revenues wicked trouble. lips wise disperse knowledge: heart foolish [doeth] so. sacrifice wicked [is] abomination lord: prayer upright [is] delight. way wicked [is] abomination unto lord: loveth followeth righteousness. correction [is] grievous unto forsaketh way: [and] hateth reproof shall die. hell destruction [are] lord: much hearts children men? scorner loveth one reproveth him: neither go unto wise. merry heart maketh cheerful countenance: sorrow heart spirit broken. heart hath understanding seeketh knowledge: mouth fools feedeth foolishness. days afflicted [are] evil: merry heart [hath] continual feast. better [is] little fear lord great treasure trouble therewith. better [is] dinner herbs love is, stalled ox hatred therewith. wrathful man stirreth strife: [he is] slow anger appeaseth strife. way slothful [man is] hedge thorns: way righteous [is] made plain. wise son maketh glad father: foolish man despiseth mother. folly [is] joy [him is] destitute wisdom: man understanding walketh uprightly. without counsel purposes disappointed: multitude counsellors established. man hath joy answer mouth: word [spoken] due season, good [is it! ] way life [is] wise, may depart hell beneath. lord destroy house proud: establish border widow. thoughts wicked [are] abomination lord: [the words] pure [are] pleasant words. greedy gain troubleth house; hateth gifts shall live. heart righteous studieth answer: mouthof wicked poureth evil things. lord [is] far wicked: heareth prayer righteous. light eyes rejoiceth heart: [and] good report maketh bones fat. ear heareth reproof life abideth among wise. refuseth instruction despiseth soul: heareth reproof getteth understanding. fear lord [is] instruction wisdom; honour [is] humility. preparations heart man, answer tongue, [is] lord. ways man [are] clean eyes; lord weigheth spirits. commit thy works unto lord, thy thoughts shall established. lord hath made [things] himself: yea, even wicked day evil. every one [that is] proud heart [is] abomination lord: [though] hand [join] hand, shall unpunished. mercy truth iniquity purged: fear lord [men] depart evil. man's ways please lord, maketh even enemies peace him. better [is] little righteousness great revenues without right. man's heart deviseth way: lord directeth steps. divine sentence [is] lips king: mouth transgresseth judgment. weight balance [are] lord's: weights bag [are] work. [it is] abomination kings commit wickedness: throne established righteousness. righteous lips [are] delight kings; love speaketh right. wrath king [is as] messengers death: wise man pacify it. light king's countenance [is] life; favour [is] cloud latter rain. much better [is it] get wisdom gold! get understanding rather chosen silver! highway upright [is] depart evil: keepeth way preserveth soul. pride [goeth] destruction, haughty spirit fall. better [it be] humble spirit lowly, divide spoil proud. handleth matter wisely shall find good: whoso trusteth lord, happy [is] he. wise heart shall called prudent: sweetness lips increaseth learning. understanding [is] wellspring life unto hath it: instruction fools [is] folly. heart wise teacheth mouth, addeth learning lips. pleasant words [are as] honeycomb, sweet soul, health bones. way seemeth right unto man, end thereof [are] ways death. laboureth laboureth himself; mouth craveth him. ungodly man diggeth evil: lips [there is] burning fire. froward man soweth strife: whisperer separateth chief friends. violent man enticeth neighbour, leadeth way [that is] good. shutteth eyes devise froward things: moving lips bringeth evil pass. hoary head [is] crown glory, [if] found way righteousness. [he is] slow anger [is] better mighty; ruleth spirit taketh city. lot cast lap; whole disposing thereof [is] lord. better [is] dry morsel, quietness therewith, house full sacrifices [with] strife. wise servant shall rule son causeth shame,page 401 proverbs shall part inheritance among brethren. fining pot [is] silver, furnace gold: lord trieth hearts. wicked doer giveth heed false lips; [and] liar giveth ear naughty tongue. whoso mocketh poor reproacheth maker: [and] glad calamities shall unpunished. children's children [are] crown old men; glory children [are] fathers. excellent speech becometh fool: much less lying lips prince. gift [is as] precious stone eyes hath it: whithersoever turneth, prospereth. covereth transgression seeketh love; repeateth matter separateth [very] friends. reproof entereth wise man hundred stripes fool. evil [man] seeketh rebellion: therefore cruel messenger shall sent him. let bear robbed whelps meet man, rather fool folly. whoso rewardeth evil good, evil shall depart house. beginning strife [is as] one letteth water: therefore leave contention, meddled with. justifieth wicked, condemneth just, even [are] abomination lord. wherefore [is there] price hand fool get wisdom, seeing [he hath] heart [to it? ] friend loveth times, brother born adversity. man void understanding striketh hands, [and] becometh surety presence friend. loveth transgression loveth strife: [and] exalteth gate seeketh destruction. hath froward heart findeth good: hath perverse tongue falleth mischief. begetteth fool [doeth it] sorrow: father fool hath joy. merry heart doeth good [like] medicine: broken spirit drieth bones. wicked [man] taketh gift bosom pervert ways judgment. wisdom [is] hath understanding; eyes fool [are] ends earth. foolish son [is] grief father, bitterness bare him. also punish [is] good, [nor] strike princes equity. hath knowledge spareth words: [and] man understanding excellent spirit. even fool, holdeth peace, counted wise: [and] shutteth lips [is esteemed] man understanding. desire man, separated himself, seeketh [and] intermeddleth wisdom. fool hath delight understanding, heart may discover itself. wicked cometh, [then] cometh also contempt, ignominy reproach. words man's mouth [are as] deep waters, [and] wellspring wisdom [as] flowing brook. [it is] good accept person wicked, overthrow righteous judgment. fool's lips enter contention, mouth calleth strokes. fool's mouth [is] destruction, lips [are] snare soul. words talebearer [are] wounds, go innermost parts belly. also slothful work brother great waster. name lord [is] strong tower: righteous runneth it, safe. rich man's wealth [is] strong city, high wall conceit. destruction heart man haughty, honour [is] humility. answereth matter heareth [it,] [is] folly shame unto him. spirit man sustain infirmity; woundedspirit bear? heart prudent getteth knowledge; ear wise seeketh knowledge. man's gift maketh room him, bringeth great men. [he is] first cause [seemeth] just; neighbour cometh searcheth him. lot causeth contentions cease, parteth mighty. brother offended [is harder won] strong city: [their] contentions [are] like bars castle. man's belly shall satisfied fruit mouth; [and] increase lips shall filled. death life [are] power tongue: love shall eat fruit thereof. [whoso] findeth wife findeth good [thing,] obtaineth favour lord. poor useth intreaties; rich answereth roughly. man [that hath] friends must shew friendly: friend [that] sticketh closer brother. better [is] poor walketh integrity, [he is] perverse lips, fool. also, [that] soul [be] without knowledge, [it is] good; hasteth [his] feet sinneth. foolishness man perverteth way: heart fretteth lord. wealth maketh many friends; poor separated neighbour. false witness shall unpunished, [he that] speaketh lies shall escape. many intreat favour prince: every man [is] friend giveth gifts. brethren poor hate him: much friends go far him? pursueth [them with] words, [yet] [are] wanting [to him. ] getteth wisdom loveth soul: [he that] keepeth understanding shall find good. false witness shall unpunished, speaketh lies shall perish. delight seemly fool; much less servant rule princes. discretion man deferreth anger; [it is] glory pass transgression. king's wrath [is] roaring lion; favour [is] dew upon grass. foolish son [is] calamity father: contentions wife [are] continual dropping. house riches [are] inheritance fathers prudent wife [is] lord. slothfulness casteth deep sleep; idle soul shall suffer hunger. keepeth commandment keepeth soul; [but] despiseth ways shall die. hath pity upon poor lendeth unto lord; hath given pay again. chasten thy son hope, let thy soul spare crying. man great wrath shall suffer punishment: thou deliver [him,] yet thou must again. hear counsel, receive instruction, thou mayest wise thy latter end. [there are] many devices man's heart; nevertheless counsel lord, shall stand. desire man [is] kindness: poor man [is] better liar. fear lord [tendeth] life: [he hath it] shall abide satisfied; shall visited evil. slothful [man] hideth hand [his] bosom, much bring mouth again. smite scorner, simple beware: reprove one hath understanding, [and] understand knowledge. wasteth [his] father, [and] chaseth away [his] mother, [is] son causeth shame, bringeth reproach. cease, son, hear instruction [that causeth] err words knowledge. ungodly witness scorneth judgment: mouthproverbs page 402 wicked devoureth iniquity. judgments prepared scorners, stripes back fools. wine [is] mocker, strong drink [is] raging: whosoever deceived thereby wise. fear king [is] roaring lion: [whoso] provoketh anger sinneth [against] soul. [it is] honour man cease strife: every fool meddling. sluggard plow reason cold; [therefore] shall beg harvest, [have] nothing. counsel heart man [is like] deep water; man understanding draw out. men proclaim every one goodness: faithful man find? [man] walketh integrity: children [are] blessed him. king sitteth throne judgment scattereth away evil eyes. say, made heart clean, pure sin? divers weights, [and] divers measures, [are] alike abomination lord. even child known doings, whether work [be] pure, whether [it be] right. hearing ear, seeing eye, lord hath made even them. love sleep, lest thou come poverty; open thine eyes, [and] thou shalt satisfied bread. [it is] naught, [it is] naught, saith buyer: gone way, boasteth. gold, multitude rubies: lips knowledge [are] precious jewel. take garment surety [for] stranger: take pledge strange woman. bread deceit [is] sweet man; afterwards mouth shall filled gravel. [every] purpose established counsel: good advice make war. goeth [as] talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle flattereth lips. whoso curseth father mother, lamp shall put obscure darkness. inheritance [may be] gotten hastily beginning; end thereof shall blessed. say thou, recompense evil; [but] wait lord, shall save thee. divers weights [are] abomination unto lord; false balance [is] good. man's goings [are] lord; man understand way? [it is] snare man [who] devoureth [that is] holy, vows make enquiry. wise king scattereth wicked, bringeth wheel them. spirit man [is] candle lord, searching inward parts belly. mercy truth preserve king: throne upholden mercy. glory young men [is] strength: beauty old men [is] grey head. blueness wound cleanseth away evil: [do] stripes inward parts belly. king's heart [is] hand lord, [as] rivers water: turneth whithersoever will. every way man [is] right eyes: lord pondereth hearts. justice judgment [is] acceptable lord sacrifice. high look, proud heart, [and] plowing wicked, [is] sin. thoughts diligent [tend] plenteousness; every one [that is] hasty want. getting treasures lying tongue [is] vanity tossed fro seek death. robbery wicked shall destroy them; refuse judgment. way man [is] froward strange: [as for] pure, work [is] right. [it is] better dwell corner housetop, brawling woman wide house. soul wicked desireth evil: neighbour findeth favour eyes. scorner punished, simple made wise: wise instructed, receiveth knowledge. righteous [man] wisely considereth house wicked: [but god] overthroweth wicked [their] wickedness. whoso stoppeth ears cry poor, also shall cry himself, shall heard. gift secret pacifieth anger: reward bosom strong wrath. [it is] joy judgment: destruction [shall be] workers iniquity. man wandereth way understanding shall remain congregation dead. loveth pleasure [shall be] poor man: loveth wine oil shall rich. wicked [shall be] ransom righteous, transgressor upright. [it is] better dwell wilderness, contentious angry woman. [there is] treasure desired oil dwelling wise; foolish man spendeth up. followeth righteousness mercy findeth life, righteousness, honour. wise [man] scaleth city mighty, casteth strength confidence thereof. whoso keepeth mouth tongue keepeth soul troubles. proud [and] haughty scorner [is] name, dealeth proud wrath. desire slothful killeth him; hands refuse labour. coveteth greedily day long: righteous giveth spareth not. sacrifice wicked [is] abomination: much more, [when] bringeth wicked mind? false witness shall perish: man heareth speaketh constantly. wicked man hardeneth face: [as for] upright, directeth way. [there is] wisdom understanding counsel lord. horse [is] prepared day battle: safety [is] lord. [good] name [is] rather chosen great riches, [and] loving favour rather silver gold. rich poor meet together: lord [is] maker all. prudent [man] foreseeth evil, hideth himself: simple pass on, punished. humility [and] fear lord [are] riches, honour, life. thorns [and] snares [are] way froward: doth keep soul shall far them. train child way go: old, depart it. rich ruleth poor, borrower [is] servant lender. soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: rod anger shall fail. hath bountiful eye shall blessed; giveth bread poor. cast scorner, contention shall go out; yea, strife reproach shall cease. loveth pureness heart, [for] grace lips king [shall be] friend. eyes lord preserve knowledge, overthroweth words transgressor. slothful [man] saith, [there is] lion without, shall slain streets. mouth strange women [is] deep pit: abhorred lord shall fall therein. foolishness [is] bound heart child; [but] rod correction shall drive far him. oppresseth poor increase [riches, and] giveth rich, [shall] surely [come] want. bow thine ear, hear words wise, apply thine heart unto knowledge. [it is] pleasant thing thou keep within thee; shall withal fitted thy lips. thy trustpage 403 proverbs may lord, made known thee day, even thee. written thee excellent things counsels knowledge, might make thee know certainty words truth; thou mightest answer words truth send unto thee? rob poor, [is] poor: neither oppress afflicted gate: lord plead cause, spoil soul spoiled them. make friendship angry man; furious man thou shalt go: lest thou learn ways, get snare thy soul. thou [one] strike hands, [or] sureties debts. thou hast nothing pay, take away thy bed thee? remove ancient landmark, thy fathers set. seest thou man diligent business? shall stand kings; shall stand mean [men. ] thou sittest eat ruler, consider diligently [is] thee: put knife thy throat, thou [be] man given appetite. desirous dainties: [are] deceitful meat. labour rich: cease thine wisdom. wilt thou set thine eyes upon not? [riches] certainly make wings; fly away eagle toward heaven. eat thou bread [him hath] evil eye, neither desire thou dainty meats: thinketh heart, [is] he: eat drink, saith thee; heart [is] thee. morsel [which] thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, lose thy sweet words. speak ears fool: despise wisdom thy words. remove old landmark; enter fields fatherless: redeemer [is] mighty; shall plead cause thee. apply thine heart unto instruction, thine ears words knowledge. withhold correction child: [if] thou beatest rod, shall die. thou shalt beat rod, shalt deliver soul hell. son, thine heart wise, heart shall rejoice, even mine. yea, reins shall rejoice, thy lips speak right things. let thine heart envy sinners: [be thou] fear lord day long. surely end; thine expectation shall cut off. hear thou, son, wise, guide thine heart way. among winebibbers; among riotous eaters flesh: drunkard glutton shall come poverty: drowsiness shall clothe [a man] rags. hearken unto thy father begat thee, despise thy mother old. buy truth, sell [it] not; [also] wisdom, instruction, understanding. father righteous shall greatly rejoice: begetteth wise [child] shall joy him. thy father thy mother shall glad, bare thee shall rejoice. son, give thine heart, let thine eyes observe ways. whore [is] deep ditch; strange woman [is] narrow pit. also lieth wait [for] prey, increaseth transgressors among men. hath woe? hath sorrow? hath contentions? hath babbling? hath wounds without cause? hath redness eyes? tarry long wine; go seek mixed wine. look thou upon wine red, giveth colour cup, [when] moveth aright. last biteth like serpent, stingeth like adder. yea, thou shalt lieth midst sea, lieth upon top mast. stricken me, [shalt thou say, and] sick; beaten me, [and] felt [it] not: shall awake? seek yet again. thou envious evil men, neither desire them. heart studieth destruction, lips talk mischief. wisdom house builded; understanding established: knowledge shall chambers filled precious pleasant riches. wise man [is] strong; yea, man knowledge increaseth strength. wise counsel thou shalt make thy war: multitude counsellors [there is] safety. wisdom [is] high fool: openeth mouth gate. deviseth evil shall called mischievous person. thought foolishness [is] sin: scorner [is] abomination men. [if] thou faint day adversity, thy strength [is] small. thou forbear deliver [them are] drawn unto death, [those are] ready slain; thou sayest, behold, knew not; doth pondereth heart consider [it?] keepeth thy soul, doth [not] know [it?] shall [not] render [every] man according works? son, eat thou honey, [it is] good; honeycomb, [which is] sweet thy taste: [shall] knowledge wisdom [be] unto thy soul: thou hast found [it,] shall reward, thy expectation shall cut off. lay wait, wicked [man,] dwelling righteous; spoil resting place: [man] falleth seven times, riseth again: wicked shall fall mischief. rejoice thine enemy falleth, let thine heart glad stumbleth: lest lord see [it,] displease him, turn away wrath him. fret thyself evil [men,] neither thou envious wicked; shall reward evil [man;] candle wicked shall put out. son, fear thou lord king: [and] meddle given change: calamity shall rise suddenly; knoweth ruin both? [things] also [belong] wise. [it is] good respect persons judgment. saith unto wicked, thou [art] righteous; shall people curse, nations shall abhor him: rebuke [him] shall delight, good blessing shall come upon them. [every man] shall kiss [his] lips giveth right answer. prepare thy work without, make fit thyself field; afterwards build thine house. witness thy neighbour without cause; deceive [not] thy lips. say not, hath done me: render man according work. went field slothful, vineyard man void understanding; and, lo, grown thorns, [and] nettles covered face thereof, stone wall thereof broken down. saw, [and] considered [it] well: looked upon [it, and] received instruction. [yet] little sleep, little slumber, little folding hands sleep: shall thy poverty come one travelleth; thy want armed man. [are] also proverbs solomon, men hezekiah king judah copied out. [it is]proverbs page 404 glory god conceal thing: honour kings [is] search matter. heaven height, earth depth, heart kings [is] unsearchable. take away dross silver, shall come forth vessel finer. take away wicked [from] king, throne shall established righteousness. put forth thyself presence king, stand place great [men: ] better [it is] said unto thee, come hither; thou shouldest put lower presence prince thine eyes seen. go forth hastily strive, lest [thou know not] end thereof, thy neighbour hath put thee shame. debate thy cause thy neighbour [himself;] discover secret another: lest heareth [it] put thee shame, thine infamy turn away. word fitly spoken [is like] apples gold pictures silver. [as] earring gold, ornament fine gold, [so is] wise reprover upon obedient ear. cold snow time harvest, [so is] faithful messenger send him: refresheth soul masters. whoso boasteth false gift [is like] clouds wind without rain. long forbearing prince persuaded, soft tongue breaketh bone. hast thou found honey? eat much sufficient thee, lest thou filled therewith, vomit it. withdraw thy foot thy neighbour's house; lest weary thee, [so] hate thee. man beareth false witness neighbour [is] maul, sword, sharp arrow. confidence unfaithful man time trouble [is like] broken tooth, foot joint. [as] taketh away garment cold weather, [and as] vinegar upon nitre, [is] singeth songs heavy heart. thine enemy hungry, give bread eat; thirsty, give water drink: thou shalt heap coals fire upon head, lord shall reward thee. north wind driveth away rain: [doth] angry countenance backbiting tongue. [it is] better dwell corner housetop, brawling woman wide house. [as] cold waters thirsty soul, [is] good news far country. righteous man falling wicked [is as] troubled fountain, corrupt spring. [it ]not good eat much honey: [for men ]to search glory [is ]glory. [hath] rule spirit [is like] city [that is] broken down, [and] without walls. snow summer, rain harvest, honour seemly fool. bird wandering, swallow flying, curse causeless shall come. whip horse, bridle ass, rod fool's back. answer fool according folly, lest thou also like unto him. answer fool according folly, lest wise conceit. sendeth message hand fool cutteth feet, [and] drinketh damage. legs lame equal: [is] parable mouth fools. bindeth stone sling, [is] giveth honour fool. [as] thorn goeth hand drunkard, [is] parable mouth fools. great [god] formed [things] rewardeth fool, rewardeth transgressors. dog returneth vomit, [so] fool returneth folly. seest thou man wise conceit? [there is] hope fool him. [as] door turneth upon hinges, [doth] slothful upon bed. slothful hideth hand [his] bosom; grieveth bring mouth. sluggard [is] wiser conceit seven men render reason. passeth by, [and] meddleth strife [belonging] him, [is like] one taketh dog ears. mad [man] casteth firebrands, arrows, death, [is] man [that] deceiveth neighbour, saith, sport? wood is, [there] fire goeth out: [there is] talebearer, strife ceaseth. [as] coals [are] burning coals, wood fire; [is] contentious man kindle strife. words talebearer [are] wounds, go innermost parts belly. burning lips wicked heart [are like] potsherd covered silver dross. hateth dissembleth lips, layeth deceit within him; speaketh fair, believe not: [there are] seven abominations heart. [whose] hatred covered deceit, wickedness shall shewed [whole] congregation. whoso diggeth pit shall fall therein: rolleth stone, return upon him. lying tongue hateth [those are] afflicted it; flattering mouth worketh ruin. boast thyself morrow; thou knowest day may bring forth. let another man praise thee, thine mouth; stranger, thine lips. stone [is] heavy, sand weighty; fool's wrath [is] heavier both. wrath [is] cruel, anger [is] outrageous; [is] able stand envy? open rebuke [is] better secret love. faithful [are] wounds friend; kisses enemy [are] deceitful. full soul loatheth honeycomb; hungry soul every bitter thing sweet. bird wandereth nest, [is] man wandereth place. ointment perfume rejoice heart: [doth] sweetness man's friend hearty counsel. thine friend, thy father's friend, forsake not; neither go thy brother's house day thy calamity: [for] better [is] neighbour [that is] near brother far off. son, wise, make heart glad, may answer reproacheth me. prudent [man] foreseeth evil, [and] hideth himself; [but] simple pass on, [and] punished. take garment surety stranger, take pledge strange woman. blesseth friend loud voice, rising early morning, shall counted curse him. continual dropping rainy day contentious woman alike. whosoever hideth hideth wind, ointment right hand, [which] bewrayeth [itself. ] iron sharpeneth iron; man sharpeneth countenance friend. whoso keepeth fig tree shall eat fruit thereof: waiteth master shall honoured. water face [answereth] face, heart man man. hell destruction never full; eyes man never satisfied. [as] fining pot silver, furnace gold; [is] man praise. though thou shouldest bray fool mortar among wheat pestle, [yet] foolishness depart him. thou diligent know state thy flocks, [and] look well thy herds. riches [are] ever: doth crown [endure] every generation? hay appeareth, tender grass shewethpage 405 proverbs itself, herbs mountains gathered. lambs [are] thy clothing, goats [are] price field. [thou shalt have] goats' milk enough thy food, food thy household, [for] maintenance thy maidens. wicked flee man pursueth: righteous bold lion. transgression land many [are] princes thereof: man understanding [and] knowledge state [thereof] shall prolonged. poor man oppresseth poor [is like] sweeping rain leaveth food. forsake law praise wicked: keep law contend them. evil men understand judgment: seek lord understand [things. ] better [is] poor walketh uprightness, [he is] perverse [in his] ways, though [be] rich. whoso keepeth law [is] wise son: companion riotous [men] shameth father. usury unjust gain increaseth substance, shall gather pity poor. turneth away ear hearing law, even prayer [shall be] abomination. whoso causeth righteous go astray evil way, shall fall pit: upright shall good [things] possession. rich man [is] wise conceit; poor hath understanding searcheth out. righteous [men] rejoice, [there is] great glory: wicked rise, man hidden. covereth sins shall prosper: whoso confesseth forsaketh [them] shall mercy. happy [is] man feareth alway: hardeneth heart shall fall mischief. [as] roaring lion, ranging bear; [so is] wicked ruler poor people. prince wanteth understanding [is] also great oppressor: [but] hateth covetousness shall prolong [his] days. man doeth violence blood [any] person shall flee pit; let man stay him. whoso walketh uprightly shall saved: [he is] perverse [in his] ways shall fall once. tilleth land shall plenty bread: followeth vain [persons] shall poverty enough. faithful man shall abound blessings: maketh haste rich shall innocent. respect persons [is] good: piece bread [that] man transgress. hasteth rich [hath] evil eye, considereth poverty shall come upon him. rebuketh man afterwards shall find favour flattereth tongue. whoso robbeth father mother, saith, [it is] transgression; [is] companion destroyer. proud heart stirreth strife: putteth trust lord shall made fat. trusteth heart fool: whoso walketh wisely, shall delivered. giveth unto poor shall lack: hideth eyes shall many curse. wicked rise, men hide themselves: perish, righteous increase. he, often reproved hardeneth [his] neck, shall suddenly destroyed, without remedy. righteous authority, people rejoice: wicked beareth rule, people mourn. whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth father: keepeth company harlots spendeth [his] substance. king judgment establisheth land: receiveth gifts overthroweth it. aman flattereth neighbour spreadeth net feet. transgression evil man [there is] snare: righteous doth sing rejoice. righteous considereth cause poor: [but] wicked regardeth know [it. ] scornful men bring city snare: wise [men] turn away wrath. [if] wise man contendeth foolish man, whether rage laugh, [there is] rest. bloodthirsty hate upright: seek soul. fool uttereth mind: wise [man] keepeth till afterwards. ruler hearken lies, servants [are] wicked. poor deceitful man meet together: lord lighteneth eyes. king faithfully judgeth poor, throne shall established ever. rod reproof give wisdom: child left [to himself] bringeth mother shame. wicked multiplied, transgression increaseth: righteous shall see fall. correct thy son, shall give thee rest; yea, shall give delight unto thy soul. [there is] vision, people perish: keepeth law, happy [is] he. servant corrected words: though understand answer. seest thou man [that is] hasty words? [there is] hope fool him. delicately bringeth servant child shall become [his] son length. angry man stirreth strife, furious man aboundeth transgression. man's pride shall bring low: honour shall uphold humble spirit. whoso partner thief hateth soul: heareth cursing, bewrayeth [it] not. fear man bringeth snare: whoso putteth trust lord shall safe. many seek ruler's favour; [every] man's judgment [cometh] lord. unjust man [is] abomination just: [he is] upright way [is] abomination wicked. words agur son jakeh, [even] prophecy: man spake unto ithiel, even unto ithiel ucal, surely [am] brutish [any] man, understanding man. neither learned wisdom, knowledge holy. hath ascended heaven, descended? hath gathered wind fists? hath bound waters garment? hath established ends earth? [is] name, [is] son's name, thou canst tell? every word god [is] pure: [is] shield unto put trust him. add thou unto words, lest reprove thee, thou found liar. two [things] required thee; deny [them] die: remove far vanity lies: give neither poverty riches; feed food convenient me: lest full, deny [thee,] say, [is] lord? lest poor, steal, take name god [in vain. ] accuse servant unto master, lest curse thee, thou found guilty. [there is] generation [that] curseth father, doth bless mother. [there is] generation [that are] pure eyes, [yet] washed filthiness. [there is] generation, lofty eyes! eyelids lifted up. [there is] generation, whose teeth [are as] swords, jaw teeth [as] knives, devour poor earth, needy [among] men. horseleach hath two daughters, [crying,] give, give. three [things are] never satisfied, [yea,] four [things] say not, [it is] enough:proverbs page 406 grave; barren womb; earth [that] filled water; fire [that] saith not, [it is] enough. eye [that] mocketh [his] father, despiseth obey [his] mother, ravens valley shall pick out, young eagles shall eat it. three [things which] wonderful me, yea, four know not: way eagle air; way serpent upon rock; way ship midst sea; way man maid. [is] way adulterous woman; eateth, wipeth mouth, saith, done wickedness. three [things] earth disquieted, four [which] cannot bear: servant reigneth; fool filled meat; odious [woman] married; handmaid heir mistress. four [things are] little upon earth, [are] exceeding wise: ants [are] people strong, yet prepare meat summer; conies [are but] feeble folk, yet make houses rocks; locusts king, yet go forth bands; spider taketh hold hands, kings' palaces. three [things] go well, yea, four comely going: lion [which is] strongest among beasts, turneth away any; greyhound; goat also; king, [there is] rising up. thou hast done foolishly lifting thyself, thou hast thought evil, [lay] thine hand upon thy mouth. surely churning milk bringeth forth butter, wringing nose bringeth forth blood: forcing wrath bringeth forth strife. words king lemuel, prophecy mother taught him. what, son? what, son womb? what, son vows? give thy strength unto women, thy ways destroyeth kings. [it is] kings, lemuel, [it is] kings drink wine; princes strong drink: lest drink, forget law, pervert judgment afflicted. give strong drink unto ready perish, wine unto heavy hearts. let drink, forget poverty, remember misery more. open thy mouth dumb cause appointed destruction. open thy mouth, judge righteously, plead cause poor needy. find virtuous woman? price [is] far rubies. heart husband doth safely trust her, shall need spoil. good evil days life. seeketh wool, flax, worketh willingly hands. like merchants' ships; bringeth food afar. riseth also yet night, giveth meat household, portion maidens. considereth field, buyeth it: fruit hands planteth vineyard. girdeth loins strength, strengtheneth arms. perceiveth merchandise [is] good: candle goeth night. layeth hands spindle, hands hold distaff. stretcheth hand poor; yea, reacheth forth hands needy. afraid snow household: household [are] clothed scarlet. maketh coverings tapestry; clothing [is] silk purple. husband known gates, sitteth among elders land. shemaketh fine linen, selleth [it;] delivereth girdles unto merchant. strength honour [are] clothing; shall rejoice time come. openeth mouth wisdom; tongue [is] law kindness. looketh well ways household, eateth bread idleness. children arise up, call blessed; husband [also,] praiseth her. many daughters done virtuously, thou excellest all. favour [is] deceitful, beauty [is] vain: [but] woman [that] feareth lord, shall praised. give fruit hands; let works praise gates.page 407 ecclesiastes ecclesiastesor, preacher words preacher, son david, king jerusalem. vanity vanities, saith preacher, vanity vanities; [is] vanity. profit hath man labour taketh sun? [one] generation passeth away, [another] generation cometh: earth abideth ever. sun also ariseth, sun goeth down, hasteth place arose. wind goeth toward south, turneth unto north; whirleth continually, wind returneth according circuits. rivers run sea; yet sea [is] full; unto place whence rivers come, thither return again. things [are] full labour; man cannot utter [it:] eye satisfied seeing, ear filled hearing. thing hath been, [is that] shall be; done [is] shall done: [there is] new [thing] sun. [any] thing whereof may said, see, [is] new? hath already old time, us. [there is] remembrance former [things;] neither shall [any] remembrance [things] come [those] shall come after. preacher king israel jerusalem. gave heart seek search wisdom concerning [things] done heaven: sore travail hath god given sons man exercised therewith. seen works done sun; and, behold, [is] vanity vexation spirit. [that is] crooked cannot made straight: wanting cannot numbered. communed mine heart, saying, lo, come great estate, gotten wisdom [they] jerusalem: yea, heart great experience wisdom knowledge. gave heart know wisdom, know madness folly: perceived also vexation spirit. much wisdom [is] much grief: increaseth knowledge increaseth sorrow. said mine heart, go now, prove thee mirth, therefore enjoy pleasure: and, behold, also [is] vanity. said laughter, [it is] mad: mirth, doeth it? sought mine heart give unto wine, yet acquainting mine heart wisdom; lay hold folly, till might see [was] good sons men, heaven days life. made great works; builded houses; planted vineyards: made gardens orchards, planted trees [kind of] fruits: made pools water, water therewith wood bringeth forth trees: got [me] servants maidens, servants born house; also great possessions great small cattle jerusalem me: gathered also silver gold, peculiar treasure kings provinces: gat men singers women singers, delights sons men, [as] musical instruments, sorts. great, increased jerusalem: also wisdom remained me. whatsoever mine eyes desired kept them, withheld heart joy; heart rejoiced labour: portion labour. ilooked works hands wrought, labour laboured do: and, behold, [was] vanity vexation spirit, [there was] profit sun. turned behold wisdom, madness, folly: [can] man [do] cometh king? [even] hath already done. saw wisdom excelleth folly, far light excelleth darkness. wise man's eyes [are] head; fool walketh darkness: perceived also one event happeneth all. said heart, happeneth fool, happeneth even me; wise? said heart, also [is] vanity. [there is] remembrance wise fool ever; seeing [is] days come shall forgotten. dieth wise [man?] fool. therefore hated life; work wrought sun grievous unto me: [is] vanity vexation spirit. yea, hated labour taken sun: leave unto man shall me. knoweth whether shall wise [man] fool? yet shall rule labour wherein laboured, wherein shewed wise sun. [is] also vanity. therefore went cause heart despair labour took sun. man whose labour [is] wisdom, knowledge, equity; yet man hath laboured therein shall leave [for] portion. also [is] vanity great evil. hath man labour, vexation heart, wherein hath laboured sun? days [are] sorrows, travail grief; yea, heart taketh rest night. also vanity. [there is] nothing better man, [than] eat drink, [that] make soul enjoy good labour. also saw, [was] hand god. eat, else hasten [hereunto,] i? [god] giveth man [is] good sight wisdom, knowledge, joy: sinner giveth travail, gather heap up, may give [him is] good god. also [is] vanity vexation spirit. every [thing is] season, time every purpose heaven: time born, time die; time plant, time pluck [that is] planted; time kill, time heal; time break down, time build up; time weep, time laugh; time mourn, time dance; time cast away stones, time gather stones together; time embrace, time refrain embracing; time get, time lose; time keep, time cast away; time rend, time sew; time keep silence, time speak; time love, time hate; time war, time peace. profit hath worketh wherein laboureth? seen travail, god hath given sons men exercised it. hath made every [thing] beautiful time: also hath set world heart, man find work god maketh beginning end. know [there is] good them, [a man] rejoice, good life. also every man eat drink, enjoy good labour, [is] gift god.ecclesiastes page 408 know that, whatsoever god doeth, shall ever: nothing put it, thing taken it: god doeth [it,] [men] fear him. hath now; hath already been; god requireth past. moreover saw sun place judgment, [that] wickedness [was] there; place righteousness, [that] iniquity [was] there. said mine heart, god shall judge righteous wicked: [there is] time every purpose every work. said mine heart concerning estate sons men, god might manifest them, might see beasts. befalleth sons men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: one dieth, dieth other; yea, one breath; man hath preeminence beast: [is] vanity. go unto one place; dust, turn dust again. knoweth spirit man goeth upward, spirit beast goeth downward earth? wherefore perceive [there is] nothing better, man rejoice works; [is] portion: shall bring see shall him? returned, considered oppressions done sun: behold tears [such were] oppressed, comforter; side oppressors [there was] power; comforter. wherefore praised dead already dead living yet alive. yea, better [is he] they, hath yet been, hath seen evil work done sun. again, considered travail, every right work, man envied neighbour. [is] also vanity vexation spirit. fool foldeth hands together, eateth flesh. better [is] handful [with] quietness, hands full [with] travail vexation spirit. returned, saw vanity sun. one [alone,] [there is] second; yea, hath neither child brother: yet [is there] end labour; neither eye satisfied riches; neither [saith he,] labour, bereave soul good? [is] also vanity, yea, [is] sore travail. two [are] better one; good reward labour. fall, one lift fellow: woe [that is] alone falleth; [he hath] another help up. again, two lie together, heat: one warm [alone? ] one prevail him, two shall withstand him; threefold cord quickly broken. better [is] poor wise child old foolish king, admonished. prison cometh reign; whereas also [he is] born kingdom becometh poor. considered living walk sun, second child shall stand stead. [there is] end people, [even] them: also come shall rejoice him. surely also [is] vanity vexation spirit. keep thy foot thou goest house god,and ready hear, give sacrifice fools: consider evil. rash thy mouth, let thine heart hasty utter [any] thing god: god [is] heaven, thou upon earth: therefore let thy words few. dream cometh multitude business; fool's voice [is known] multitude words. thou vowest vow unto god, defer pay it; [he hath] pleasure fools: pay thou hast vowed. better [is it] thou shouldest vow, thou shouldest vow pay. suffer thy mouth cause thy flesh sin; neither say thou angel, [was] error: wherefore god angry thy voice, destroy work thine hands? multitude dreams many words [there are] also [divers] vanities: fear thou god. thou seest oppression poor, violent perverting judgment justice province, marvel matter: [he is] higher highest regardeth; [there be] higher they. moreover profit earth all: king [himself] served field. loveth silver shall satisfied silver; loveth abundance increase: [is] also vanity. goods increase, increased eat them: good [is there] owners thereof, saving beholding [of them] eyes? sleep labouring man [is] sweet, whether eat little much: abundance rich suffer sleep. sore evil [which] seen sun, [namely,] riches kept owners thereof hurt. riches perish evil travail: begetteth son, [there is] nothing hand. came forth mother's womb, naked shall return go came, shall take nothing labour, may carry away hand. also [is] sore evil, [that] points came, shall go: profit hath hath laboured wind? days also eateth darkness, [he hath] much sorrow wrath sickness. behold [that] seen: [it is] good comely [for one] eat drink, enjoy good labour taketh sun days life, god giveth him: [is] portion. every man also god hath given riches wealth, hath given power eat thereof, take portion, rejoice labour; [is] gift god. shall much remember days life; god answereth [him] joy heart. evil seen sun, [is] common among men: man god hath given riches, wealth, honour, wanteth nothing soul desireth, yet god giveth power eat thereof, stranger eateth it: [is] vanity, [is] evil disease. man beget hundred [children,] live many years, days years many, soul filled good, also [that] burial; say, [that] untimely birth [is] better he. cometh vanity, departeth darkness, name shall covered darkness. moreover hath seen sun, known [any thing:] hath rest other.page 409 ecclesiastes yea, though live thousand years twice [told,] yet hath seen good: go one place? labour man [is] mouth, yet appetite filled. hath wise fool? hath poor, knoweth walk living? better [is] sight eyes wandering desire: [is] also vanity vexation spirit. hath named already, known [is] man: neither may contend mightier he. seeing many things increase vanity, [is] man better? knoweth [is] good man [this] life, days vain life spendeth shadow? tell man shall sun? good name [is] better precious ointment; day death day one's birth. [it is] better go house mourning, go house feasting: end men; living lay [it] heart. sorrow [is] better laughter: sadness countenance heart made better. heart wise [is] house mourning; heart fools [is] house mirth. [it is] better hear rebuke wise, man hear song fools. crackling thorns pot, [is] laughter fool: also [is] vanity. surely oppression maketh wise man mad; gift destroyeth heart. better [is] end thing beginning thereof: [and] patient spirit [is] better proud spirit. hasty thy spirit angry: anger resteth bosom fools. say thou, [the cause] former days better these? thou dost enquire wisely concerning this. wisdom [is] good inheritance: [by is] profit see sun. wisdom [is] defence, [and] money [is] defence: excellency knowledge [is, that] wisdom giveth life it. consider work god: make [that] straight, hath made crooked? day prosperity joyful, day adversity consider: god also hath set one other, end man find nothing him. [things] seen days vanity: [man] perisheth righteousness, wicked [man] prolongeth [his life] wickedness. righteous much; neither make thyself wise: shouldest thou destroy thyself? much wicked, neither thou foolish: shouldest thou die thy time? [it is] good thou shouldest take hold this; yea, also withdraw thine hand: feareth god shall come forth all. wisdom strengtheneth wise ten mighty [men] city. [there is] man upon earth, doeth good, sinneth not. also take heed unto words spoken; lest thou hear thy servant curse thee: oftentimes also thine heart knoweth thou thyself likewise hast cursed others. far off, exceeding deep, find out? applied mine heart know, search, seek wisdom, reason [of things,] know wickedness folly, even foolishness [and] madness: find bitter death woman, whose heart [is] snares nets, [and] hands [as] bands: whoso pleaseth god shall escape her; sinner shall taken her. behold, found, saith preacher, [counting] one one, find account: yet soul seeketh, find not: one man among thousand found; woman among found. lo, found, god hath made man upright; sought many inventions. [there is] man hath power spirit retain spirit; neither [hath he] power day death: [there is] discharge [that] war; neither shall wickedness deliver given it. seen, applied heart unto every work done sun: [there is] time wherein one man ruleth another hurt. saw wicked buried, come gone place holy, forgotten city done: [is] also vanity. sentence evil work executed speedily, therefore heart sons men fully set evil. though sinner evil hundred times, [days] prolonged, yet surely know shall well fear god, fear him: shall well wicked, neither shall prolong [his] days, [which are] shadow; feareth god. vanity done upon earth; [men,] unto happeneth according work wicked; again, wicked [men,] happeneth according work righteous: said also [is] vanity. commended mirth, man hath better thing sun, eat, drink, merry: shall abide labour days life, god giveth sun. applied mine heart know wisdom, see business done upon earth: (for also [there that] neither day night seeth sleep eyes:) beheld work god, man cannot find work done sun: though man labour seek [it] out, yet shall find [it;] yea further; though wise [man] think know [it,] yet shall able find [it.ecclesiastes page 410 ] considered heart even declare this, righteous, wise, works, hand god: man knoweth either love hatred [by] [that is] them. [things come] alike all: [there is] one event righteous, wicked; good clean, unclean; sacrificeth, sacrificeth not: [is] good, [is] sinner; [and] sweareth, [he] feareth oath. [is] evil among [things] done sun, [there is] one event unto all: yea, also heart sons men full evil, madness heart live, [they go] dead. joined living hope: living dog better dead lion. living know shall die: dead know thing, neither reward; memory forgotten. also love, hatred, envy, perished; neither portion ever [thing] done sun. go thy way, eat thy bread joy, drink thy wine merry heart; god accepteth thy works. let thy garments always white; let thy head lack ointment. live joyfully wife thou lovest days life thy vanity, hath given thee sun, days thy vanity: [is] thy portion [this] life, thy labour thou takest sun. whatsoever thy hand findeth do, [it] thy might; [there is] work, device, knowledge, wisdom, grave, whither thou goest. returned, saw sun, race [is] swift, battle strong, neither yet bread wise, yet riches men understanding, yet favour men skill; time chance happeneth all. man also knoweth time: fishes taken evil net, birds caught snare; [are] sons men snared evil time, falleth suddenly upon them. wisdom seen also sun, [seemed] great unto me: [there was] little city, men within it; came great king it, besieged it, built great bulwarks it: found poor wise man, wisdom delivered city; yet man remembered poor man. said i, wisdom [is] better strength: nevertheless poor man's wisdom [is] despised, words heard. words wise [men are] heard quiet cry ruleth among fools. wisdom [is] better weapons war: one sinner destroyeth much good. dead flies cause ointment apothecary send forth stinking savour: [so doth] little folly reputation wisdom [and] honour. wise man's heart [is] right hand; fool's heart left. yea also, fool walketh way, wisdom faileth [him,] saith every one [that] [is] fool. spirit ruler rise thee, leave thy place; yielding pacifieth great offences. evil [which] seen sun, error [which] proceedeth ruler: folly set great dignity, rich sit low place. diggeth pit shall fall it; whoso breaketh hedge, serpent shall bite him. whoso removeth stones shall hurt therewith; [and] cleaveth wood shall endangered thereby. iron blunt, whet edge, must put strength: wisdom [is] profitable direct. surely serpent bite without enchantment; babbler better. words wise man's mouth [are] gracious; lips fool swallow himself. beginning words mouth [is] foolishness: end talk [is] mischievous madness. fool also full words: man cannot tell shall be; shall him, tell him? labour foolish wearieth every one them, knoweth go city. woe thee, land, thy king [is] child, thy princes eat morning! blessed [art] thou, land, thy king [is] son nobles, thy princes eat due season, strength, drunkenness! much slothfulness building decayeth; idleness hands house droppeth through. feast made laughter, wine maketh merry: money answereth [things. ] curse king, thy thought; curse rich thy bedchamber: bird air shall carry voice, hath wings shall tell matter. cast thy bread upon waters: thou shalt find many days. give portion seven, also eight; thou knowest evil shall upon earth. clouds full rain, empty [themselves] upon earth: tree fall toward south, toward north, place tree falleth, shall be. observeth wind shall sow; regardeth clouds shall reap. thou knowest [is] way spirit, [nor] bones [do grow] womb child: even thou knowest works god maketh all. morning sow thy seed, evening withhold thine hand: thou knowest whether shall prosper, either that, whether [shall be] alike good. truly light [is] sweet, pleasant [thing is] eyes behold sun: man live many years, [and] rejoice all; yet let remember days darkness; shall many. cometh [is] vanity. rejoice, young man, thy youth; let thy heart cheer thee days thy youth, walk ways thine heart, sight thine eyes: know thou, [things] god bring thee judgment. therefore remove sorrow thy heart, put away evil thy flesh: childhood youth [are] vanity. remember thy creator days thy youth, evil days come not, years draw nigh, thou shalt say, pleasure them; sun, light, moon, stars, darkened, clouds return rain:page 411 ecclesiastes day keepers house shall tremble, strong men shall bow themselves, grinders cease few, look windows darkened, doors shall shut streets, sound grinding low, shall rise voice bird, daughters musick shall brought low; also [when] shall afraid [that is] high, fears [shall be] way, almond tree shall flourish, grasshopper shall burden, desire shall fail: man goeth long home, mourners go streets: ever silver cord loosed, golden bowl broken, pitcher broken fountain, wheel broken cistern. shall dust return earth was: spirit shall return unto god gave it. vanity vanities, saith preacher; [is] vanity. moreover, preacher wise, still taught people knowledge; yea, gave good heed, sought out, [and] set order many proverbs. preacher sought find acceptable words: [that was] written [was] upright, [even] words truth. words wise [are] goads, nails fastened masters assemblies, [which] given one shepherd. further, these, son, admonished: making many books [there is] end; much study [is] weariness flesh. let us hear conclusion whole matter: fear god, keep commandments: [is] whole [duty] man. god shall bring every work judgment, every secret thing, whether [it be] good, whether [it be] evil.page 413 song songs song solomon let kiss kisses mouth: thy love [is] better wine. savour thy good ointments thy name [is as] ointment poured forth, therefore virgins love thee. draw me, run thee: king hath brought chambers: glad rejoice thee, remember thy love wine: upright love thee. murderers. thy silver become dross, thy wine mixed water: thy princes [are] rebellious, companions thieves: every one loveth gifts, followeth rewards: judge fatherless, neither doth cause widow come unto them. therefore saith lord, lord hosts, mightyone israel, ah, ease mine adversaries, avenge mine enemies: turn hand upon thee, purely purge away thy dross, take away thy tin: restore thy judges first, thy counsellors beginning: afterward thou shalt called, city righteousness, faithful city. zion shall redeemed judgment, converts righteousness. destruction transgressors sinners [shall be] together, forsake lord shall consumed. shall ashamed oaks ye desired, ye shall confounded gardens ye chosen. ye shall oak whose leaf fadeth, garden hath water. strong shall tow, maker spark, shall burn together, none shall quench [them. ] word isaiah son amoz saw concerning judah jerusalem. shall come pass last days, [that] mountain lord's house shall established top mountains, shall exalted hills;
